description:
We went here for a team event, 10 folks. The ambience is very warm and the place feels classy. If it was closer to my house, I'd do at least one anniversary or a birthday here.

I got the grilled lamb chops and they were impeccably cooked. I asked for medium cooked (the other option is medium rare). The meat was soft and moist and the mediterranean herbs were perfectly blended in the meat.

I also tasted the moussaka and it was delicious. Reminded me of indian goat kheema, I have relished in the past. 

We ordered some good wines (forgot their names :)) and the appetizers were yummy. 

This place is a must visit for a meat lover, food lover, however you classify yourself.
author: Roger M.

description:
True gem of a place that boasts of cozy feels, within a classy abode and extremely friendly staff. 

Food: delicious - I don't think there is anything  not worth tasting from the menu. If you bring your Own vino, you'll only pay 25$ for corkage! Do try  the riblets and stuffed kalamari from the appi menu. You won't regret it.
author: Ewa U.

description:
Kokkari, where do I even begin?  This is one of the absolute best restaurants in the city, if you have never tried it I recommend you change that as soon as possible. 

I used to take clients all the time for lunch, especially when it was hard to get someone out of the office and then you name drop Kokkari and all of a sudden you have a full table.

EVERYTHING on this menu is PHENOMENAL! :) My mouth is watering just writing this, the fried cheese is a fan favorite and if you like cheese how could you go wrong?  The hummus and spreads are pretty good, I must admit though that I do not like their hummus but the green dip (Maybe spanakopita) with the feta is  TO DIE FOR.  I normally order the chicken Slavonkia (I think how you spell it) and get the other dip as my side instead of what it came with which I definitely recommend.

They normally change the apps and specials (which they have soooo many amazing fish dishes and they come out as a full fish and they can de-bone it for you upon request). The salads have always been tasty in my opinion too.

They don't have too many vegetarian dishes, but you can definitely make it work. They have a ravioli and some of the shared apps and sides and salads definitely provide enough options but it would be a shame because the meat they serve is fantastic.  The Lamb Chops are out of this world, everyone raves about them and they are definitely the best in the city.  The lamb burger is great as well.

I personally love the Turkish coffee and they have good desserts although I normally try to avoid them at that point because I am so full from everything else.  Very Reliable spot for work dinners, events and for friends and family in town, dates etc.  It has a romantic environment but can be hard to get a reservation if you do not book in advance. What are you waiting for? Kokkari is everything... :)
author: Ellie J.

description:
Been to the Palo Alto location so needed to try this place. 
Came here for a business meeting last night and boy it was packed for a Monday night!!
Maybe because Dreamforce convention was going on...
Wasn't feeling that hungry as it was already Kate for dinner- 8pm meeting so I just ordered some appetizers for myself. 
Ofcourse I was just eye hungry, but no worries took the rest home. 
Ordered zucchini cakes, lamb riblets, artichoke and eggplant skewer and grilled squid with feta cheese. 
Everything was delish. Lamb riblets still my favorite. Enjoyed it with a glass of cab sauv from Kitts Napa Valley. 
Make reservations as this place is always packed. 
Trust!!!
author: Claudine V.

description:
Received phenomenal service here as our server made every type of accommodation for my food allergies. Upon discovering my food restrictions, our server asked the chef to circle anything on the menu I could have and had alternate suggestions for dressings of certain salad dressings. 

The entire night, our server paid extra attention to remind me of what I could and couldn't eat. Often times, he'd serve me first before everyone, while reminding me of the substitutions they've prepared for me. 

Of all establishments, this has by far been the most attentive to my allergy needs and I am so incredibly impressed. They've completely exceeded my expectations. 

And everything worked smoothly the entire night! No allergic reactions whatsoever! 

Food was amazing, ambiance was on point, and we lucked out on free street parking (yay for having a late reservation!) right outside the restaurant. I'd say that's a good formula for future visits.
author: Jackie O.

description:
We love Kokkari. Hadn't been there in about a year and snagged a table for a Monday night. They take reservations two (yes 2!) months in advance. If you want a table plan ahead. Otherwise get there early and sit at the bar. You will still spend the same money sitting at the bar so I'd recommend a table. 

Monday night the place was booming. Jammed. Great vibe. My wife and I spent 3 weeks in Greece late June early July and we longed for authentic Greek food besides what I turn out of my own kitchen. So we went. In general it was excellent. Not a "5" but a strong 4. So why wasn't it a 5?

First, the restaurant is lovely inside. Tons of money spent to a high standard designed to look like you're in an upscale restaurant in Athens (Grand Bretagne). But it's not overdone or flashy - very tasteful. Great vibe and hostess, servers, all others very attentive.

Second, the food. I can't say much more than my fellow Yelpers have already. Yes, try the lamb, try the chicken ( it's not just Chicken it's Greek Chicken Served with tasty orzo and fasolikia, Greek style green beans. Yum. Try almost any appetizer- try 3-or 4 they aren't big portions though they aren't priced as small. So was looking forward to the octopus-- usually done with olive oil, garlic, S&P.
A bummer because for $17 we got a chewy rubbery dish. Ugh and unbecoming a restaurant of this caliber. If they can't get the good stuff they should not sell it. Period. ( if you're in NYC go to Kellari Grill on W 44th between 5th and 6th. None better ever. They fly it in every day from Greece.)

Next--the Moussaka was dense, heavy, the bechamel sauce was as think as mashed potatoes. The base which is always potato was way too thick - the eggplant almost non existent. 

And they still got a 4? Yup. Cause everything else was stellar. So bottom line- do not order Moussaka or octopus-- not that big a deal. You'll love the place. 

Extensive and Expensive wine list. Fantastic selection of world wines including local
Napa favorites. Ask your server where he/she thinks the values are -/ they know. 

Desserts-- the loukoumades ( little doughnuts) are to die for. The Baklava is good. Not great. In all of Greece you order and get a large piece that's dripping in honey, butter, loaded with walnuts --
This version was a little dry. 

The "nits" are just the things that kept it from getting the top score. Not a reason not to go.
author: Greg C.

description:
This meal was incredible. We got:

- octopus - cooked perfectly
- saganaki - wow so good
- lamp chops - definitely order them medium rare, they were amazing
- pork rotti - this actually needed a bit of salt and was a little underwhelming, will try the fish instead next time

Service was incredible, ambiance is amazing, loved the fact that they have a pretty low corkage fee of $25 so we could bring in one of our favorite bottles. Even the bread and olive oil they brought out in the beginning was amazing.

The only tiny complaint I have is that it was my birthday and I wish they would have given us a dessert on the house, but they at least put a candle and wrote happy birthday on the plate :)
author: Shabnam E.

description: One of the very best places to dine in San Francisco. I love this place. All the dishes are delicious. You can't go wrong with any of their dishes.
author: Lisa F.

description: What a fantastic meal! We were overwhelmed by the appetizers, so we decided to satisfy our cravings with a tapas style dinner. Everything was delicious, and we sampled the octopus, spanakopita, taramasalata, salad and the sautéed shrimp, which was to die for. Nice selection of wines, and the bread was good. Service was top notch. Couldn't have been better!
author: Dimitri V.

description:
Came here last night with 3 others for dinner and it was delicious despite the fact that I'm recovering from a cold and my taste buds/sense of smell are a little off. 

Ambiance: 3/5: Definitely loud and a bit busy. Constantly people walking around and getting up, moving around, coming and going, but nicely lit place with homey decor. There's a fireplace-looking rotisserie in the back that happened to be radiating just a little bit too much heat though so it was toasty in there (I thought my fever was back until I checked in with the others who were also warm).

Food: 4/5: Food was very impressive. Everything was fresh, with interesting textures and flavors. Here's what we ordered:
- Octopus: Really good, but just a bit tough for my liking. served with lemon
- Saghanaki: Basically, a thin layer of ooey gooey, pan-fried cheese. Delicious. Perfect with the table bread and peppers
- Peppers: i think this was the special of the evening, shishito peppers that were flavorful and cooked perfectly.
- Grilled whole branzino: amazing. Perfectly seasoned and grilled; found a few bones but that's to be expected, just eat carefully. 
- Lamb Chops: SO good. I agree with the other reviews on here that these were not gamey at all and didn't even really taste like lamb. More of a fatty steak. Got them on the rare side and they were tender, juicy and amazing. 
- Baklava and Baklava ice cream were pretty good but nothing amazing.

Service: 5/5: waitress was attentive and friendly, explained the specials, made recommendations, and kept our glasses filled with delicious greek white wine. 

Highly recommend!
author: Priyanka C.

description: It was the best restaurant that I ever have seen! A nice looking restaurant inside and out,and very comfortable seating. We were overwhelmed by the appetizers, so we decided to satisfy our cravings with a tapas style dinner. Everything was delicious! Thank you so much for amazing food and service!
author: Elena L.

description: One of the best Greek restaurants in America.  Knowledgeable staff, beautiful surrounding, authentic Greek food, well executed by highly skilled kitchen.  This place elevates the well-know Greek staples like mousaka, lamb chops, grilled whole fish of the day, to the highest level.  Menu also has items one might find only in certain regions of Greece, marithes (pan fried smelt) sountzoukakia (ground beef/lamb meatballs in tomato sauce with garlic and cumin) and penerli (Greek "calzone" with Greek cheese) all superb.  Daily rotisserie changes often, chicken and duck last time we ate here.  Fine Greek desserts, and Greek coffee prepared on heated sand (havali) Don't miss this place if you can get reservations.  If not, consider eating at the bar.  Extensive wine list.  After 2 decades, this place is still going strong.
author: Angelo S.

description:
Alright. 
So... this was my bucket list restaurant. It's THAT restaurant... You know the one that everyone has been talking about for years and you kind of start to think "I need to do this before its too late..." 
I'm just mad I waited so long! 
This is definitely fine dining. There is no two ways about this. You should make reservations well in advance. 
I went on a Thursday night, 10 pm and it was busy! 
We ordered 3 appetizers, each one of them better than the other. 
The wine list was very impressive! 
But it's the main course that stole me heart... or stomach! I ordered their lamb shanks. It was by far the best lamb I've eaten in my many years of eating! 
I am salivating as I think about the flavors of the meat! It was so simple, it was out of the world! 
We ended the dinner with their baklava ice cream! Yumm! Is an understatement! 

Be sure to check this gem out!
author: Snneha N.

description:
Good food. Hands down. 

If you're deciding on whether or not to come here, no discussion is needed. Just do it!

This is the second time I've been here and the atmosphere, the food, the service, everything is absolutely top notch. 

Between my wife and I we got the fig, olive, and goat cheese pita appetizer, a peach salad (special), lamb moussaka, and duck breast (rotisserie special)

To finish it off we each had a glass of wine, galaktoboureko (filled filo), and Loukomadas (donuts)

Everything we had tasted AMAZING! 

We will be back again!!!
author: Richard F.

description:
You begin your experience as soon as you walk into this old world, romantic space. 

Our waiter deserves at least a 100 stars. A man who knows his restaurant, the food, the kitchen, the wines and his guests. He was personable, professional, humorous and perfect with his recommendations. The only problem was that I wanted everything he described because he did it so well.

The food was as expected, spectacular. The highlights for me were the whole branzino, the octopus, the sea urchin and their homemade spearmint chocolate chip ice cream. I don't normally eat ice cream but another person at our table wanted it and no else did so I told her I'd have some. It was like no other mint chocolate chip ice cream I ever had. I feel that it needs another name like Heavenly Elegant Subtle Mint Chocolate Chip Perfection.

This was a special dining experience.
author: Anne P.

description:
I had a wonderful dining experience.  This is a spacious restaurant with great service and care.  Come, splurge and dine.   This restaurant is packed and you'll need to reserve a month ahead.  
Great seating arrangements for all numbers.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I really love this place. Once I found parking, the rest was a breeze. The ambiance was nice. I liked the old rustic feel. 

Honestly, I felt the prices on the entrees were a bit steep. Now I am in no way implying that it took my whole wallet, however, I did feel for the type of food it was a tad bit high.  So to give you an idea, an appetizer, soup and entree, wine, dessert and tip was well over 135.00 per person, so I would not be able to justify paying this all the time. 

So all that said, if money is not an object to pay for excellent Greek food, small to moderate portions, than this is the place. You have took at it more like, you are paying for the great chefs, the servers and the ambiance and decent food.
author: Joey V.

description: This place is really nice ! Serves delicious food , I got the lemon herbed chicken and it was so moist and delish. Cooked to perfection. It's also really busy. I would definitely come back and recommend everyone to try this place !
author: Cristina V.

description:
Made a reservation for dinner the other night and managed to secure a table a couple weeks ahead via OpenTable. Was greeted warmly by the receptionist upon arrival and presented my table.

Staff throughout the meal was fantastic. Courteous, professional, and non-intrusive.

Interestingly enough, the olive oil came upon request with the bread and didn't contain the darker sauce with the oil like at Evvia. 

Started off with the octopus and it was excellent as usual, although the portions were a touch on the smaller side. Flavors were excellent and the octopus was tender and non-rubbery.

Highlight of the meal is always the lamb chops that are cooked a perfect medium rare. Super tender and flavorful, always a hit!

Ended off the meal with my favorite dessert with the filo dough with custard on the inside! I'm not a fan of pistachio ice cream though!

~$95/head after tax and gratuity for dinner.

Parking is plentiful in the private lot across the street!
author: Derek S.

description:
My Friday tradition is to celebrate the start of the weekend by eating a fantastic meal - either at a pop-up or at one of the great dining spots in SF. Kokkari certainly counts as the latter and I was really looking forward to this meal. 

Whenever I go to a Mediterranean restaurant, the two things I typically order are octopus and lamb chops.  Both were available here and both were just perfect.  A virgin mojito provided the perfect pairing for the appetizer and the entree. 

Dessert was shredded filo dough with semolina, creme fraiche, vanilla, honey and pistachio (it's one of their specials that night).  I also ordered the lemon verbena mint tea to end the meal. 

Overall, this was a really wonderful experience.  Definitely deserves the spot as one of SF's top 100. The meal was well-paced, the ambiance is really nice and service was just impeccable.  Including tax and a good tip, the above meal was about $120. Well worth it. Highly recommended and I will definitely come back here.
author: Andrew S.

description:
The restaurant has a warm, inviting interior with a lot of rustic wood finishes.   Service was good but based on the rave reviews I expected it to be great.   Small things, but I had high expectations - we sat for a few minutes before anyone came to the table, my husband's ice tea glass remained empty for too long, etc.    And was the bread supposed to come with olive oil for dipping?  Not at our table.  

We started with the Eggplant & Artichoke Skewer.   I loved this dish and wished I had not shared it with my husband (LOL).  For my entrée I had the Halibut which was good but not memorable.   My husband had the Lamb Chops.  They were tender and flavorful.   The waiter and the manager were very attentive when it appeared my husband was not happy with the way they were cooked (one of the chops was a little overcooked).  They definitely wanted to make sure it was 'right'.  Despite the fact that my husband said it was fine, the manager made an adjustment to the bill  (top marks for wanting to ensure the customer was happy).
author: Diane W.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday and after months of anticipation the experience fell short. 

Service: spectacular 

Food: lamb-it was okay, nothing more than that
           Grilled octopus- it was good
           Musaka- not the best, I've had better
           Cocktails- not worth the money

The reason I am giving this place 3 stars is for the service.
author: Tuuyen N.

description:
Very nice place with great service. We had a reservation at 8:30 but weren't seated until 9, but we were given pita and spreads on the house. And again, the service was great. They really went above and beyond.

Menu is kind of small (one page) but everything looks good. We got octapodaki tou yiorgou (octopus), fish of the day (branzino), and arnisia paidakia (lamb chops). For dessert we got the loukoumades (doughnuts). Everything was delicious and filling for the three of us.
author: Mika S.

description: Kokkari is hands down one of my absolute favourite restaurants. Reservations are highly recommended because they are usually fully booked. The service is always phenomenal no matter how busy the restaurant is (and believe me, it's ALWAYS busy). They offer a delicious sour dough bread and olive oil dip pre-meal to get the gastric juices flowing. I recommend the grilled octopus to start. It's flavourful, tender and perfectly cooked. I am extremely partial towards their grilled lamb chops with surprisingly delicious potato wedges. It is always cooked to perfection and I've never been disappointed. My boyfriend typically goes with the lamb shank which is so tender that it requires nothing more than a gentle piercing of your fork to pull the meat apart and off the bone. They have a very extensive wine list to satisfy any taste bud or budget and they accommodate BYOB with a $20-25 corkage fee. I would most definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for top quality food with insanely amazing service in San Francisco!
author: Oyeyimika O.

description:
What a disappointment. I had been waiting to go here for months, could never get a reservation, and finally was able to schedule one when my mom was visiting from New York. It was my mom's first time in SF so I purposefully chose this restaurant to create a special experience with delicious food for my mom. Unfortunately, we were extremely let down. 

Not only was the food bland and unmemorable, to top it off, we had one of the worst servers I've experienced. He was moody, seemed uninterested in our experience and rushed us through the entire meal. We even had to ask him to introduce himself. The longest he was at our table was when we was trying to upsell us on a bottle of wine or telling us about what a hard and sad life he has had.

For or meals, we started off with the taramosalata and the octapapodaki tou yiorgou. I was not impressed with either of these dishes. The octopus was chewy and in flavorful. We were hoping the disappointing appetizers was a fluke and our main entrees would shine through. My mom got the ippoglossa, I got the makaronia and my boyfriend got kotopoulo souvla. Of our meals, the kotopoulo souvla was the most flavorful. Other than that, the halibut and ravioli were OK. Our dining experience was mediocre and we did not receive the caliber of food or service we were expecting.

I have no idea how this place has such great reviews. I will not be returning.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Not sure why I took so long to come here.  Maybe I had spent all those years working for a Greek company that I  didnt want to tarnish my tastebuds.

Well I came here for a birthday celebration with 7 others and were seated in the back area by the kitchen.  The Maitre'D was very attentive and even offered to move our table but we were fine.  We brought our own bottles which entails  a $20 corkage fee.

Personally I am all about the lamb so the lamb souvlaki was easily my choice.  We had a number of appetizers which were all great. I remember the eggplant being extra special and stayed way from the lamb appetizers which everyone seemed to enjoy.  I wanted to let everyone else enjoy the lamb.  

My old boss who was a Greek chef had always said that if a Greek restaurant didnt serve good lamb, it wasnt a good Greek restaurant.  Everyone laughed at me when I started as I didn't say another word til I finished.  The lamb was perfect.  Tender and flavorful along with the tzatziki I was in my own world!

I was so full but someone convinced me to share the Kokkari Sundae which is great if you like a traditional sundae.

Only bad thing I have to say is that the bathrooms are downstairs by elevator. At the end of the night I was caught in a stinky and dirty elevator with all their trash and recyclables.  Blechh!
author: Erik H.

description:
Pretty tender lamb chops and good service! 
Ordered calamari and we thought would be deep fried (we didn't read the details so our fault), but it does not taste good :-(, also a bit confused about the number of lamb chops you get, I see most of the yelp's review photos have 3 and I only got 2, maybe is lunch? A bit pricy for lunch 35 just for the lamb chops and the portion is a bit small - 2 chops and 3 potato wedges, nothing more and nothing less on the plate.
author: Jay Y.

description:
I've been here for lunch a few times and it never disappoints. It's also much easier to get a reservation for lunch last minute than it is to get a dinner reservation. Great food, service and ambiance. I prefer to sit in the main dining room where you can look into the open kitchen. 

I recommend the zucchini cakes and assortment of humus with pita bread as an appetizer. The grilled lamb chops are amazing.
author: Mehul S.

description: Simply spectacular...as if you are exported to the Mediterranean! Worth every penny for the meal. The wine list was extensive but it's hard to find a bottle under $100.
author: Steffanie S.

description:
Although it may not make the list of the trendiest, hippest, newest restaurants, Kokkari remains one of the timeless, classic restaurants of San Francisco. When the earthquake hits and all these restaurants are leveled, I'd bet a decade from the quake people will be like, man, remember Kokkari? Best restaurant in SF. All of these other cool restaurants will be an afterthought or forgotten entirely.

Be prepared to have the best Mediterranean food you will have in California, possibly the U.S? Preparation and execution are to the highest caliber. Seasoning, temperature, texture, everything is just buttoned down and on another level than anywhere you've ever been.

I've been a few times over several years but standout items are the duck confit dolmades and the goat stew. I've also tried a couple lamb and fish dishes which were very good, but I don't recall them as specifically as I do the above dishes. They have a robust wine list that will match any aspiring sommeliers tastes.

The only thing is that Kokkari is that to me, is not particularly approachable. There are a lot of old rich people. The restaurant is always busy, and service, though attentive, is very formal.

It is still, without a doubt, one of the best milestone / celebration restaurants in the city and I will forever recommend it.
author: Peter T.

description:
At last. After hearing many good things about Kokkari (yep we're now on a first name basis didn't you know), I finally decided to take the leap to see and taste for myself. And it did not disappoint. It now has a special place in my heart and here's why: the ambiance, the food, and the attentive staff. Please feel free to read on for more deets

The soft glow from the lamps scattered restaurant-wide, oriental rugs under sturdy wooden tables, upholstered chairs which conveniently hid my monstrosity of a dufflebag, & ginormous bread getting toasty by the fireplace-turned roaster, which in turn rotated glossy, yummy-smelling proteins, contributed to the lush and cozy atmosphere. 

I decided to order 4 Mezethes (small plates) and 1 Dessert: *Pantzaria beet salad (red beets, Greek yogurt, dill, olive oil, green onions, and chopped pistachio nuts), Soutzoukakia lamb meatballs, *Kolokithoukeftethes zucchini cakes (crispy exterior with flavorful shredded zucchini interior, I wish I knew the spices used -it was that good), *Octapodaki tou Yiorgou octopus (boiled, blanched, and grilled for a perfect, tender bite), sweet corn salad (sweet corn, dill, feta, and arugula), and baklava and praline ice cream. The items with the asterisks were my favorites. 

My friend had left dinner early for a concert & I decided to stay awhile alone in a restaurant by myself (yes, you heard right ALONE as in table for 1). Those yummy leftovers wouldn't be able to eat themselves, now would they? And, after learning that my friend would be leaving, the host encouraged me to stay until I was ready & that there was no need to rush. The initial fear of what others might think of my eating by myself eventually turned into a giddiness of being able to check an item off the bucket list earlier than I expected. In my effort to truly relish this opportunity of eating alone, I thought about all the things I was thankful for in that moment in time. The food, the warmth from sitting fireside, and the lovely sanctuary that Kokkari provided. 

After having had such a heart-warming meal, I was then ushered out by a "Goodnight" and that he'd hoped I would visit again. Yes, I certainly will.
author: P C.

description:
Took a long walk to get here and it was well worth it!

The food - a medley of Greek and Mediterranean flavors. Most unusual dish was a fried cheese that was served sizzling hot. Possibly my favorite savory. The potato dish was a bit disappointing, while the salad absolutely hit the spot, fresh and crunchy. A fava bean dish was okay, it's flavors reminding me of a lasagna without the noodles. 

Ambience - darkened interiors would suggest romantic but during daytime hours felt more comforting and cozy. The u-shaped booth took some sliding of the butt to to get situated but thankfully our server pulled it out so we could slip in and out.

Service -- our waiter was knowledgeable but not pretentious. Everything he recommended was spot on. He was attentive but not hovering which made for an unhurried and relaxing meal.

Price -- on the high side but worth the calories and cost.

Wouldn't typically mention the bathroom, but here we had to take an elevator down to the basement to get there. Well, it really was like a cellar and the bathroom decor was elegant yet homey and cozy all at once.

Bottom line, great find by my friend Laurie who choose this place!
author: Sharon H.

description:
I've been wanting to try Kokkari for what feels like forever. Problem is, finding a reservation for a normal dinner time without much notice is near impossible. (I'm not the best at committing.) Finally, on Friday, February 23rd, I came here for a friend's birthday. I believe he made reservations about six weeks prior for our party of six at 10pm.

*Meat Dolmathes - grape leaves stuffed with lamb, rice, dill & mint ($16)
*Kolokithokeftethes - crispy zucchini cakes with cucumber & mint-yogurt dressing ($12.25)
*Spanakotiropita - traditional filo pies of spinach, feta, leeks & dill ($10.25)
*Octapodaki tou Yiorgou - grilled octopus with lemon, oregano & olive oil ($17.75)
*Garides Skordates - wood-oven roasted prawns with feta butter & Kalamata olives ($17.25)
*Soutzoukakia - grilled lamb meatballs with spiced tomato sauce & Greek yogurt ($14.35)
*Psari Psito - traditional grilled whole fish with horta & lemon, Lavraki - Sea Bass ($47)
*Ippoglossa - halibut steak pan roasted with black lentil salata, roasted grapes, artichokes & pomegranate ($38.25)
*Arnisia Paidakia - grilled lamb chops with lemon-oregano vinaigrette & Kokkari potatoes ($47.50)
*Goat Stew Special ($38)

My favorite dish, hands down, was the rack of lamb. Super meaty and flavorful. Even the bday boy who doesn't like lamb enjoyed all the lamb dishes at Kokkari. (I guess he finds it too gamey.) I also adored the octopus and prawns. The octopus was tender with a nice chew. The head on prawns were great for sucking. I do love them delicious head juices. The sauce was also amazing. Great for bread dipping. I'm not eating deep fried foods right now, so I couldn't try the zucchini cakes. Everyone seemed to enjoy them though. They start the meal with complimentary bread and special olive oil from Crete, which is a treat.

*Baklava - Traditional walnut & honey baklava with vanilla-praline ice cream ($10.50)
*Galaktoboureko - Semolina custard in filo with fresh Meyer lemon spoon sweet & pistachio ice cream ($10.75)
*Loukoumades - Traditional Greek doughnuts with honey, cinnamon & walnuts ($10)
*Rye Manhattan: up ($13.50) x2
*Old Fashioned ($12.50) x3
*Bulleit Rye ($12)
*Turley, Old Vines Zinfandel, California '15 ($52 bottle)
*Graham's 10 year Tawny Port ($12)
*Blandy's Malmsey Madeira 10 Year ($13)
*Fonseca 20 Year Tawny ($15)
*Greek Coffee - Stone-ground coffee heated over hot sand, Sketo for no sugar ($6)

We all started with one cocktail each for the apps and then had a bottle of red to share with our mains. I believe the sommelier helped us pick out the zin as we weren't sure what to order. It worked perfectly with our mixture of meat and fish as we had one in our party who wasn't eating meat. Dessert was a sweet treat. I couldn't eat some of it since it was deep fried, but the baklava was definitely tasty. I adored the ice cream. I got the 10 year tawny port to pair which I enjoyed.

Such an awesome spot for a birthday celebration. Between the food, the service, and the drinks, I was amazed. So glad I finally tried out this spot!
author: Elena N.

description:
I was in town for business and this restaurant came highly recommended by one of my coworkers from the area. 

The ambiance is cozy with a soft lighting. Its perfect for a special occasion, date night, girls night or business dinner.

Service was great! I sat at the bar but the bartender did a great job of keeping my glass full and providing amazing food recommendations.

Appetizer: crispy zucchini cakes. You are served two so make sure if you're with a larger party to order a couple of these. 

Entree: I decided to be adventurous and try their special - goat stew with orzo, artichoke and feta. There are hints of cinnamon so it's a little on the sweeter side. If you've never had goat, it's a little Gamey but full of flavor. Definitely worth trying!

Dessert: while I wasn't in love with the  Galaktoboureko, I loved the pistachio ice cream. It and actual pistachios in it. If you're looking for a Greek dish other than baklava, it's a nice option.
author: Maria P.

description:
I had a great dining experience at Kokkari. The food was amazing and the vibes were nice. 

I love the fresh fish and meatballs. Their bread is also very good. My favorite was ending with the Sundae. YUM!
author: Tina L.

description:
Best part of this spot is it's a beautiful restaurant and the moussaka is incredible. 

I'd probably put it at a 3.5

The lack of cocktail list sucks and our "house" cocktails were pretty weak. 

We had a reservation and we're still seated close to 30 min after, so 830pm on a Thursday. We're new parents, it was our one night out and we had reservations; 30 min is a long time to wait. Not to mention the bar area is full and crowded so waiting there wasn't an option. 

The lamb is delicious but at $40ish, pretty pricey. The fish although cooked well and a nice piece, was not good, topped with a tomato sauce and olives. Personally, I just didn't think all the flavors meshed well.

The apps were good, nothing to write home about, but enjoyed. The pita with the dip was amazing, another order of pita costs you $4. 

The donuts for dessert were delicious! 

We wrote in our reservation and I also told the hostess it was my husbands birthday and they did nothing. That, plus seating us close to 30 min after our rez, kind of not the best customer service. 

The place is beautiful, and the food is good, but the popularity detracts from a real authentic and relaxing experience and doesn't guarantee an on time reservation. 

Overall, def a worthy spot to try, but I wouldn't put it up there as a top SF restaurant.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
My third time at Kokkari was consistent with the first two visits: beautiful restaurant, notable service, and simple but seriously good food. This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I love starting with the tzatziki and the dolmathes. I've actually never tasted better dolmathes anywhere else. The pita is mouth-watering to even think about. 
I've had the lamb chops and the sea bass branzino. Both were pretty remarkable. Next time I need to try the hummus!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
If you're wanting Greek food, done right in a nicer setting than most Greek restaurants and are in SF, you gotta come here!!! If you are in the South-bay, just go to Evvia, instead, because they offer very similar dining experiences. The service is stellar and you leave your dining experience feeling happy that you chose to eat there, every single time!

For appetizers, I've tried them all, you can't go wrong, just pick what catches your fancy (my favorite is the anginares souvlaki). For main meal, their oven roasted branzino or rib-eye are my go-to picks. For dessert, I would get the yiaourti granita but only because Evvia doesn't offer that on their menu. If I would be picking based on my favorite, get the sundae. It's delicious and everything they use for the sundae (except for the hazelnuts) is made by the restaurant.

Strongly recommend eating here, you won't be sorry!
author: Taline M.

description: We had lamp riblets and lamp chops. They are wonderful. And also a combo of three different dips plus the leaves trappings. Staff are super helpful by changing the large portion of main course into smaller ones for us two girls - just ask and they will arrange for you. We were really full at the end:-)
author: Jing H.

description:
I am giving them 2 stars to acknowledge the amazing service we had and the awesome table we got for the 2 of us on the side where the large windows open up to Jackson Square.  

As far as the food goes, we clearly didn't order well.  We went with entrees and only one appetizer.  The appetizer was great (lamb and rice dolmas).  The entrees were not.  I had moussaka which was not at all like moussaka I have had before.  It was just a bunch of flavors mashed together more like a stew. It was hard to make out the egg plant since it was over cooked and hard to even find the taste.  My wife had the lamb shoulder special which again was simply like a stew with no distinct flavors that stood out.  Each serving was too large really for one person which the waitress should have told us.  And the arugula and peach salad was terrible. Very small and consisted of a handful of arugula, tasteless peach and a lite drizzle of dressing.  To be honest, I wouldn't have served what we ordered to friends if I did a dinner at home.

The best way to order at this restaurant is to only order off the appetizer menu and avoid the entrees.

And be prepared for a costly meal.  2 glasses of wine each, one dessert plus what I described above came to almost $200 before tip.  Also, be prepared to not get the table we got and instead get a small table among a crowded room of many small tables. Quite noisy and caverness. We won't be going back.  Not sure why it is so popular really.  Doesn't make sense to me.
author: Don S.

description:
I first reviewed Kokkari back in the height of the "Great Recession" ....2009 and I have to say the food, the service, and the ambiance have consistently stayed the same...Namely Awesome.

It is hard for me to count on two hands restaurants that consistently bring the goods ...every time: Their lamb with Greek potatoes is still wonderful. Their grilled fish dishes are super fresh and tasty. Actually anything that they put on their spit-roast ( pork,duck, chicken, lamb, or goose) is wonderfully done.

 All of their starters are fantastic with a modern take on Greek/Mediterranean  classics.

Still a great wine and cocktail list.

Some of the waiters are still here with their amazing personalities and expertise.

The space does not look tired and is super clean.

If you haven't been here go check it out: Either for a quick drink and appetizers, a great romantic meal, or hosting a party.
author: David G.

description: Wood grilled Mediterranean awesomeness! I have yet to have a less than excellent meal here.
author: James W.

description:
Huge place, feels like you've traveled back in a past a bit with its vintage look and feel. The baklava was amazing... I normally don't get dessert!

The pita bread was amazing so definitely get a hummus spread. We got the fish-based one and it was great. Lamb chops were solid as well. 

Only funky thing is that the menu is extremely hard to read. I believe a lot of Greek words, wish they had some translations. Great experience!
author: Young Y.

description:
Went here for lunch! It was very good. The ambiance was nice, staff was friendly, and food was authentic tasting, fresh, and yummy! It was a business lunch so the menu was pre selected for us. I loved their feta cheese and their chicken slovaki was perfectly cooked. I would go back on my own dime and time- very impressed. 

Great for groups. There were vegans and gluten free people in our large party and the staff was extremely accommodating and gave them their own options which I was told were also great.
author: Emily P.

description: I feel like I am in the Monty Python scene being subjected to the comfy chair and the threat of the soft pillow. Confess!!! Ok, ok, ok... stop already. I can't take it anymore. I do love Mediterranean food. There, I said it. Now that I have that weight off my shoulders we can move on to the wonderful experience we had at Kokkari Estiatorio. We were in San Francisco for the Bridge to Bridge run and had heard wonderful things about Kokkari. We had made a reservation in advance and were pleased to be seated close to our arrival. The dining room is spacious and decorated with a warm Mediterranean aesthetic. There was a feeling of excitement as servers move constantly among the tables attending to each party's needs. We intently studied the menu and had a hard time deciding on our choices. Everything sounded so good that we decided to share so we would all have a chance to sample everything. Yay! We started with a combination of dips including melitzanosalata (a delicious eggplant dip), tzatziki, and favaslata (made from yellow split peas) and served with house made grilled pita. All three were exquisite. Our next choice was the kolokithokeftethes. These are zucchini cakes served with a cucumber mint yogurt dressing. We all agreed later after finishing this wonderful meal that this dish was the first among equals in our selections. Unexpected when we ordered but definitely our favorite at the end. Next came the dolmathes which were excellent with the traditional grape leaves stuffed with a tasty mixture of rice, dill, and mint. We then had the kalamari. This was grilled calamari stuffed with feta and herbs and served with a roasted tomato and and eggplant relish. Some of us then had the soutzoukakia which are grilled lamb meatballs in a spicy tomato sauce with a greek yogurt. This got rave reviews from those who sampled this dish. Our next taste adventure on this Mediterranean culinary excursion was the garides skordates. These were wood-oven roasted prawns with feta butter and kalamata olives. The feta and olive taste combined with the roasted prawns was great. Do we need more? Oh, there are so many more choices! Next we had the makaronia which is a ravioli of ricotta and zucchini with vegetables,  pine nuts, and goat cheese. This was a very nice complement to our other choices. The last dish in the series of main course options was the petri posto, the whole grilled fish. A nicely grilled flaky white fish that had a really good flavor. Finally, we selected a few desserts to share since we clearly did not get enough to eat yet. The rizogalo is a fantastic dish with arborio rice pudding with honey glazed fruit. A delightful sugary sensation. Our other choice was the fruit tart which was a very nice tart with ice cream. Wow! Stick a fork in us. We were done. This was a great dinner experience. We all were marveling at every dish and how fantastic everything had been as we were leaving. Kokkari should definitely be at the top of the list of places to dine when going out in the downtown San Francisco area near Embarcadero and Washington
author: Mike J.

description:
The food was tasty but they served us the Ouzo with a cocktail glass and a pipe which is a huge red flag for both Greeks and Turks. 

I can understand localization of the kitchens on some level but this is more like being disrespectful to the culture and the kitchen.
author: Ilker D.

description:
This place definitely does not need another positive review. Though when I've experienced this type of dinning, well it's gotta be done!

Kokkari serves traditional Greek cuisine, served in a gorgeous restaurant featuring tall ceilings, elegant decor,  top notch service, and heart warming food.

If you're new to Greek cuisine and don't know where to start your Greek adventure starts here. The waiters, hosts, and all employees are so helpful with suggestions and recommendations, especially when choosing from the wine list. If you need to go to the bathroom, they will escort you all the way to the elevator as it can be a bit complicated. Make sure you check it out to experience the rest of this beautiful restaurant and to also take a peek at the kitchen! 

Anything you order here will simply be divine and I can't forget the extensive Greek wine selection. For the best experience, make sure you make reservations ahead of time!
author: Karla M.

description: This is an absolutely amazing restaurant. I came here with my fiancé and I had a couple of appetizers as well as the lamb for dinner. They have a few options that are amazing for dessert. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: S L.

description: I've been here a few times and have always loved the svelt fish appetizers.   Amazing.    Usually bring my bottle of wine in and they are always gracious to serve.   Highly love this place.
author: Kate H.

description: Excellent Lamb Souvlaki. Service was great. I would absolutely come back next time in town.
author: Jim D.

description:
One of my favorite places for a work lunch, fun friends dinner, romantic dinner...anything!!

I always get zuchinni cakes- even non veggie lovers love this 
Pita starter with the yogurt cheese spread 
Meatballs
Chicken souvlaki
Moussaka

Everything here is always good!
author: Daniela J.

description: I love love love this place and I gotta say I keep coming back it's so addicting!! There is nothing on the menu that is not good.... Tony was tending bar and he was so spot on with everything including pairing the wine with my dishes thank you I'll be back!!!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Hands down best dinner I've ever had. It is cozy, romantic, and the perfect date spot. The food is out of this world and the wine list was impressive. It was such a treat, I can't wait to go back when we visit SF next!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Fabulous restaurant with beautiful ambiance and gorgeous food.
We made a lunch reservation last week and enjoyed their octopus, calamari, sausages and two large salads.
I ordered the tomato salad that was perfectly balanced with a large piece of feta, rusks, purslane and heirloom tomatoes. My friend had the Kokkari salad which she didn't enjoy as much. She commented on the over abundance of arugula stems. 
I will return for dinner when my next trip to the city occurs. 
Wonderful service, romantic and comfortable dining room.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Went for lunch on a Thursday at noon for two.
It was crowded and we waited for about 15-20 minutes to seat in the bar which was the fast seats.
It was a great service and the portions are great, not too much n not to little.
The restaurant it is an older crowd.
author: Kim K.

description:
San Francisco has more restaurants that it knows to do with, but Kokkari is easily one that can hold its own in a city that can make any food lover pass out.  It's right next to A5 Steak Lounge, so you already know it's in good company. 

Came in with no reservations which is a no go in most places, but they do have open seating at the bar, or you can be put on a wait list and hope somebody cancels.  Well, we were lucky it seems as somebody must have cancelled, as after about 40 minutes of waiting we were seated. Yes! 

This place has a really nice feel to it.  Fireplace, dim lights, the works.  You feel like you're at a special spot right off the bat.  The service was also top notch and we were treated like English royalty from the onset.  I can deal with that.  

The meal was fantastic and I ordered a off the menu special called "lamb parts" which is comprised of you guessed it. Lamb parts.  It was pretty amazing and the wife had the lamb chops which was also pretty fantastic.  We tried some octopus, which might have been the best octopus I've ever had.  Also there is complimentary bread, but no butter? Hmm. 

One of the most fantastic dinner experiences in SF, and hope to come here again at some point. Thumbs up!
author: Benny H.

description: A little sad..octopus very chewy..I think Kyma in NY does it better..sorry west coast. Great enthusiastic waiter with lots of knowledge. The atmosphere was a stark contrast with the biting wind outside- a fire place and warm tones felt very homey. I had lamb which I though was well prepared with fresh herbs-my husband had the branzino-he didn't love..maybe not the best choice if you are looking for lots of flavor. Baklava had too many nuts..something  I thought I would never say..maybe pick something else..just ok.
author: Danielle K.

description: We love everything about this restaurant!  The food was amazing, our waitress was super friendly and very knowledgeable with the menu.  Will definitely be back if we visit San Fran again!
author: Jaime F.

description:
Fabulous food, service, ambiance!

Took my sweetie for her birthday
and had a memorable time. Pricey, but I felt I got something for my money.
Staffed by real people (ie warm & not pretentious), serving honest food (simple quality ingredients well executed), in a warm homey environment.(lamb roasting on big open hearth). 

Reservations a must!
author: Paul S.

description:
Exclusive place to have rewarding dining experience: nice ambience, impecable service, incredible wine menu to have favorite one for table, beautiful presentation with extremely tasty dishes either of appetizers or main/ special menu/, incredibly positive  aura around.. definitely, highly recommend to have fantastic dining in financial SF district.
Sevda
author: Sevda G.

description:
Great restaurant, especially if you love Mediterranean, Greek food.  The service was great, our waiter was very attentive, gave us recommendation, including for our children before we even asked.  
We ordered makaronia, which was a seafood ravioli, and roasted chicken.  They were great....  We also had 2 appetizer, the octopus and smelts,  both were wonderful too.  Octopus was very soft, smelts were crunchy and soft at the same time.  
For the level, I think the price was descent, not overly expensive.  With 1 drink and the 2 side dishes for the kids, it came up to $135.  For San Francisco, it was normal.  
The dining room was very comfortable....  next time I may need to try one of their lamb stuff....
author: Steve D.

description: My wife and I have been here multiple times as well as for business dinners and events.. it is hands down on our top 5 list in San Francisco. A fresh salad, lamb chops, baklava, and an aged cab blend are my picks.
author: Jay R.

description:
Absolutely exquisite. There is nothing else that needs to be said to describe the culinary experience here. Celebrated my 30th here with close friends - perfect setting.

We had the octopus which was not too chewy (perfect!), a platter with different dips (hummus, tzatziki, etc) , the dolmades which were very tasty, and the half chicken entree. Honestly was so full by the time the chicken came out, but gave It a go anyway and it was bomb. 

Come through and have yourself a night.

Pros:
Food
Ambiance
Service
Champagne

Cons:
Late reservations available even though several tables were open on a Saturday night when we arrived
author: Vyshak C.

description:
We had our one year wedding anniversary here. We are traveling from Seattle and this place was recommended to us by someone who had ate here when they were visiting San Francisco. 
We didn't have reservations but we were able to grab seats at the bar. (Reservations recommended)
Everything was excellent- the ambience, the service and the food. I would recommend this restaurant to others looking for a fine dining experience away from the tourists.
We love lamb so this Mediterranean cuisine was perfect for us.
author: Kristina R.

description:
Delicious food. Beautiful space. Great service. What else there to want from a restaurant? 
Plus the fact that this establishment is a quintessential San Francisco spot.
author: Nilu r.

description: Never a disappointment. If you haven't tried the food here you are truly at a loss.  I have been coming here faithfully for four years each time I visit San Francisco. Each and every time the service and food is SUPERB!  My favorite is the lamb chops with a side of zucchini cakes. The service here is EXCELLENT bar none. The attention to details in each meal is unequalled. Thanks Peter for providing such astronomical service. Can't wait to visit again.
author: Thea M.

description:
Came here for a birthday and ordered family style for 6. My sister and brother in law have been here multiple times, but it was the 1st time for the rest of us. We had a reservation and was seated immediately. Parking was not bad after 6pm.

For appetizers, we ordered the Duck Dolmathes (special that night), Octapodaki tou Yiorgou (grilled octopus), and Marithes Tiganites (crispy smelts) to start. The Duck Dolmathes was very flavorful and came with a refreshing yogurt dip. The grilled octopus was my favorite appetizer and had the perfect texture and balance of flavor. I've never had smelts, so this was interesting for me, but I did enjoy it. They came with a garlicky dip that was amazing!

For the main dishes, we had 2 orders of Arnisia Paidakia (lamb chop with potatoes - 1 each), 1 order of Kokinisto me Manestra (lamb shank with orzo), and 1 order of Psari Psito (grilled fish with greens - there were 3 options and we chose Branzino). The meats were so tender and juicy. The shank fell right off the bone and went well with the bed of orzo. The fish was okay for me. 

For dessert, we ordered the Baklava ( 2 pieces of pastry + ice cream) and Galaktoboureko (2 pastries filled with custard and fig + pistachio ice cream). The Baklava was a little sweet for me, but complimented well with the ice cream. The Galaktoboureko was very good, not too sweet. The pistachio ice cream had a nice crunch to it because it was filled with bits and pieces of pistachio.
author: Diane L.

description:
I like their branzino fish which is very yummy prepared with simple light aioli sauce n their slow cooked lamb in an old fashion oven
A place I will never  get tired to visit
Keeping up with time ....trendy
author: Cecille P.

description:
An easy straight-to-five-star experience. We had a bunch of good food this trip however Kokkari is one of two stand out places I'd go out of my way to return to.

The service was excellent and the execution of every dish was impeccable. 

Even small details like the bread, salt and oil impressed. 

Two of us sampled their saganaki, grilled octopus, spanakopita, and skillet prawns small plate / appetizers. Each one amazing. 

We shared the lamb chops entree which was pretty much perfection and finished off our meal with a piece of flourless chocolate cake.  It was maybe too much food but in some ways the perfect amount. 

There are so many dishes that we wanted to try and didn't get to.  You could easily just as the waiter / waitress to bring you anything and you'd be in Greek hog heaven. 

I wish I lived in this town so I didn't have to wait so long until my next visit. 

I miss you already, Kokkari.
author: Dan K.

description: The food is to die for here. I have had octopus and lamb chops and they were perfect and delicious.. my husband got ravioli. Restaurant is beautiful and sever was very attentive. Will be back and for dessert this time!
author: Kacey R.

description:
UPDATE!

We have been sick all night and some morning after last nights dinner. I haven't had a good poisoning like this since elementary school. 

Must have been the prawns ... or raw lamb 


What happened !!??? This used to be one of my ( many but still ) places to go !
Service is still excellent but the food and the drinks ????
We asked if they changed owners or got a new chef but looks like everything is still the same. 

We ordered old fashioned and it was water and bourbon. No bitters , not much bourbon either. Asked to remake the drinks we got straight up bourbon with lots of ice. 

Appetizers were very good but lamb chops with a Greek Salad were horrible. I asked for medium rare and o swear my chops were still saying baaaahh

Their Greek Salad was made with barely red beefsteak tomatoes , worst cucumbers and green bell peppers. So wrong. 

My stomach has been killing me since we got home 


I really hope we just got in on a bad night.
author: Masha M.

description:
I have traveled and dined in all 50 States and there are many great Greek cuisine venues. Located in the Financial District (FiDi) of San Francisco, this special and distinguishing Greek cuisine is pinnacle of Greek cuisine in the City by the Bay.

Perfect in every respect, I have dined here for years as a long time San Franciscan. Every guest I host, over the many years, all rave about the refined yet causal ambiance, great service and the delicious dishes.  Their lamb dishes are extraordinary. Period.

The lamb shank, lamb skewers and riblets are amazing. Tables frequently order another round of these local favorites. Walking is easy if in the FiDi as is ride sharing services. Valet is an option as well although I rarely if ever drive in this very walkable City.

Did I mention that their lamb dishes are among the best in the [Bay] Area?
author: Michael G.

description:
Exceptional Dining..

This place is worth checking out, Food is of high quality and standard.. Elegant restaurant, great service and ambience..

Favorites: "Kalamari", *Grilled octopus, Arnisia Paidakia, Mosharisia Brizola

Funny sidenote: While vacationing in Santorini Greece, a chef at a top restaurant here had asked me if I have ever eaten here at Kokkari after discovering that I was from San Francisco, I replied yes..He two highly recommended it and enjoyed this place as he had eaten here while visiting San Francisco and loved it..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
Kokkari is truly a gem in San Francisco! Delicious Greek food, classic decor, and consistently kind service every time. 

I've had the pleasure to try Kokkari a few times without needing a reservation because it quite close to my husband's office. This is probably one of the few restaurants I know in FiDi that is almost always jam packed even during weekday lunches. That said, it hasn't been a problem to walk in for a table of 2 during lunch. I do recommend making a reservation for dinner, any time of the week, because they are nearly always at full capacity.

Food is amazing, and the service is on point. Making it understandable why this is a popular destination for important lunch meetings. In general, everything I have had there have been executed well with no disappointments from any of the times I've been. I think you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, so it's mostly a preference of what you prefer to eat. Overall, the underlying flavors for all of their entrees are pretty similar, with their signature Kokkari dressing. Inspite of that, the seasoning is light and allows the flavors of the ingredients to really shine.

Might I also add that their dinner bread is crusty on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I appreciate that a little bowl of salt is provided at the table for you to adjust the amount of seasoning in the olive oil.

Here are a few of my recommendations of favorite dishes. Do take note that if you mention that you and your party intend to share dishes, they will separate entrees onto 2 plates for you. Certain dishes, for presentation purposes, are left on 1 plate. Dinner and lunch menu's are mostly similar with the exception that dinner has more appetizer and dinner entree options. 

Appetizers:
Roasted Beet Salad: I love beets. These are perfectly roasted and tossed in a thick greek housemade yogurt with a wonderful sprinkling of pistachio dust
Octapodaki tou Yiorgou: grilled octopus! Marinated and cooked to utter perfection. Probably the best I've had, second just to Dio Deka in Los Gatos
Arnisia Plevrakia: grilled lamb riblets. These are SUPER tasty. Juicy, burst of flavor. Cooked to tender perfection.
Spanakotiropita: spinach cheese stuffed in phillo dough. It's very light, airy. 

Entree:
Psari Psito: roasted whole fish. The fish variety changes everytime I have been here. I love their branzino (sea bass), and greek red snapper. All have been cooked in the wood-fired oven with the perfect amount of lemon, oregano dressing. Very nice, well flavored and fall off the pieces. No bones because the chef has already complete deboned it, except for the head. Price varies from $35-50, depending on the fish.
Arnisia Paidakia: grilled lamb chops. I've always been a fan of lamb chops, but a lot of places tend to overcook or marinate them. These were SO GOOD. Juicy, kokkari dressing, easy to slice my knife through. Awesome. If there is one thing you HAVE to get here, I'd say it's a lamb or the fish.
Arnisio Souvlaki: grilled lamb tenderloin. These were also delicious. I would say on par the lamb chops, perhaps slightly easier to eat. It's very succulent, well flavored, paired well with their thick cucumber salad tzatziki. It's like eating little cubes of lamb steak- order medium rare.
Moussaka: one of my favorite Greek dishes, but hard to find one that is not greasy or overdressed. I like to think of it as a eggplant, ground lamb pie, with a bottom of puree'd yukon gold potatoes, and a floating cloud of bechamel custard to top it all off. It's freaking delicious.


Desserts:
No brainer, if you're going to pick 1, go with the Baklava topped with a praline ice cream. Beautiful combination, perfect ending. 
If you're going for a home run, and can make room for it, I also highly recommend "Galaktoboureko," which is a filo pastry stuffed with a custard, paired with blood orange and pistachio ice cream to cut through the richness.

Overall, you can't go wrong with Kokkari. I think it's one of the must-try restaurants if you're ever in San Francisco!

Prices are steeper, but as are most nicer restaurants in FiDi, so if you're going to treat yourself this is a nice place to go for. I'd say lunch per person runs around $50, and dinner around $80-100 per person. But the food is worth it!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I have been to Kokkari nearly a dozen times now and always find this to be a solid choice. The food is dependably good and the service is among the top five during of my three years of living in the Bay Area. 

Tonight we had the rotisserie special which was an incredibly juicy yet crispy pork. We also had the branzino which had a crispy exterior followed by light and flaky meat, all of which was complimented by a douse of extra virgin olive oil which added to the unmistakably Mediterranean flare of the dish. 

The last dish we ordered was the Moussaka which was a blend of an incredibly rich and creamy top followed by hearty tasting spiced lamb. 

The only unenviable element of the night was being placed in the front of the restaurant in a round table which was inadequate for a party of four. We only ordered three entrees for the four of us and our waitress had to substitute two of our dinner share plates for appetizer-sized dishes. 

All in all a top tier restaurant and amongst the best San Fran has to offer.
author: Jason H.

description: Great food and service.  Best lamb chops I have ever had.  We also ordered the Uni (Sea Urchin) and it was fresh and tasted unbelievable.  We had lots of other dishes, but the two mentioned above were my fav.
author: Jimmy T.

description: Terrible service. Could not have been more disappointed. Our food was overdone, service was space, wrong dishes were served. Bad table. Wouldn't go back without a major change to management. Weird restroom in the basement sketchy elevator.
author: Erica A.

description:
Finally got to try this place! Sister restaurant, Evvia is one of my faves in the South Bay so I was super excited about Kokkari. I didn't realize 80% of their menu is the same, though. Arrived promptly for our 5:45pm reservations and was seated immediately. Even at that time this placed was PACKED. Doesn't seem that big from the outside, but this place is HUGE.

Ordered:
x Kalamari (grilled calamari stuffed with feta, fennel, orange & black olives) - we usually order the octopus because it's just the best ever, but decided to try the calamari for a change. OMG I've never had stuffed calamari before and it was just AMAZING. I highly recommend this dish.. even if you don't like calamari :P
x Spanakotiropita (traditional filo pies of spinach, feta, leeks & dill) - It was my first time having this aside from the frozen Whole Foods and Trader Joe's version. SO GOOD! The dough was so flaky and delicious. I couldn't really taste the feta, but it was still creamy and delicious in the middle.
x Psari sto Fourno (wood-oven roasted with potatoes, autumn vegetables, persimmon, charmoule) - ordered this with snapper and it was just ok. Stick with the branzino. There's a lot more flavor. We ordered deboned, but it came with SOOO many bones.. it was a huge turn off for me.
x Ravioli - This ravioli was pretty bland :( I remember the first time I went to Evvia I ordered ravioli and it was also bland.. not sure if it's a Mediterranean thing.

In all another great dinner. Evvia is probably slightly better, but again, 80% of the menu is the same. Definitely worth trying :)
author: Anna M.

description:
Evvia's sister, has been one of the most demanding restaurants in San Francisco for a long time. The food is exceptional and the service is just as great! 
You have to book in advance but you can always try your luck by calling the restaurant on the same day. They may have an early opening but if you have no reservations and want to get in on a Friday, chances are that if you are lucky, you can book a table for 10:30! 

What's popular? Everything! 
What we usually order? 

Saghanaki ( fried Greek cheese with squeezed lemon) 
Octopus 
Vegetable Skewer ( artichoke, red bell pepper, egg plant) which comes with a side of Greek yogurt 
Branzini ( Mediterranean Sea bass) 
Lamb chops ( with fresh oregano-cooked to perfection) 
Lamb skewers ( with a side of Greek yogurt, Persian cucumber salad and kokkari potatoes) 

Dessert: 

Galaktburko, custard filling fillo with a side of pistachio ice cream 
Or 
Panacota ( we order this one at evvia) 

They always have amazing specials(their goat stew is remarkable)  but overall you can't go wrong with any item on their menu.
author: Dan P.

description:
We came here to celebrate a coworkers' baby shower. When we arrived there was a mixed(older) crowd. The place is much bigger and more expensive than we thought.

We ordered several apps to share (they serve small starters to share although they are too small to share!):

Kolokithokeftethes - zucchini cakes were delicious, however there are only 2 per order for $12.25

Gigantes - good flavor and descent to share if everyone has a spoon full and asks for the free bread to dip in it!

Spanakotiropita - taste like every other I have had, although these are only 2 per order for $10.25

Grilled Calamari- was delicious, 4 small stuffed for $12.75

Feta sto Fourno- baked feta was delicious! Ask for bread!

For the main I had the Chicken Souvlaki which was nothing special, the same as any other restaurant with a similar cuisine.  Some coworkers ordered the Lamb Chops and said they were good but too small.

For dessert we had:

Galaktoboureko - this was the best although again there were only 2 pieces and we had a table of 7

Kokkari Sundae - this was good and definitely big enough to share

Sokolatina - flourless chocolate cake just as you would expect.

Overall the place was over priced and very small portions, however, that does not take away from the flavor.  Everything was pretty good, but I am not sure I would regularly visit due to the size and price.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Kokkari is definitely the place to dine Greek food, and it totally matches the hype!  I don't have to waste my time flying to Greece on an airplane for the best modern Greek food, Greek atmosphere, or even Greek ambiance!

This downtown Greek eatery is located in the best location, right across  Sydney Walton Square.   Parking can be tough, but valet parking is available.

The interior and exterior of the restaurant is beautiful.  At Kokkari, I love the classic decor, the comfortable seating, the energetic/ lively/warm/ inviting ambiance, and the dynamic first class service!  Totally love the very polite greeting from the host as you first walk into Kokkari.  The bathroom is clean and always pretty with fresh flowers, paper towels, and toilet paper. 

Food, ambiance, service, and value- 5 stars Out 5!  Noise level was low enough for great conversation. Everything is perfect.  Greek food is the best here!    

The fried cheese, grilled octopus, Greek salad, moussaka, lamp chops, charcoal grilled dry-aged rib-eye steak and grilled fish are superb, tasty, and highly recommended.  Everything on the dessert menu is definitely to die for.  My favorite is the Greek yogurt with sorbet.   Must try the Greek coffee!  Ah, almost forgot about the wine.  The wine list is extensive.  I have tried many wines here and have never been disappointed.  All of them are excellent.   You just have to pick which wine you are in the mood for.  

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Kokkari - it's my absolute favorite restaurant!  Will be back soon if we can get the reservation, which is not too easy to get.  

Tip=
1-  The complimentary bread is yummy but don't eat it!   Very tempting but you must control your eyes!  Haha.
2-  if not RSVP, get there early so you can grab a seat at the bar.
author: Ivory B.

description:
Having been to both Kokkari and Evvia once before, I was anticipating this most recent visit. The food here is exceptional. We arrived early for our seating but I found the wait to be pleasant as I was taking in the gorgeous rustic interior of the restaurant. Baskets of bread loaves were sitting in front of an hearth with lamb on spits roasting in the fireplace adorned with ceramic and metal cookware. 

We had some of the sourdough bread to nibble on and it was so good I ended up eating quite a few slices. There was one slice left at the end of our meal and I asked for it to be boxed. Our waiter was sweet enough to pack me a couple extra slices to go!       

SAGHANAKI 
Eat this quickly while it's piping hot! The textures and flavors of this cheese just blew everyone at the table away. The crispy outer layer gave way to a delectably gooey center. And the flavor combination of sour, savory, and salty was exquisite. It's a wonder how this dish is so simple yet so delicious.    

HORIATIKI 
This wonderfully refreshing classic Greek salad goes so well with the heavier dishes. All the ingredients were just bursting with freshness.  

KALAMARI
Biting into these tender, succulent pieces was absolutely delightful. I really enjoyed the added flavor from the black olive garnish. 

ARNISIA PAIDAKIA  
The meat was finely grilled, flavorful, and juicy with the lemon-oregano vinaigrette enhancing the natural flavors of the lamb. The three chops looked modest in size but I felt they were quite filling. The potatoes were incredibly tasty. It's no wonder they are branded with the name of the restaurant itself. 

SOKOLATINA
A rich flourless dark chocolate cake with the consistency of soft fudge. As much as I liked this cake, I have to say I prefer the Galaktoboureko. It's the lighter of the two desserts.
author: Lauren H.

description: I love the food here, but sometimes the wait for a table that you reserved a month ago is annoying. Also, I don't come back here as often since they split coffee down my back (during a huge business dinner). I was so insulted because the manager gave me his card 5 minutes later and said he would pick up the dry cleaning tab. I had to walk out of the restaurant looking like I shit my pants (the coffee conveniently settled right in that spot). I was humiliated. If you don't like to make reservations in advance come here for lunch during the week. I have always been impressed by the wine the waiter picks out for me. The taramosalata and zucchini cakes are my favorite. Skip the Greek coffee for obvious reasons......
author: Denise D.

description:
I love the food here even though Greek is not usually my top choice. Very convenient location in financial district, very large

Food:
- Yogurt Sorbet with strawberry icy and mint - this is the reason I came back. Yes it's only a dessert. After having a considerably heavy meal here this is the best dessert to end the night. 
- Grilled octopus: super tender and flavorful
- Zucchini cakes: great dish too but if I have to pick between this or octopus, I'd go for octopus
- Arugula salad: the cheese mousse on there along with strawberries and pine nuts are what make this arugula salad something that my boyfriend and I fight over, he is not usually a veggie person
- Lamb shank: tender, huge portion, share it! All the lamb dishes here are awesome
author: Amy Z.

description:
This restaurant looks more upscale as we walked to our seats. You're going to notice an older crowd. Probably bc the food here isn't cheap. Our waiter was a nice red headed man with a beard. He really knew the menu and recommended the lamb to us. I was reluctant bc lamb is more chewy than I would like but he assured me that it was really tender. He was right. It was really tender. I ended up sharing a Greek salad and splitting the lamb kabob. My friends got the range free chicken. All of the foods came out hot and tasted great. We ended the night with a baklava and a sundae. Baklava was delicious. When I went to make reservations, all of the 7-8pm times were taken. I would recommend to make reservations like a month ahead for the time slot you want. The only times that was avail when I made reservations was at 9:30, 9:45 or 10pm. 


So the bathroom was under the restaurant and it was a little creepy going there. You have to walk down a dimly lit hallway to take an elevator. In these days I would have preferred to have a bathroom that's closer. The whole time I was walking to the bathroom I had a lifetime movie scenario going on in my head.
author: Ciara N.

description: Food is great and the atmosphere is fun. Very noisy at the bar and in the restaurant. Fun place to go for dinner,not for a special occasion.
author: David S.

description:
Kokkari is now tied for my favorite restaurant, and the meal is one of the best I've ever had. Is it really worthy of such high marks? OH YEAH!

Getting a reservation in San Francisco is no joke. We made our dinner reservation about a month and a half in advance when we knew we'd be in the area. Highly recommend you plan a little in advance since popular time slots go quickly. The decor here is lovely, classy and rustic at the same time. Service was excellent. For being a packed place, you don't get the feeling they are trying to rush you out, they want you to enjoy your meal. Speaking of, we ordered a lot of food (so what else is new)

+Zucchini cakes: 5 stars - so delicious I contemplated getting another order!
+Octopus: 4.5 stars - I don't like octopus normally but that was charred to perfection
+Stuffed pita: 5 stars - IT'S BASICALLY A DELICIOUS PIZZA APPETIZER
+Halibut: 10 stars - Best fish I've ever had, hands down. Perfectly seasoned and cooked
+Lamb special: 5 stars - bf's order. I don't eat lamb, but I tried it and it was bomb
+Baklava: 5 stars - perfect ending to the meal, and not too sweet

Everything about our evening was on point, from the food to the wine and the service. It was the best dining experience I've had in a very long time. If you get a chance to come here, do it!
author: Melissa F.

description: Get the lamb chop! We came to town last minute, so we took our chances on a walk-in and scored seats at the bar. Great night
author: Scott V.

description:
I've heard so many great things about this restaurant and when I called to make a reservation, the woman on the phone was very short with me, defensive even.
Apparently the restaurant has been closed down.
I'm not sure if it's a health code violation that they are working on to open up again, or what the situation is.  When I asked specifically when they would reopen and why they are closed, the woman said there is a sign on the door that explains all of that.  As if I'm supposed to drive across town to read the sign. 
Unbelievable.   Official word is the kitchen is being remodeled.  The unofficial word is this is not a voluntary closure, and the restaurant is working feverishly to meet health code standards.
The way in which the lady on the phone spoke to me, I tend to wonder if it's not the latter.
author: Christina P.

description:
Had a great lunch here yesterday and we really balled out! The highlights are definitely the lamb chops which are a must-order, the calamari which is stuffed with cheese and topped with olives, oranges and fennel, and the peach feta salad which was a special for the day. 

But to be honest you really can't go wrong! We also had the duck dolmas (also a special), the house sausage with haloumi cheese, baked feta, whole branzino, and desserts. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly. 

This is a nice restaurant so definitely not your go-to quickie lunch. The service was exceptional and our waitress had great recommendations for both the food and wine. This was a team outing and she was kind enough to let us sit and chat for hours even after everyone else at the restaurant had left. 

It's pricy so be warned! Everything is high quality and perfectly prepared so I felt it was worth it (but I also got to expense it on our company so I felt pretty guilt-less!)
author: Sophie S.

description: I really loved this place for a date night or even a gathering. The restaurants esthetics are really warm and traditional but still very romantic. Sat at the bar while I waited for my table and reservations are a must! Ever dish we got was full of flavor and cooked perfectly. The cheese dish appetizer had to be our favorite. Often times when we visit restaurants that are on a higher end in the city I often deem it as"it's been done" but this is one I can definitely see re visiting and wanting to share with friends and family as well. It's great for groups or an intimate dinner.
author: Lu L.

description:
I've heard about Kokkari for a long time as a go-to for celebrating special occasions. TL;DR the spectacular food and one-of-a-kind ambiance lived up to the hype, but the price... let's just say it's good for special occasions. 

(+) Complimentary bread: Mmm, warm, fresh, and fluffy soft.

(++) Zucchini Cakes ($12): Woah, the most stunning fried zucchini I've ever seen. The composition with the golden coating surrounding cakes of shredded zucchini reminded me a bit of latkes. Soak up the mint-yogurt dressing and add some cucumber slices, and you get cool earthy flavors alternating with the more indulgent creaminess and fried crispiness.

(+++) Grilled Octopus ($17.25): Never was a big fan of octopus, but its robust flavors synergized with the strong smokey tones of the grilling and seasoning of lemon, oregano, and olive oil. It's a bit heavy from the olive oil, but it's hard to stop eating.

(+/-) Special: Duck Dolmathes: Frankly just tasted like plain dolmathes with a thin layer of duck. There wasn't anything special about the dolmathes; in a blind taste test it would likely be similar to what you find at your local Mediterran deli. The duck wasn't bad, but it didn't come together in any noteworthy way.

(+) Halibut Steak ($32.75): Pan roasted for tastiness and surprisingly moist. The accompanying fava puree, broccolini, and artichoke and olive tapenade gave a distinctly Greek twist. The portion is alright, though I expected something larger or thicker for something called steak. I think the branzino specials may be a better deal, though the prices of $40+ scared me a little. 

(++) Moussaka ($25): Comfort food. I think it could have used more kick, but the casserole of spiced lamb, eggplant, potato, and yogurt bechamel was hearty and filling. They don't skimp on the lamb either.

(+++) Grilled Lamb Chops ($31.50): As featured on 7x7 things to eat in SF before you die. And boy, am I glad that I got to cross this off my bucket list.
