The succulent meat has flavorful juices oozing out as you bite into it, infused with a pronounced roastiness and tangy lemon-oregano vinaigrette. Mop up the remaining meaty broth and seasoning with the mashed potatoes. The downside? Your standards for lamb chops will never be the same again.

I loved the rustic feel of the dining rooms, with the tall ceilings, large paneled windows, wooden fixtures, vintage chandeliers, and other traditional decor. We chose a window seat, and the chairs were fancy-pants individual armchairs. Talk about picture-perfect dining.

Indeed, Kokkari turned out to be an excellent choice for a celebratory meal. Since I took my family here to celebrate my graduation, Kokkari had just the right food that's of high caliber cooking but not too abstract (my parents would not know how to appreciate fine dining, and boo would be left hungry), professional service with the change of plates/utensils, and reservations available for lunch and dinner to avoid hassles. We even found street parking (albeit at $3.25/hr) and there are also garages nearby.

I would highly recommend Kokkari for the overall dining experience, but only if you either have exorbitant amounts of dispensable income for eating out, or are willing to splurge a little for a special occasion.
author: Edna C.

description: I REALLY wanted to love this place considering I've heard amazing things about this restaurant. However, everything was just too salty for my taste! The only thing I really enjoyed was the octopus - wow, that was delicious! Everything else was just A-OK. We also got this licorce sorbet at the end that was extremely... interesting. I couldn't stand the taste but my friend loved it.
author: Angelina H.

description:
Kokkari is a huge Greek restaurant near the Ferry Building/Embarcadero near a quieter area of SF.  We had an excellent dinner here after catching Hamilton.  I would rank this among the best Greek restaurants in my book.  The food here has some pretty bold flavors, and they cooked our fish and lamb entrees to perfection.  Menu was all Greek to me, but they have good translations.  I like how scaleable the menu is.  Plenty of appetizers if you want a lighter dinner Tapas-style. You can also go full blown with apps and entrees like a traditional dinner too.

Service was friendly and efficient - Matt was our main server and the waitstaff here are super quick with clearing dishes and refilling water.  Solid 5 stars.

We ordered the following:

APPS
1. Grilled Artichoke-Eggplant-Pepper skewers with Greek Yogurt dip is a must-have, and a great way to incorporate veggies.  The char on the Artichokes brought out a lot of the flavor. (5 stars)
2. Watermelon-Feta salad is great on a hot day.  Very simple, but good (4 stars)
3. Grilled Octopus was super tender and juicy, and nice smoky flavors.  Great for sharing for 2 people, but may be too small for 3-4. (4 stars)

MAINS
1. Wood Oven Roasted Branzino.  This is one of two whole fish preparations, and is the more complex one compared to the grilled version.  Fish was very moist and seasoned from the olives and Chermoula.  Roasted potatoes, turnips, and arugula make this a complete meal. (5 stars)
2. Lamb Chops medium rare came three per order and had a wonderful sear with soft and juicy interior.  I'm not used to seeing lemon with lamb but here it works well - adding a bit of acidity to cut the richness of the meat. (5 stars).

DESSERT
1.  Arborio rice pudding with peach and honey was excellent!  Definitely one of their lighter desserts and similar to the Mexican version except you get peach instead of cinnamon. (4 stars).
2. Greek Coffee - oh boy watch out for this one.  Similar to Turkish coffee in that its real bold and has all those grounds near the bottom.  The fact that I'm writing this review at 5am since getting up at 3:30am says alot about the potency.  That plus 90+ degree weather in Danville.
author: Daniel C.

description: I went here for a date night recently, and have to say that I think this is THE best restaurant​ in San Francisco. The vibe that Kokkari has is very comfortable and warm, which fits with the food that they serve up as well. The waitstaff is amazing and possibly one of the most top-tier I've seen for this sort of price range. I'd highly recommend​ the stuffed pita bread, as well as saving room for dessert for the flowerless chocolate​ cake.​
author: Alex H.

description:
Ok yes this place is good more for the ambiance, service and freshness of their product.  This place for me lacks flavor,  I can't seem to get an understanding of Mediterranean food... not saying everything should be drenched in thick and heavy butter sauces but give me something to work with here.  THe fish and the cheese appetizer was most memorable for me.  Service is one of the best in the city outside of a Michelin Star joint.

Food 4
Service 5
Overall 4.5
author: Patrick C.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in San Francisco!

Smelt- one of my favorite appetizers. 
Grilled artichoke- I probably wouldn't order again. They are artichoke hearts. Just what you would expect on a skewer
Tzatziki- cucumber yogurt sauce
Favasalta- chickpea hummus with feta cheese 
The pita bread wasn't soft and fluffy :( 
Octopus- so tender
Branzino (grilled)- loved it
Galaktoboureko- for dessert, it was just okay. 

I'm excited to come back to try other dishes here!
author: Tracy V.

description:
One of the highest reviewed places in SF so it was for sure on my bookmarks. It's great if you want whole meat dishes. They do know how to cook their meat well. 

FOOD:
Peinirli (3 stars) 

Sausage appetizer (5 stars): This was a special and it was delicious. The sausage had so much flavor. 

Sea Bass (4 stars): Got this deheaded and deboned but there were so many bones! Was annoying to take them all out. Fish was cooked well though.

Lamb Chops - Arnisia Paidakia  (4 stars)

Lamb Shank - Kokinisto me Manestra (5 stars): Super moist, fell off the bone. 

Lamb Skewers  -Arnisio Souvlaki (4 stars)

DESSERT
Baklava with Ice Cream (4 stars): Good baklava and even better with the ice cream. Will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth.

SERVICE (5 stars)
Service was great which I expected with prices and ambiance. 

ATMOSPHERE
Nice restaurant. Make sure you have a reservation because they get booked, or you can try the bar area. 

PARKING
We did meter parking on the street and found it easily on a Sunday. 

Overall great for special occasions since it is a nicer restaurant. Great for meat lovers.
author: Latisha S.

description:
Stupid. Yes, stupid that I've never reviewed Kokkari. I have been her at least 10 times over the last 18 years. My sweetie and I have celebrated birthdays and anniversaries here. This is a place for special occasions, but it is also a neighborhood restaurant for a drink and a casual meal. One of my most favorite restaurants in the City!!!!  This place NEVER disappoints. 

Walk into a warm bar area with fireplace and energy!!  Wonderful bar with fresh accoutrements for cocktails and a first rate mixologist. Martinis are poured. 

Dinners are fantastic: fresh grilled or fire roasted fish, chicken, steak. LAMB?  Duh!!!! This is a Greek restaurant!  If they can't nail lamb, then they are lame. The lamb is always great. I had the mixed lamb grill tonight, with rib, shoulder and leg--I left only bones. The potatoes are cooked in the juices that drip from the meat. 

We also had the octopus as an appetizer. If you're an octopus lover, you know that this is not an easy dish to execute. Cooked to long or too short, it's chewy. The cooks at Kokkari mastered it: perfect grill taste in outside and tender and moist inside. Seasoned simply with lemon and high quality olive oil, it is a winner!!

Unless you were born in Corfu, you won't recognize a damn thing in the dessert menu other than baklava. But, everything is good!  We had a rice pudding with grilled peaches. Also, the custard with dates and walnuts was ridiculous. Leave some room for dolce!!

Mediterranean atmosphere. Great service. A San Francisco mainstay. Go here!!
author: Donnie Mac M.

description: LOVE this place!!! Always service with a smile. I never seem to make reservations so I mostly end up at the bar. My favorite bartender is Fatali but regardless of where I'm sitting, the food and drinks are always pitch perfect. Everything on the menu is solid. One of my favorites is the branzino. They also serve a watermelon salad sprinkled with olive oil. Ughhhh mouthwatering good!!!
author: Ali R.

description: Impeccable service, exquisite ambience, delicious food with distinct flavors across the menu. This should be on any local and tourist's list.
author: Kunal K.

description:
Superb dining experience!  Everything was excellent. Greek heaven!
The lamb niblets are a must, tender and delicious. Zucchini cakes with a yogurt sauce...excellent. I'm not sure if the pita is baked in house but it tasted like it was. We tried hummus and other dips (a trio) which were great.   The goat stew is amazing!  So rich and flavorful...a must.  Also had the special which was a lamb dish. I didn't love it nearly as much as everything else.  I would order moussaka, lamb chops  or goat stew next time.  Excellent service.  Really nice ambiance.
author: Melissa R.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the area!

Pros-
Décor
Atmosphere
Food (I love their prawns)

I fell in love with greek and Mediterranean cuisine because of this place!
author: Leo L.

description: Recently attended a private dinner here and it was fantastic! Loved the private room - even tho it's in the dining room, it's very private and cozy once the doors are shut. It's the food that made this an over the top event. The grilled octopus was incredible; the spreads and pita breads were delicious. The mains - lamb chops, chicken skewers and whole fish were beyond fantastic. Cannot wait to return.
author: Donna G.

description:
If you are in Sf or visiting San Francisco and like Mediterranean food, then this is the place! 
We have been coming to kokkari for years now and love the food and service always!
 
As for the appetizers, we love the octopus. Always very fresh with a mild dressing of olive oil and lemon. 

The saghanaki ( baked cheese) has been our favorite for years. 
 Our new favorites( vegetarian is aginares souvlaki) which is a skewered eggplant, red bell pepper and artichoke with yogurt dip. 

Our favorite meals are the lamb skewer ( arnisio souvlaki) which comes with a side Persian cucumber and mint salad, Greek yogurt dip( with grated cucumber) and lemon zested potatoes.

For pescatarians, their branzino is just light and amazing! It comes with two options. Grilled or baked and we always get the grilled version. You get to change the side from the sautéed vegetables to the "kokkari" potatoes. ( give it a shot) 

For desert, we ordered the Sunday which is gluten free and incredibly tasty.
author: Ghazal P.

description: where to start? have been a loyal fan for many many years..with all the new restaurants opening  left and right..Kokkari still one of my favorites(if not the most). from the perfect cocktail to impeccable service. Cheers!
author: Souris L.

description: Good location and we've been told about this place by numerous patrons. Comfortable atmosphere and decent service. We celebrated a milestone birthday there and it was as relatively uneventful. Tried two apps, three entrees and two desserts with coffee and tea! We are on the fence on whether we'd visit again.
author: Sanaa H.

description:
Wow ! This is an amazing restaurant would go again in a heartbeat ! Be ready to spend but it's definitely worth the dollars. The ambiance , the service , the food ! 
From the appetizer I loved the party sampler that comes with an array of sauce ( one of them of tzatziki sauce can't remember the names of the others ) but it is definitely one of the best from the menu. It is quite filling and their food comes out quick so don't order unless you're a big enough group(4-6) or are super hungry ! 
For the food I also had the chicken with the tzatziki sauce and again it was divine! The lamb is also great so another option if you want to try something else
author: Waheto W.

description:
Mussaka was delicious. Cauliflower app was great. Octopus was solid (not the best i've had), and lamb app was pretty good too (a bit fatty for my taste but I'am also not a huge fan of lamb).

Service was good - I like it when they have a strong opinion on what to get.
author: Laura D.

description:
I've been to Kokkari twice; both times I thought the service was spectacular but the food fell a little short of the hype. I have tried the zucchini cakes, grilled meatballs, lamb souvlaki, chicken souvlaki, vegetarian ravioli, garlic potatos and giant beans. All are pretty good, but didn't blow me away.

BUT, dessert is a whole other story. Their flourless chocolate is AMAZING. It is so rich and creamy, and tastes just perfect paired with pistachio ice cream. 5/5!
author: Alice S.

description:
Plush, slightly worn chairs with fancy patterns, oriental carpet over hardwood floors, and lots of older people in business attire. Felt like I walked right into a common room (what we called social lounges) at school, if they suddenly specialized in fancy Greek food.

Came by for a celebratory lunch, so there were lots of things on the menu to try.  Overall, everything was tasty and portion sizes were large. For appetizers, we had the zucchini cakes, grilled calamari, and grilled lamb riblets. The zucchini cakes didn't really taste like veggies (in a good way, for all the usual veggie avoiders), and the texture was stringy and easy to cut into with a fork. The grilled calamari had perfect texture-- easy to chew and cut through, but not undercooked. The feta in this was melted down, and wasn't too pungent. I didn't notice the bulgur wheat in this. Good grilled flavor. The meat on the lamb riblets easily fell off the bone. The gamey flavor of the lamb here was fairly light, and it had just enough chewy portion to be tasty but not difficult to eat if one was at a fancy business lunch. Meat texture was bouncy and juicy, though more moisture would always be appreciated.

There was a bit of a wait between the apps and main courses, but we were a larger party and the place was packed (packed!) on a Monday at lunch. We got the ravioli, amisio souvlaki (grilled lamb skewer), cretan pilafi (brown rice with butter and lemon rice with greek yogurt), and patates sto fourno (potato wedges with oregano and lemon). The ravioli was not as al dente as other higher end restaurants I've had, but the filling did stand out in terms of its taste (you could really taste the freshness of the spring veggies and the pine nuts). I would have preferred the filling to be slightly less pulverized, but to each their own. The grilled lamb skewer was strong in lamb flavor vs. the riblets, and while the meat was not super tough, it definitely could have benefited from more moistness and seasoning. The brown rice was fairly standard-- good as an accompaniment but didn't stand out on its own. The potato wedges were also standard-- super hot and melt in your mouth insides, but I love potatoes generally. Overall, I think the apps (3.75/5) were stronger than the mains (3.3/5).

We finished with the vanilla ice cream and baklava. Really good vanilla ice cream has that special je ne sais quoi about it-- I think it's the bean bits that really make the vanilla flavor pop. The baklava was pretty standardly good. I preferred them separate (3.5/5). The Arnold Palmer I got was heavy on the tea, but with the ice (and passing of time), the concentration of tea to lemonade was good. The cappuccino I got was super foamy on top (so much that you could spoon it out and eat it), and wasn't overly sweet. Wait staff was quite magical when it came to putting down utensils without you noticing!
author: Nicole H.

description:
I came here for a work lunch. The VP of my company said it was his favorite restaurant in his city and I was not disappointed!

We tried a bunch of the appetizers. I usually don't like lamb but the lamb riblets were super tender. There was none of the usual aftertaste either. Made me regret not getting lamb for an entree! The fried cheese and zucchini cakes were also favorites.

For the entree, I had the sea bass. I love how you get the whole fish and they debone it for you. Really tasty and fresh!

Now we couldn't have left without getting dessert. We split a baklava and a galaktoboureko. A great way to end a great meal. The desserts were relatively light and not overbearingly sweet.

I totally understand the hype and would definitely recommend it!
author: Becky H.

description: This place is clean and has great food & service! I had the lentil soup with lamb riblets for lunch and the portions were just perfect for one. The lentil soup was the most tasty and filling with a generous amount of chicken and rice hidden inside.
author: Vivek S.

description:
I've been coming to Kokkari for several years now. This place is always packed but service has always been great and the dishes are always well executed. 

Although they have a pretty large menu, they are pretty straight forward....nothing too fancy. For appetizers, the grilled pita with the different kinds of spreads are always great to share. The saghanaki, which is a pan fried cheese is also fun to have. I also enjoy the grilled octopus and the calamari stuffed with feta cheese. I have been here so many times so now I typically like to order their nightly specials. They have had grilled lamb's tongue, pork sausages, lamb dolmathes as their appetizer specials, they were all great!

For the main course, I would typically get the whole grilled fish if I want something lighter. It's a very simple dish (oregano, olive oil, lemon, salt) and yet it's very satisfying. It comes with a side of steamed/boiled vegetables (the veggies might be a bit boring but I guess it works with this dish because it's so simple?) You can ask the waiter to debone the fish if you prefer.

If I'm craving for red meat, I would usually get the lamb chops or the lamb souvlaki. Both dishes are excellent, seasoned nicely, and grilled to perfection. The ribeye is great too, but the portion is huge for one person.... I would suggest splitting the ribeye. Also, check what they have on their special rotisserie. Often times they would have duck and that's a great dish to try as well....very tasty.
author: Sam M.

description: Such an amazing Greek restaurant!  My favorite was the Lamb special.  Also the leg of lamb was amazing!
author: Ahmed H.

description: Loved this gem! Took my sister there for lunch. Service was great. Drinks, appetizers & entrees were delicious. They have a great wine list. Went back couple of times with friends & family!.
author: Sandhya K.

description:
4.5 stars. 

One of my favorite places in San Francisco. Fantastic ambience and great lighting. I celebrated my 40th birthday here and it was amazing.  

My favorite dishes:
Lamb riblets: very tender and flavorful. 
Grilled octopus: never disappoint

Fried zucchini cakes were solid but not spectacular. 

Would not recommend:
Fried smelt: too oily

Reserve way in advance or come late to score a table.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Yes, things might be a bit pricey here than your average everyday restaurant, but you do get good quality and decent value for your money.

The soutzoukakia (grilled lamb meatballs with spiced tomato sauce and Greek yogurt) were a great way to start the meal, and were quite rich, meaty, and filling. They're an appetizer, but for most people they could suffice as a meal on their own. Next, I doubled down on more meat: shavings from the daily lamb rotisserie. The photos don't do this dish justice. You're getting a heaping plateful of delicious, juicy, perfectly-seared lamb. So filling that it's worth sharing amongst a large group. All of this went down nicely with some well-paired wines.

Definitely a good place for a business dinner or a special occasion.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Every aspect was excellent , down to the g a galaktaburika and Turkish coffee
Stuffed squid, pomegranate salad, fresh bread, pita and toppings (fresh baked) 
Really  excellent meal
author: Dan B.

description:
Kokkari is the best Greek restaurant this side of Athens.

We have been to Kokkari six or seven times. It is a perfect lunch spot with clients or great for a date night or family outing. Everything we have ever had was delicious. While we have had most of the appetizers, the fried smelts and the octopus are probably our favorites, and the zucchini cakes, and the meat balls, and the.... With regards to the entrees, all I have to say is Lamb Chops! Perhaps the best I have ever had. Nice selection of Greek wines and a knowledgeable staff to help you with your selection.
author: John C.

description: Love this place! All around excellent service, nice wine list and great food. Beautiful, cozy and warm atmosphere. A perfect spot for a special occasion. I highly recommend their seasonal salads, grilled octopus, branzino, and lamb chops.
author: Bell A.

description: The food was great, ambience was good---but the waiter Tig was ***** five star!!!we recommend the fried cheese called saganaki-yum! The halibut was delicious despite some random fish bones. Everyone else had some version of lamb and they were all happy... but Tig deserves praise for making our dinner experience unique in a good way. Great job,Tig!Oh also--beware it's $$$$$
author: Carmen O.

description:
Came here to celebrate the fiance's birthday and it was a wonderful dinner! I can't thank our server enough for great recommendations. The menu gets pretty overwhelming and everything sounds amazing so our server was super helpful and we were able to narrow our choices down. I also really appreciate that Kokkari Estiatorio is on opentable so it was fairly easy to make a reservation.

The ambiance here is cozy-fancy. I love the open fire rotisserie in the back of the restaurant and on your way to the bathroom, if you're lucky, you can watch someone make coffee in this urn of hot sand.

I actually recommend coming with a group of friends since portions are generous and there are way too many dishes to try. Be sure to get the fried cheese... that was the star dish.

To top off our dinner, we got dessert (Galaktoboureko), which had happy birthday written on the plate. Even though I was super stuffed, I managed to inhale it. 

I'll be back with some friends!
author: Janet H.

description:
OMg.. if you are craving food from Greece.. be it Santorini/Mykanos/ Crete, this is the place to go. Warning: you have to book a table and that is an optimum experience but you can also walk in and get a bar seat. The people are really nice.. and food is amazing.. no other place in the city is as good as this.. great food list on the menus and long elaborate list. Ian a vegetarian and loved gigabytes, zucchini cakes and spanakotripta.. Saganakhi was okay... too salty for me. My husband ordered octopus for mezethes and lamb chops for main course. He was blown over. We had all Greek wines.ihad Kamara Retsina which I liked.. not like usual white wine but a strong fruity smell with not so wet taste. If you are a fan of bougatza then galaktoboureko is what you want.. it was great with a glass of Sauternes. 
All in all. I am coming back with family and friends on special occasion because this place ain't cheap.
author: Ankita J.

description:
Rude servers please avoid this space. 

Food not good 

Drinks watery 

Pass - that place
author: Mauro P.

description:
My husband was away on business for my actual birthday, so he reserved a table here for later in the month because he knew that I've been wanting to go in such a long time. In all honestly, the whole thing was a massive fail to the extent that I felt bad that he wasted his money:
- food came before drinks. I wouldn't expect that in an Olive Garden.
- entrees arrived cold. We said so and they came back warmish & well fired (these are $40 entrees...) 
- the maître d came over to ask if "everything was alright NOW" (as though I was an obstreperous child) & I said "well it's still just warm if I'm honest" & he disappeared, never to be seen again. 


The server was nice & apologetic, and they waived the cost of the main but to be honest, if we couldn't afford it we wouldn't have chosen it. A refund doesn't recoup an experience, and having been so excited for my Friday night celebratory meal I left deeply disappointed.


Won't return & will actively warn others. There are so many nice restaurants in SF, no one needs to waste time on this one.
author: Fi M.

description: Awesome and delicous Greek food in a cozy restaurant. Kokkari doesn't disappoint if you are a meat lover. All of their dishes are delicious but I'd say their specialty is with all the different kind of lamb dishes. Just be sure to make a reservation because it'll be busy!
author: Gary Y.

description: This is my favorite in SF.  Lots of great places in the city. However I have yet to find one that beats this one.  The lamb, the peach seasonal salad special  (amazing), fish and it goes on. Have enjoyed every order thus far.  The ambiance is warm and cozy.  I love the open fire with rotisserie chicken. Great job!
author: David W.

description:
what a fantastic experience. this place has been on my to-do list for years and was finally able to make it

it's gorgeous inside. so warm and inviting with a beautiful fireplace roasting pork and lamb. it seems the front room is the place to be with upholstered chairs, but we preferred to sit in the larger back room which seemed a little less formal, larger and has a view of the kitchen.

service was impeccable, wine list was extensive and very fairly priced, with enough options by the glass.

we opted to share one main and four starters. I highly recommend this approach as there wasn't a single starter we didn't want to try.

starter standouts were the grilled octopus and peirinli which is baked pita stuffed with figs, ricotta and olives, topped with caramelized onions. seriously one of the best things I've eaten in a long time. watermelon and feta was a very refreshing break from the heavier apps

we had the lamb shank with orzo for a main. it was good, but next time I will try a different entree. there were lots of specials that night which made it difficult to choose

pro tip: at exactly opening time (5pm on Saturday) they open the door and allow first come, first served to sit at the bar with full menu
author: Bob U.

description: Food is amazing. From the appetizers to the main courses, everything is flavorful and authentic Greek. The service is impeccable and the servers seem to really understand the meals. Drinks are great. We came here for a 40th birthday and they made us feel very special. This is what dining out is supposed to be.
author: DP G.

description:
04/12/2017 - Another educational dinner presentation held in the same private room downstairs tonight.

I noticed much better customer service this time. Everyone greets you on your way out. They all look happy. It may sound sappy, but it just gives off this feeling of warmth/family. Maybe I'm just trying to feel those My Big Fat Greek Wedding vibes.

Halibut tonight was amazing! Tender and moist on the inside and not burnt on the outside. Whatever they top on it compliments the fish so well.

Pita bread is STILL bomb! This is the only place where I'll have pita bread and hummus because it's perfection.

Server was awesome! I got the sundae only because I wanted ice cream, and she offered to just serve me ice cream since I didn't want the whipped cream or fudge. Thanks!!

Still 4 stars because I want to try more things on their menu before I give a solid 5 for consistency.
author: Fanny W.

description:
Our favorite restaurant to visit when we hit San Francisco. The gigante beans and lamb meatballs set the stage for our dinner tonight. The special peach salad was beautiful and a light surprise. The pork chop from the rotisserie was moist and tender. The goat stew was something new for me, tasting similar to pot roast in texture. I was surprised by the $45.50 price tag for the featured stew however. Lesson learned to ask first then order. 
Kokkari is a treat that you cannot get elsewhere. Enjoy the service. Don't be thrown off by the corner entrance, it's big enough for all of us. Make your reservations in advance. 
Until next visit, bon appetite!
author: Jeanie H.

description:
I have heard amazing things about Kokkari for quite a long time and I finally had the pleasure of dining here last Friday night. It was elegant and surely very popular. It took us 1 month to find an open table on the week night. The décor was Mediterranean with woods and rugs everywhere. The service was warm and attentive. The manager came to check in with us during the meal and right before we left. We were served warm bread with a big bowl of olive oil once we sit down. 

For appetizer, we indulged in their grilled Octopus and fish roe dip with homemade pita bread. Both are outstanding and the dip is rich, creamy and smooth. It goes so well with their soft but firm pita bread. It was a match made in heaven. For entrée, I was eyeing the lamb chop but decided to go a healthier route of grilled Branzino fish. Both cost over $46 but come in rather big portion. My husband got the lamb chop instead. 

I had a slide of the medium rare lamb chop and it was full of flavor and excellently seasoned. My Branzino fish came in whole with head, tail and bone. It was a beautiful thing although I cannot finish it all at once. It tastes fresh, sweet and tender. 

We were really full after entrée but figured an order of dessert will just put us to sleep so why not? We got the Baklava and it came with a scoop of very sweet Vanila ice cream I believe. The baklava comes in two triangle pieces and if you never have it before, you should be aware that Baklava is naturally very sweet since it has a lot of honey in it plus crushed pistachio. We felt like penguins after this meal because our bellies were too full. 

I would love to come back again and try other items on the menu!
author: Athena C.

description: We loved this place. Ordered all four types of lamb on the menu and each one was delicious. Try the grilled octopus appetizer and zucchini cakes. The wine list is extensive however if ordering by the glass it's limited and not great. Service was very good and our server , I think Jeff, knowledgeable. Not a formal place but good for work related dinners too. I went with my teenage kids and there were many other smaller kids around. Highly recommended.
author: Vin M.

description: Great food and service. The pasta is to die for. The seafood platter is sumptuous
author: Sara W.

description: We had an amazing experience at Kokkari. William, the manager, is a rockstar. Our server, Tara, was also incredibly kind. Food was delicious, great wine list, meatballs are delicious, the Moussaka is by far the best in SF. Will return again and again. Thanks, William, Tara, and the whole staff for such an awesome experience!!
author: Maria M.

description:
What the hell did my family of 3 just spend $270 on?? 

Ambiance: A-
It was very nicely designed to give that high end Mediterranean vibe. Lighting was mediocre in brightness and created a romantic aura. Lots of family style tables and even had private dining rooms. Booths for my family of 3 was kind of awkward ?? Like.. we're wearing dresses and we gotta scoot into the seat like we're at a diner? Cmon... 

Food: C-
Everything. Tastes. The. SAME.  Charred then doused with olive oil, salt, lemon juice.  Unless I'm mistaken, I'm sure Greek/Mediterranean cuisine involves a LOT more flavoring that those ingredients. What the hell. 
- Grilled octopus. Grilled then dressed with olive oil and lemon juice. $13 (or something) for a few bite size pieces ??
- Special of the day: mission figs with cheese and honey something. This was my favorite but there was way too much dressing and a little too much honey. The leaves were literally completely covered..
- Zucchini cakes with yogurt sauce: UHHHHH why is this popular?????? $13 for two rounds of panko covered zucchini batter. I guess the pickled cucumber and yogurt sauce were good complements...
- Puff pastry with spinach and feta. SO oily?? 
- Special on the pit: roast lamb. THIS TASTED LIKE BOILED LAMB, which of course was then doused in olive oil and lemon juice. Chewy and overcooked. And expensive??
- Lamb chop. Not sure why all their lamb items don't really taste like lamb... This was probably my favorite, and was actually cooked to Medium as requested. 
- Whole grilled sea bass. Grilled and dressed with..... YOU GUESSED IT, freaking olive oil and lemon juice. They "deboned" it and there were still so many bones left. There is no way to eat this dish elegantly. At least my mom said the fish tasted fresh.... 

Service: C 
Tell me why our server looked like he had a migraine all night? Not once did we see him smile. He was so stern, I felt like I was supposed to be pouring him water. He did take the time to explain the dishes when I had questions, but we did not felt welcomed by him. I'm not even sure if he introduced himself when he first approached our table. 
We mentioned that it was my birthday when I made the reservation, but there was no attempt to celebrate. If we're paying this much, at least a scoop of ice cream would've been nice. I know I know, I'm so self centered for being upset at this, but you know what? We are common peasants who are out there to celebrate my very ordinary birthday, so I would at least like to be acknowledged.

Weird quirk:
The bathroom is downstairs so you need to take an elevator..... Very ... Dungeon feeling. 

OVERALL:
Everyone was so snobby. I felt like I should be serving the server instead because he looked so... Sad. Food was equally as sad. Bill was severely sad. So was wallet. Never coming back....
author: Susanna C.

description:
Oh Kokkari, how you have my heart! What an amazing menu, space, and ambiance. This is truly one of my favorite restaurants in Northern California and I try to come here as often as I can. 
 You really can't go wrong with any of the menu choices to be honest. Some of my favorite appetizers include: spanakopita (light and fluffy), Kokkari potatoes, Kalamazoo, and the grilled lamb meatballs which are perfectly seasoned and paired with a fresh Greek yogurt. 
 I usually order the salmon as my entree but you cannot go wrong with the rib eye. They also have a four cheese ravioli on the menu which is nice for the vegetarian palette. 
  Finish your meal with the baklava ice cream- mind blowing. Thank me later. 
 This place will change your love for Greek food; take a group of friends or take your significant other, make reservations and enjoy the evening at this gem in the financial district!
author: Jay E.

description:
I always hesitate reviewing someplace that has so many reviews already.  What can I say that hasn't been said?  So I'll just touch on a few highlights.We were a group of 7 celebrating my bros birthday.  T and I got there ahead of everyone else.  Early enough to see them taking the whole lamb off the rotisserie, and I already knew what I'd be eating.  It was slow cooked over the flame with potatoes roasting underneath in the drippings - a little shoulder, some leg, a couple of rib chops.  It was sublime.  We got several apps, my favorite was the Kalamari - grilled calamari stuffed with feta, fennel, orange & black olives 12.75.  The squid were pretty small, but the combo of flavors, was extraordinary.  I highly recommend it.
What I really want to talk about, though, is the service.  Our server,Hank, was absolutely exceptional.  He was always there when we needed him and dealt with each of the quirky personalities in my extended family with grace, expedience and humor.  Since the birthday boy was paying for all of us, we brought wine and asked him to split off the corkage and give us the bill for that.  He was kind enough to tell me, as he opened the 4th bottle that starting with the 5th one the fee goes up from $25/ to $35/ , so we had him stop at that one.  Is it just me, or does using Uber make you drink more.  

Food:  36/40
Service:  20/20
Atmos/intangibles:  18/20
Value:  16/20
Overall:  90/100 just squeaks into the 5 star territory
author: Diane B.

description: Great food, great service, and nice environment. The lamb chops is my favorite dish here. It is a must have here. I took my different friends here and they all love it.
author: Kat L.

description:
I went to Kpkkari Estiatorio last night. The ambiance of the restaurant is very cozy even though the restaurant is large. We started off with wine and their wine list is very inclusive.

Our appetizers were zucchini cakes that came with a cucumber yogurt sauce with pickled cucumbers. We also had a fried cheese dish that was browned on all sides with a gooey center. They squirted lemon over the top, which added a sour component to the dish that was delicious. The cheese reminded me of the best browned pizza cheese but way better! 

For our main dishes, my husband ordered the Moussaka which is a ground lamb casserole with potatoes and a béchamel type sauce that has been baked off. the casserole has some sweet spices in it like cinnamon. It was the perfect balance of sweet and savory.  I ordered the whole roasted sea bass, which was delicious and delicate.

We couldn't resist dessert. I ordered a semolina custard filo dessert that came with pistachio ice-cream and candied quince. OMG so good. My husband ordered the greek donuts which were beautifully anointed with a sweet sauce while the donuts remained slightly crisp. We will be back. This was a very good meal and I would recommend to anyone.
author: Carla K.

description: I was here with my boyfriend recently to enjoy a dinner. Greek/Mediterranean restaurant with good food although very over-priced. The service is very good and our waiter was very friendly and nice, menu was good and had a wide variety. We decided to order a few different dishes to share, they were all "ok", nothing really blew me away. Maybe the bread that they served everyone. And oh, the dolmas were good and authentic. The rest was just average.
author: Beyan A.

description: Our family recommended this restaurant and it was definitely worth going to. We were told it's hard to get last minute reservations so we got there 10 mins before they opened and there was already a line forming outside the restaurant. We sat in the bar area and they serve a full menu. We ordered the fried cheese (saghanaki) that came on the sizzling plate and they spritzed lemon on it and it was amazing! A must have for cheese lovers! We also ordered the lemon chicken soup with rice (avgolemono) and the white fish (psari psito), it was all very delicious! This definitely a place worth going to if you're in the area!
author: Ron V.

description: I'm not sure where to start. This is my second visit. Our last visit was for a birthday dinner. On that visit our food was amazing and the service was so so at best. This time we set in Matt S. Station and I think this is just about a perfect overall experience one can get at a restaurant. From starters to dessert are spot on. Each of Matt's recommendations were amazing selections. I was told the lamb burger was amazingly decided to give it a try. I can't even say lamb is my favorite.  The burger was amazing. Beautifully presented. The Meyer lemon dessert with the pistachio ice cream was the bomb. The baklava ice cream was no joke either. Thank you Matt very an exceptional lunch!!!
author: Tony C.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. 

Get a reservation if you can. 

Sit at the bar if you can't. 

I prefer to sit at the bar. The bar tender will watch for seats for you if you order drinks. 

All the dishes have Greek names I can pronounce and don't remember. 

All the dishes are delicious. 

Fried cheese. What?! Holy holy insane!

Meatballs. Mouth watering. 

Grilled octopus. Tripping just thinking about it. 

All apps / small plates - incredible. 

Branzino - my favorite 

Rotisserie anything - can't go wrong. 

Pro move - sit at the bar and let the bartender order dinner for you. Done. Best dinner you've ever had in San Francisco. Your will look super cool in front of your date - trust me.
author: Dave K.

description: A nice evening; very friendly and knowledgeable server ; nice ambience; wine list is pricy
author: Robert O.

description: How does this place have a Michelin star? It is a giant cavern with a ton of people running around, but not a lot of work getting done. Our server was more focused on bossing around the bussers than doing her job. The food is overseasoned and oily, what you would get in a mediocre restaurant in Chicago's Greektown. We got five or six appetizers, but could not be bothered to order mains. Hey, at least the wines suck.
author: Ben G.

description: Probably my favorite restaurant in sf. Service is always top notch and the food is super flavorful and a break from normal California cuisine. The appetizers are out of this world and this is one of the best moussaka dishes you can find.  Lamb lamb lamb here and the fish is amazing too. You have to go at least once and try. You won't be disappointed.
author: Josh L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants!  The grilled octopus appetizer and sea bass are amazing.  I've been here about 5 times and it's just as good each visit.
author: Xiara L.

description:
So it's okay. When the front crowd are in suits and all look like they crawled out of corporate board meetings from the financial district, and former SF mayor Willie Brown saunters pass you in a red woolen suit from the restroom, you know you're in a serious establishment. As for the food, I was unimpressed. I love Greek cuisine and it didn't feel as authentic. I couldn't put my finger on it. Maybe it's a fusion restaurant? I don't know. It had a long wine list for the deep pocket crowd.

It was a packed Friday night and the noise was above level and we sat next to a couple essentially side by side separated by a standing lamp.

The grilled branzino was good, but a little too dry for my taste. The baby carrots appetizer was too soggy. I liked the artichoke skewer and the loukomades, and the service was excellent, but not enough to give this another star. It's the $200 I spent for two (inclusive of two appetizers, two entrees, one shared dessert, and two glasses of wine); I expected more.

(This review is independent of my enjoying the night; I had a good time. Will I go back again? Probably not).
author: Oliver C.

description: Kokkari was a good experience, with decent food and good service. The items we ordered were all very tasty and, as with all Greek experiences I've had, completely filled with olive oil. To be 100% frank the food was decent and I didn't experience any mind-blowing culinary discoveries with the taste of the food - everything was just solid and good, a solid 4/5.
author: David Y.

description:
I was super excited to try Kokkari as it is one of few 4.5+ star rated restaurants with so many reviews. Both my boyfriend and I are not huge fans of Mediterranean food, but we decided to give it a try. Overall, our experience was alright. 

Appetizer:
Grilled octopus: 5 stars. Simply delish! 

Entree:
Oven-roasted branzino: 4.5 stars. They had three different fish for fish of the day. You can get them either oven-roasted or grilled. I chose oven-roasted, and the dish came with roasted tomatoes and Yukon potatoes. The fish itself was great, but the roasted vegetables were amazing as well.

Grilled lamb chops: 3 stars. I'm not sure what happened with our dish. Most Yelp reviewers rave about this dish, but we weren't so happy with ours. We asked for medium-rare, but two of the three lamp chops came out medium to medium-well. Also, those two lamb chops were lacking flavor very much. For a $47.50 dish, we were looking for more, but ours definitely did not meet our expectations. 

Our server was very helpful and attentive. She was knowledgeable in dish preparation as well as the restaurant's beer selection. If it wasn't for her, I would be leaving a 3 star review. Kokkari is definitely pricey for what it offers in terms of food, but maybe our next visit will be better.

Also, they offer valet service. However, we were able to park on the street right next to the restaurant.
author: Eunice C.

description:
Yes, yes, yes!! Kokkari never fails to impress! I made my second visit here during a business lunch with a big group of 11, and we reserved and were seated at a long communal table in the inside dining room, facing the open kitchen. Despite being such a big group, the service was timely and impeccable--somehow, all of our dishes still arrived at the same time, and the food was amazing like always. The lunch menu is almost identical to the dinner menu, though a few of the entrees are smaller (and cheaper).

Mezedthes are the star of any Greek meal for me, so four of us split a bunch of starters (this was a good number of people to split these dishes, as quite a few items came in fours). The salty baked feta was served in a tomato sauce and had the perfect amount of kick/spice--perfect for eating with bread. The grilled meatballs were tender and juicy (pairing perfectly with the tomato sauce and dollop of yogurt), and the zucchini cakes with yogurt sauce and cucumbers were so unique. The stuffed grilled calamari and dolmathes (rice in grape leaves) were both delicious as well, and the fried smelt had a fantastic crispy texture--kind of like fish-flavored fries!

Having tried so many starters already, we decided to split just two entrees--the lamb chops and the grilled whole sole. Both of these dishes had bold Greek flavors of lemon, oregano, and olive oil--there was nothing crazy about these dishes, but everything was perfectly executed! The lamb chops come with the most delicious fried potatoes, and the juicy whole fish is deboned at the pass right before being served!

Overall, another great experience at Kokkari--I definitely preferred the flavors and the variety of the starters more than the main dishes themselves, and this was such a balanced, delicious meal. However, this restaurant is certainly expensive and the portions are small for the price, but the unmatched quality of ingredients and execution are worth the expense.
author: David K.

description:
I'd been here before a few times, and absolutely loved it. The fried cheese thing ("Saghanaki") is delicious and so are their spreads with pita. I'd been raving about Kokkari for a while, and thought I'd make a reservation to introduce my husband to one of my favorite places.

Unfortunately, it wasn't as good as I remembered. The octopus appetizer was delicious - perfectly cooked and seasoned. We had some salad, but it wasn't memorable. The lamb chops were tender and wonderful and tiny and came with a tiny side of potatoes (the potatoes needed to be rationed carefully in order to not eat them in one bite and have them to go along with the 4 bites of lamb...) I ordered a fish and it was well cooked and tasty. My fish came with sauteed greens, and they were weirdly textured and really didn't work with the fish and I found them completely inedible. 

The quality of their meats / fish is absolutely wonderful. However, everything just tastes like it's been charred and seasoned with olive oil / lemon juice. It's kind of boring and the lamb chops are literally the smallest I've ever seen at any restaurant (especially for the price...). 

Our server was nice and the wine selection was good. It's a nice place for a date or a birthday celebration. I've actually never been to a restaurant that does absolutely nothing when you tell them you're celebrating something special.... well Kokkari does absolutely nothing which is really awkward... There are a lot of great restaurants in this city at this price point, and to be completely honest, I think this one is the least creative / smallest portions (with spices, sauces, ingredients) compared to its peers. I understand the high ratings - it's a classy place and it hurts to admit that you spent ~ $100 per person for a mediocre meal with minimal ingredients that you could have made at home.
author: Nelya T.

description: When you want to splurge, or if you have your workplace paying, this makes a great spot to get some quality Greek food. I had their halibut steak along with couple of their appetizers. The moussaka and the zucchini cakes were definite highlights. You can't go wrong with any of their main courses. I've tried their version of the donuts which is average but it goes great with their coffee!
author: Anand R.

description:
This place is amazing.

Food:
Grilled Octopus: good portion amount, flavoring and delicious 
Lamb riblets: i enjoyed every bit of the meat and how the meat easily came off the bone
Sole: entree dish, the entire fish was perfectly cooked, and flavored. Came with a side of potatoes 
Rotisserie Lamb: this was the special of the night. the flavoring was amazing, the lamb was juicy, seasoned and not gamey at all. 

If you haven't been here before you must try the lamb chop -- it's absolutely my favorite. Im a little upset that I didn't order it but I knew that the lamb on the special menu was going to also be amazing...and it was! 

The service was great, and so were all the servers and staff, very attentive.
author: Abby C.

description:
First time at Kokkari and I loved the experience! So much that I'm giving my first 5 star review of the year !

Walking in, you immediately notice the rustic Mediterranean interior dećor, like a country inn, warm wood colors, pottery, stone walls, very welcoming. 

Came here with no dinner reservations on a Friday night, but luckily got seats at the bar. Both Bartenders were welcoming & tremendously hospitable.

Ordered some Mezethes (appetizers) that were both finger lickin good. The Arnisia Plevrakia : Delicious grilled lamb riblets with oregano & lemon.. juicy, & flavorful.
Also ordered the Kalamari: which was grilled and stuffed black olives, feta, fennel.. very creative, and actually have had a foodgasm tasting this! 

I'll be coming back for a full dinner experience!
author: Nawar F.

description:
For some reason, when people ask me what are some of the biggest staples in the city and I mention kokkari in my list...I tend to get a strange look especially when they find out it's Mediterranean food.  This isn't your typical Medi/Greek restaurant, folks.  This is excellence and perfection and absolutely stands up to other spots in the city.  

You'll have to get reservations ahead of time on open table.  I tend to make reservations months in advance in increments just so I can keep coming back.  Parking is horrific out here.  Take a lyft...also it would be best since they do have a full bar and an extensive wine menu.  We ended up with a fantastic bottle of sancerre which really complemented our meal.  Awesome for special occasions and hopefully, you'll get a seat in front of the hearth.  

Speaking of the hearth, they've got meat on the fire, depending on the chef's choice of the day, and tons of bread sitting up in front of it.  Really creates such an amazing ambiance and I just can't get enough.  I was so stoked when I found out the special was duck.  Yesssss!!!

Anyhoo we started off with:

Feta sto Fourno - Greek feta baked with tomato, capers & Metaxa brandy.  I will be the first to tell you that I am not a fan of feta.  I told our server this but she still recommended it saying that most people who don't like feta end up loving this dish.  Glad I listened to her.  It was fantastic and the flavors were bursting at the seams.  

Next, we ordered their infamous "fries with eyes":  Marithes Tiganites - crispy smelts with garlic-potato skordalia & lemon.  I could eat this entire dish myself.  The smelts had such a great texture.  Although fried, it still tasted light and was absolutely delish.

Ok, back to the duck which was the Souvla Tis Emeras, the rotisserie of the day.  Perfectly cooked, a must order if they happen to have it when you're there.  More than enough to take half of it home as I was stuffed from everything else already.  We also ordered the Arnisia Paidakia, grilled lamb chops with lemon-oregano vinaigrette & Kokkari potatoes.  Also such an amazing dish and you can't go wrong with either of them.  Flavors and seasoning were on point.  

For dessert, we ordered a couple of items but the main meal was really the star.  If you haven't been here, I have no idea what you're waiting for!  Amazing 5 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Came for a nice meal in the city even though I know I am not a fan of lamb, I had to get the hyped up dish. The Moussaka was very flavorful and the potatoes whipped on top were heavenly. Although, I still don't like the lamb, I could appreciate the dish. Bf got the chicken, and he wasn't too excited about the dish. He didn't find it to be extraordinary, though it was flavorful.

The service was awesome, though. We came to our reservation early and they were kind enough to seat us anyway. The place is charming, with multiple rooms. I really enjoyed the ambiance. We sat at a table with two large chairs, and I thought it was so cute.
author: Katherine L.

description: I came here with a couple friends and had looked at the menu before and was hesitant because I don't eat lamb or seafood so did not know if I would enjoy it. I walked out eating one of the best meals of my life!!! This place is beyond amazing and tried so many different things every one of them was absolutely delicious. Will definitely be going back and it's worth every penny.
author: Nicole K.

description: Such amazing Greek food and service.  We shared several appetizers and a main dish.  the Saghanaki reminded me of the what I had in Greece, but you cant do fried cheese wrong!  The soutzoukakia (meatballs), and moussaka were amazing.  The staff are so attentive and friendly.  So many more things I would like to try.  A really great dining experience for food and service.
author: Steven B.

description:
My friends described Kokkari Estiatorio as an SF staple, and after dining here, I would have to agree. 

I have to admit, the experience didn't start off so great. The hostess wouldn't seat us until our whole party was present, and told us to go to the bar for a drink. The only problem was that there was absolutely no space, so we waited in the corridor. The hostess then very rudely told us that we shouldn't be standing there, which I sort of understood, but there was literally nowhere else for us to stand without being in the way anyway. We quipped that there was nowhere else for us to stand, and that we weren't going outside in the cold. Not to mention, this probably could have been avoided if they just sat us, as 3 out of the 4 people in our party were present anyway. Yeesh.

Thankfully, after that whole debacle, our server was very kind and cordial. He gave us some really good recommendations for wine, as well as the food. We were seated in the back area near the windows, which was really nice. The interior is very well-kept, and the presence of the wood-fired oven makes the vibe seem more home-y, which I appreciated. 

Our favorites:
- Lamb chops: Cooked to a perfect medium rare, the signature lamb chops were everything that was promised to us and more
- Grilled stuffed calamari: The varying textures were all great, and the sharpness from the feta and olive really went well with the tender calamari
- Moussaka: So good. Each layer was perfectly portioned, and I really enjoyed the meatiness.
- Banana Kataifi: Unbelievably tasty. It wasn't on the the dessert menu, but was listed as a special, and it's definitely worth it. Not sure if it's available year-round, but it certainly should be.

In general, as previously mentioned, our service was very attentive, and the courses were very well-paced. The prices are definitely on the expensive side, but the ambiance is very nice and the quality is really great. With the bottle of wine for 4 people, and about an appetizer/entree per person with dessert, it was about $80 a person, including tip/tax. Not too shabby 

Our meal here was pretty much perfect, besides the hostess needing an attitude check (did I really just use the term "attitude check?"). Definitely worth a return trip to try the other dishes, and we'll be back when we're in the mood for some great Greek food.
author: Eric J.

description: This place is amazing. Great food and nice staffs will make everyone really satisfied. I would like to try all the dishes in the menu if possible. Definitely want to go back sometime later
author: Sujung S.

description:
Some of the best food in San Francisco, period.  

You need a reservation.  I like that they have big, comfortable chairs that are not too close to other tables.  Many tables are close to the windows, so it feels airy and light.

I strongly recommend the grape leaves for an appetizer.  The saghanaki was good as well. Watermelon salad and potatoes were tasty, but not anything to write home about.

Lamb was well cooked.  Juicy and not too fatty. 

The best desert (imho) is the Greek yogurt with honey and nuts. Be warned: the portion sizes for most things was pretty reasonable, but the sundae is giant!

Service was efficient, friendly and knowledgeable.  Couldn't be better really.
author: Holly P.

description:
Wow. Utterly amazing. I came here a few nights ago with my boyfriend while we were on vacation to celebrate our last night out in San Francisco. I had done some research and discovered it is one of the best places to eat in the city. Not to mention, Greek food is one of our favorites. I had made a reservation about a month in advance and although we were a few minutes early, they seated us right away in a cozy corner table with a nice view. 

The bottle of wine we ordered was a nice, more dry Pinot Noir; the Caraccioli Cellars, Pinot Noir, Lucia '13. Very delicious especially for the price of only $52. 

We started with the Karpouzi me Feta (watermelon and feta appetizer with basil, pine nuts and olive oil). I am a big Top Chef and Master Chef television fan and have always been intrigued by the watermelon dishes they create but had never before had the chance to try one. It was spectacular and everything I had hoped for. They were offering a specialty peach salad that night that we also got and thoroughly enjoyed. 

My boyfriend actually opted for an appetizer for his entree, the Soutzoukakia (lamb meatballs with spiced tomato sauce and Greek yogurt) and I had the Arnisia Paidakia (lamb chops with lemon-oregano vinaigrette and potatoes). Both were superb. Even though the meatballs are traditionally an appetizer my boyfriend was barely able to finish them the portion was so nice. On my lamb dish you could really taste the vinaigrette which had soaked so nicely into the lamb. 

As for dessert, per the recommendation of our waiter, we went with the Galaktoboureko (custard in what looks like a connoli but tastes even better with apricot and pistachio ice cream). I probably would have ordered this dessert even without the recommendation because of how much my boyfriend loves ice cream, nonetheless I'm glad it was presented to us in such a high manner because it was delicious. My only critique is that they put more apricots on the plate because those were my favorite!

Of course the service was wonderful. The waiter really took his time with discussing the menu and wine options they offered. Will definitely be back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Marissa D.

description:
Came here for an anniversary dinner and it was AMAZING!! We had heard good things about Kokkari from multiple people, so we were super excited to see if it lives up to the hype. The ambiance is really cozy with soft lighting, and all of the seats are comfy living room style chairs. Most of the tables are tables for 2, and each of these tables is pushed up against another table and separated by a floor lamp. We had requested a special table just for 2 which was awesome. We walked around to get a look at the whole restaurant, and I really liked the fire and the spit right in the middle of the restaurant, and in the back room you get a good view into the kitchen!

Our server was really friendly and personable too. She made the meal really fun! We brought our own wine since the corkage fee is only $25. We started with the crispy zucchini cakes. This appetizer comes with 2 of the cakes, a sliced cucumber salad, and a minty yogurt sauce. That sauce really makes the dish! For our entrees, we each got a side of the goat stew which was on special, and we got the pork which was the special on the spit that evening. Both dishes were phenomenal, but that stew is really magical! We also had our eyes on the lamb chops, but we'll have to come back another time to try those! We ended the meal with 2 desserts- the galaktoboureko and the special which was a phyllo nest with sweetened ricotta, figs, and baklava syrup. They were both really tasty- I liked the galaktoboureko better and the bf liked the special better. We were also impressed that they remembered to write happy anniversary on our plates without us even reminding them when we walked in! (We told them when we made the reservation). 

Overall, we had an awesome experience here, and if you're on the fence about going, DO IT! I'm excited to go back myself to try some of the other dishes!
author: Rachel D.

description: The food was amazing! Some of the best Greek food I've ever experienced. Our server was sweet, knowledgeable and kind. Very professional and went above and beyond for us. The only thing I can say that I didn't enjoy was how we were greeted at the door. The hostess wasn't very pleasant and had a very pretentious feel about her. And I wasn't going to allow that to ruin my experience cause the food speaks for itself.
author: Edward J.

description:
I usually don't write reviews but felt compelled to do so for Kokkari. Although the food was ok and the service was quite good, this review is meant to counterbalance all the hype to provide a more accurate overall rating for this restaurant. 

One common theme in marketing/psychology is that one's satisfaction doesn't derive from intrinsic quality but from the difference between actual quality and expectation of quality. For example, if you eat at a restaurant you expect to be like McDonald's but is actually the quality of in-and-out, you'll be greatly satisfied. If you eat at a 3 star Michelin restaurant, but it turns out to only be a 2 star experience, you'll be very disappointed.

Under this scale my experience at this restaurant is 1-yelp star. At the time of writing this review, Kokkari had 3850 reviews and 4.5 stars. Comments describing this restaurant would include:

"The olive oil is the best thing ever, I swear I would drink it if I could!!"

"Some of the best food in San Francisco, period."

"The meal is one of the best I've ever had."

"The most tender and full of flavor lamb shank that I've ever tried"

"I kid you not, BEST LAMB CHOPS IN THE WORLD. And that's coming from someone who usually hates lamb."

And hundreds of similar reviews. Reading the Yelp page convinced me that this restaurant achieved something akin to human discovery of fire. When I walked in with my girlfriend, I was expecting to be nothing short of amazed. The real (objective) results were as follows:

Zucchini Cakes: 4/5 stars. Unique, crispy appetizers. Would order again.
Filo Cakes: 4/5 stars. I've had Filo cakes in the past, but these were above average.
Lamb Chops: 3/5. Chewy, not too much flavor. Quite average.
Lamb Shank: 3/5. Same as above.

Overall, this was a pretty average meal. Service was superb, and the waiters were quite accommodating. But remember, I was expecting to witness the discovery of fire. But for $140, it did not come even close to that. 1/5.
author: Chris W.

description: Waited for 45 mins to get a seat at the bar. Then an employee moved a couple friends ahead in the queue. Not cool. I finally geseated at the bar but decided that type of treatment is BS and got up and left. The bartender knew what happened and was at least man enough to comp my drink. Hats off to him but screw that nonsense. That employee should be reprimanded.
author: Ron A.

description: We came in yesterday for lunch. Food as always was delicious. Our waitress was friendly and her timing was perfect. The rest of the staff was also friendly and attentive. Love coming here, every time.
author: Christina R.

description: Wow! This place was amazing! From the food to the atmosphere and finally the service! We were unable to get a reservation since they book up so quickly but sat at the bar and ordered octopus, calamari, Greek salad, lamb meatballs, and this amazing Phillo dough dessert which we forgot the name but the bartender recommended and it was fabulous!!!! Will def be back again!
author: Irene P.

description:
Still as incredible as always and arguably one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.

Sure, from time to time it's fun to have dishes that are served at subzero temperatures, coated in foam, emanating smoke, or stacked like a Cirque Du Soleil gymnastic tower... but nine times out of ten I just want great food, exceptional service and classic decor. And Kokkari scores in every category.

Right now, the fresh (and I mean still moving) sea urchin from Monterey Bay and Feta-stuffed squid are both exceptional. As for the entrees, get the lamb chops, and ask for four instead of three because you and your date will most certainly fight over them. Pair that with the Branzino and you just might have room to split their namesake sundae dessert (their in-house ice cream is beyond compare).
author: Mike V.

description:
Exquisite. What a classy place to grab a nice dinner. Everything about Kokkari was fanastic. I wasn't amazed at the appetizers we ordered but the entrees were exceptional. The restaurant is huge! There are so many rooms throughout but I wouldn't suggest coming here without a reservation. The servers were very informative regarding each dish and attentive throughout the night.

For starters we got an order of the kalamata pita (flatbread) and the avgolemono (egg-lemon) soup. When I think of pita, I think it of more on the softer side but this dish was a little crispier than I was expecting. It's basically a mini pizza; extremely thin flatbread with a hardened crust. The avgolemono soup was a little too sour for me. I know it's a egg-lemon based soup but it seemed like the ratio between egg to lemon wasn't consistent and there was a ton of lemon juice.

Now, the entrees are spectacular. We opted for the arnisia paidakia (grilled lamb chops) and kokinisto me manestra (lamb shank). I loved both dishes. The grilled lamb chops had a great presentation. The meat was juicy and tender. It didn't taste or smell gamy at all. I loved the lemon-oregano vinaigrette that it came with... it balanced quite well. The lamb shank was also superb. It's placed on top of orzo pasta and the meat fell right off the bone! Reallly tender and tasty!!

I would definitely go back to Kokkari! Maybe I'll order some different appetizers next time.
author: Jason L.

description: Me and my team visited here for our offsite. From the moment we entered till the end it was an experience. The ambience is cozy and intimate. I love their semi-french kinda windows that they open out once in a while. The food is great! Every dish here I guess is curated with a lot of attention and care, presented really well. I had Aginares souvlaki, grilled artichoke, eggplant with Greek yoghurts and some veggies. It just melted in my mouth. And my dessert was the icing on the cake. I ordered for galaktobureko! It just gives you food coma!  Id definitely go here again for a dinner date with my husband. Hopefully I get reservation!
author: Kalyani R.

description: When I told a few friends I was going to San Francisco, their immediate reaction was - you have to go to Kokkari, it's incredible. I made reservations (which I recommend doing as far in advance as possible because getting them wasn't easy) for 8:30 pm on MDW Sunday - but based on the reviews I have read, Kokkari is packed pretty much every night- and the ambiance was great! Buzzing, but not too loud and we were able to hear everyone at the table we were seated at. The first thing I noticed was the service - it was incredible. Our waitress was so knowledgeable (and knew every thing on the menu that could be tailored to my Gluten Free diet) and she was able to help us by recommending several dishes, so if you go and you can't decide what to get, ask your waiter! They have a seasonal menu, but I recommend the asparagus, the lamb steak, the dolmathes, the amazing hummus (We ordered a dip combo plate and there was one dip that was the most delicious cheese I have ever had so I highly recommend). Now, my last recommendation is the Yiaourti Granita made with yogurt sorbet and seasonal fruit granita- ours was made with cherry and it was incredible. Loved this place so much- it's a must try!
author: Sophie H.

description: Well trained and attentive staff, fantastic food, great ambiance, and location. Our experience here is ALWAYS great!
author: Leona Y.

description:
This place is definitely $$$, but the bill wasn't on me so I had a great time haha.  This is definitely a nice place to come for meetings or more special events.  I had a Greek whole grilled fish that was part of the specials that day and it was absolutely delicious.  Bonus, because the bones were removed.  The Moussaka was pretty popular among our party, but beware that it's very filling.  

For appetizers, the zucchini cakes were good.  The warm pita bread is also amazing.  Highly suggest getting a platter!
author: Shannon L.

description:
This place came highly recommended to us. Reservations are hard to make; you'd have to reserve at least a month in advance and there's a reason why-the food is outstanding. 

We started with grilled octopus. It was a simple dish but it tasted delicious. Sometimes less is more. 

For entrées, my husband decided on the lamb shank and I went for something more traditional and standard-the moussaka. The lamb was so moist and falling off the bones tender. The spices created a harmony in your mouth. My moussaka was hearty and it was definitely comfort food on a rainy night in San Francisco after walking around the city. It hit the spot and very tasty. Portions were generous which we appreciated very much at a high-end restaurant.

We weren't sure if we wanted dessert but looked at the menu anyway. I got curious about the baklava ice cream and went for it. Hubby was full so he just ordered a Greek frappe. Both were amazing! I highly recommend these if you have room for dessert. 

Overall, we were very pleased with this place. The ambience was nice and the service was excellent. This place is great for a romantic evening or getting together with friends. You will enjoy it.
author: Joy B.

description:
This place is awesome! Go! I was told my numerous friends about how good this place is. This is perfect for a nice date night, special occasion or just a great dinner! 
I recommend the lamb meatballs, pork chops, and the sundae!!!!
author: Allie C.

description:
Fast forward 4 years and hundreds of dining experiences under my belt I am now a little wiser and fluffier

The simplicity of Kokkari is part of its charm, let the ingredients shine and treat it with respect 

Overall Thoughts

It goes to show that first impressions aren't always true, glad I was proven wrong
author: Eddie W.

description: Unreal! So tasteful !!!! The service is amazing,definitely awesome date spot or any special occasion. I love the food. Not your typical Greek restaurant. Must Go!
author: Sahar E.

description: Probably the best restaurant in the Bay Area with great service, amazing food and wonderful ambiance. The bar is a great place to hang out if you are lucky enough!
author: Michele W.

description: We were there to celebrate my birthday on Saturday the 15th.  We had reservations made a month in advance.  We got an excellent table.  We lucked out because we had the only Greek waitress in the Restaurant, Sophia!  We encouraged her to recommend dishes and beverages.  She made excellent choices for us.  She treated us with respect but as family as well.  We loved her!  We had the Greek eggplant appetizer.  We had the grilled octopus and the lamb meatball appetizers.  All wonderfully delicious.  We had the pit special and the sea bass.  All perfect!  Two desserts, coffee and Masticha (sp).  We hated to leave!  I am looking forward to visiting my favorite restaurant again soon!  We hope Sophia will still be there!
author: Emily G.

description:
Some tips for you.  You're welcome.

-Make reservations on Open Table.  Thursdays to Sundays are usually booked out 30 days in advance, especially during peak dinner hours. 

-Apps: Baked feta topped with roasted tomatoes, onions and a hint of capers and flecks of chili flakes

-Order anything roasted on the spit; there were chickens and pork shoulder tonight.  The pork shoulder was especially decadent, made more so by a small sliver of crispy pork skin that reminds me of lechon (Google it.  Hint: It's Filipino!)

-Get you some goat stew on a bed of orzo.  Ignore that it's goat and just focus on the feta and the orzo and the flavor that makes this goat the G.O.A.T

-With dessert, have your Greek coffee, sketo style for its unsweetened caffeinated glory.  I'm still effin awake and I sipped this thing six hours ago.

-For dessert: kataifi with roasted peaches and vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel sauce.  It goes really well with the sketo coffee.

-Or, get the ice cream sundae.  

Amazing meal, one of my top 5 in the city.
author: Joc V.

description: Best restaurant in town, my absolute favorite and food is beyond amazing. Same food you find in Greece and a lot of times it's better at Kokkari. I try not to come here too often so it will always remain my most loved and coveted jewel in SF:)
author: Liza B.

description:
Kokkari is one of my top top favorite restaurants in the city. I love Greek food, and everything I've tried on the menu is delicious! I like that they stay true to the Greek flavors but offer subtle twists on some of the dishes.

Menu-wise I like to order a handful of the mezes (usually a dip, meatballs, saganaki, one of the veggies) and share, or the fish dishes and lamb souvlaki are also amazing. I also have found their desserts to be excellent.

I also always find their extensive wine and spirits list fun, and when I ask for recommendations, the staff is always able to offer advice.

My other favorite thing about Kokkari is the cozy, elegant atmosphere (complete with a giant rotisserie oven!) and the top notch service. It's one of my favorite places to go when I want a nice dinner I can relax over since I know our table will be so well looked after!
author: Holly L.

description:
Really great service, but I can see how parking around this area would be a nightmare. It was pretty much a ghost town for our 9:45 reservation, thankfully (we ended up parking not too far away--definitely will feel the wind on a chilly day). I have no clue how there's no reservations at a reasonable hour on a Friday (since getting here on a workday seems virtually impossible), and that you have to book at least a month in advance. Our server (who mentioned it was his first day), pretty much memorized the entire menu and specials it seemed, which was very impressive. Sadly, the restaurant didn't really live up to all the hype for me. I wasn't overly impressed with the food (although out of all the items we had, the lamb was definitely top notch and I really enjoyed the ice cream sundae for some reason), and it takes a long time to get your order. We had to wait to be seated even with a reservation and being on time, and then the items came out pretty slow. Granted, it was busy, but not teeming with people. Waiting for your table to be ready sort of defeats the purpose of arriving on time--but I'm sure if we were late there'd be another 30 minutes added on. Don't order anything but wine, beer, or some standard Lemon Drop-esque cocktail here either--I asked for something with bourbon and lemon; the waiter seemed pretty confident the bartender could make me something with that (there is a Gold Rush cocktail of bourbon, honey, and lemon that I have made and ordered out that is quite good and very simple to make), but literally came back with...you guessed it, a Lemon Drop--complete with a wedge of lemon in a martini glass and a sugar rim. I had to do a double take and confirm it was the "college freshman girl, get wasted on two while listening to Britney Spears and discussing Sex and the City" libation of choice. And sadly, it was. Big time letdown--but my own fault, you don't order drinks like that at restaurants not known for cocktails. The bathroom is also really far inside the cavernous venue; you have to walk down a long aisle and take an elevator (!) to get downstairs to the bathrooms. If you don't feel like walking, just hold it to build character.

Overall, glad I tried it, but not worth the wait time, average food (minus the items listed above), and subpar drinks.
author: Dan M.

description:
The service for a business lunch was very slow & unprofessional. Waiter poured sparkling water in a glass that already had regular water. We had to ask for butter with the bread. 5 people on the table and only 4 menus were given. I don't want to inconvenience my client by sharing a menu. 

Table was appropriate for 4 but was inconvenient for 5 persons. 

I'm actually upset because I called to confirm my reservation & clearly mentioned that it was a business lunch so was hoping for better service. 

Deserts were good.
author: Binita P.

description:
Wowza. I'm a bit sceptical when it comes to Greek restaurants in the Bay Area, mostly as the food is not what I would call authentic but rather a blend of Californian and Greek cuisine (Opa!) - nothing wrong with that, just not authentic. 

Kokkari exceeded my expectations. Everything from the beginning to leaving the restaurant was just superb. Service, ambiance, and the food. Greek, not fusion. Upon entering you'll notice the gracious dining room, and although packed the noise level was kept low. Largely because of the carpets on the wall and the warm, wooden interior.

We got the Baked Feta (Greek feta wood oven baked with tomato, capers & Metaxa brandy, $8), the Saghanaki (Pan fried Kefalograviera with lemon & oregano, $14), the Pacific Salmon (Pan roasted with black lentils & Kalamata olive, artichoke tapenade, $30), and the Lamb Souvlaki (Marinated lamb skewered with tomato, onion, lay leaf with chickpea salad, tzatziki & pita, $23). 

Minus half a star as the desert wasn't rocking our boat - the rice pudding was meh, and it was exchanged to a wonderful chocolate cake.

Apart from that, just wow.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Crowded but solid gourmet Greek fare. The lamb riblets appetizer is just about perfect.
author: Art K.
