description: Made dinner reservations 3 weeks and was really looking forward based on all the great reviews. Wine list may be one of the best around. Service was absolutely fantastic. Food was very ordinary. Pork was very dry and grilled fish was bit undercooked, still had that fishy aftertaste.
author: J P.

description: Warm and inviting restaurant in the heart of San Francisco. This was by far my favorite restaurant here. Being exposed to mediterranean dishes all my life, I had never tasted food this delicious. The appetizers are a must- especially the zucchini cakes with the yogurt dressing and the dipping pastes with warm zaatar pita. If you appreciate lamb, their grilled lamb chops are delicious.
author: Vahe T.

description: Great food and service! Came here for lunch but definitely be back for a dinner. Desserts are really big even for 4 people sharing!  Bring your fat wallet.
author: Troy W.

description:
At first glance Kokkari looks like a small restaurant at the corner of a quiet San Francisco street, but it's much more. Walking in I was surprised at the interior design; from wine glasses to intricate chairs the entire restaurant was decorated and buzzing with conversation. Walking to our chair I saw the demographic of mainly older folk enjoying fine wine with colorful and most likely very delicious food.

Sitting down near the kitchen we were bombarded with the aromatic scent of cooked lamb and wine. Our hostess, who was very kind and knowledgable, took us through the different items on the menu briefly but concisely describing each item. As someone who had never eaten Greek food before, our waiter drew attention to the specials and helped us narrow down what we would most likely like and helped us pair the right wine with our meal. 

When the food arrived it was amazing. The meat, which was cooked perfectly all throughout, and had a consistent and exotic flavor. The plating was very aesthetically pleasing and the large plates allowed for us to separate the bones and other inedible parts of our meal. The recommended wine was very nice and went well with our meal. 

Our desert, which was baclava and ice-cream, was and excellent way to end our meal. Receiving our bill we weren't surprised at the price but I would say that with the quality, service, meal, and consideration the staff gave us it was well worth it and would definitely come back and recommend this place for excellent greek cuisine.
author: Bhargava S.

description:
Those Greek names on the menu are always confusing. But when it comes to flavor and creativity, nothing can compare to Greek food. Even the cheese, they can do it fried, grilled, fresh, or marinated. I like the strong sheep cheese fried on a hot plate and when you squeezed a lemon on it, the whole cheese got sizzling. My favorite goes to the Greek yogurt with spiced walnut, dates and honey. Loved it. Never had such creamy yogurt and the sweetness balanced out nicely. 
Service was amazing. When our waiter was singing the menu, my mouth was watering.
author: Nancy W.

description:
I don't think there is one thing in this menu that isn't absolutely delicious. I highly recommend trying several appetizers. The lamb meatballs were the best, in my opinion. 

Main course we ordered the lamb chops which had nice flavor but sadly were room temp. The petrale soul was exquisite though. 

We ordered baklava ice cream for dessert which was very good. They have a fabulous wine list. 

Very nice ambiance. We came on a Saturday night and most men were wearing sports coats. And women were on the dressier side as well. I would say jeans and casual attire are not appropriate for this place. Although you won't be kicked out if you do favor a more casual outfit. Just go and enjoy the wonderful food. You won't be sorry!

The bill was hefty but we did order quite a bit of food including alcohol. Our server was one of the best we've had in a long time, maybe ever. 

Overall a great experience!
author: Rachel H.

description: Wonderful experience. Octopus, moussaka and service were amazing. I plan on returning and experiencing more items on the menu. Highly recommend!
author: L M.

description:
Let's just say that the saying you pay for what you get does not always hold truth. In fact, in this case I would say it's quite contrary. I would also say not only does the menu lack any real diversity, the staff also lacks manners and is also unfamiliar with diversity and etiquette. There was one true gentleman server there that evening and he shined liked a rockstar! He was Elton John, Elvis Presley and Michael Jackson all wrapped in one! The rest, they were DOA. 
One, you are in San Francisco. Excpect the unfamiliar. Two, sidewalks are public right of ways. Don't tell people they are infringing upon your space, especially when they are inevitability your unforeseen (or in this case) EXISTING diners, taking a break. YES, that was myself and my spouse you told us to move along while I was outside stretching my back from your most awful and uncomfortable chairs that were killing my back because I have a disability. Thank you. Maybe invest in some upgraded seats, to offset your meals or substatiate the cost vs Denny's Diner hardback seating. Your average appetizer is the cost of a meal at many restaurants. My soup and meal alone was roughly $65, withouth said appetizer of spanikopota and saginaki!
My spouse and I drove 3 hours to spend a significant day with family. We went there to enjoy our time specifically, not to be treated like I was in line waiting for ICE to be called and told to move along out front by Mr. Yellow/Tan Coat. I guess somehow free dessert made it all better. 
Three, if you don't want your customers inconvenienced by the ungodly sights and smells of the bay then the simple solution would be to move the seating away from the genereal vacinity of the FRONT DOOR. Orrrr invest in $2 air/vent freshener. Orrrr how about no false flags based on ethnic composition and precinceived notions?! No signs were being held that said will work for food or in need of help. And even if they were, you're in SF. Die hard liberal city, people don't care, remember??? 
ORRR DID IT HAVE TO DO WITH OUR ASIAN-NESS? OUR MIXED-NESSED??? OR WHAT??? BECAUSE THERE'S A 101 ISSUES WITH SF and that night, my husband and I were yours despite our family's bill being how much? I am going to guess in upwards of $600--$1000 plus #amiright? 
Yet you still received your three stars and tip. Care to disclose how much the tip was? It was beyond reasonable and fair! Amiright?! Much more than the humiliation that I deserved from the unidentified man in the yellow/tan coat (not our server). Maybe he needs to be evaluated. 
Thank you at least to the gentleman server for Accommodating  us and taking muliple pictures for my family as this was my Yia-Yia's 95th birthday! She may not remember it, but hopefully with us being able show her pictures she might at least have some short term memory of the dinner itself. At least the server was able to make her laugh and for that, I'm thanful and he alone earned his tip because that's no easy task these days. That's why there's three stars. Elton, 
Elvis, and Michael (all one and the same, you know who I'm talking about about, the one that stood on the chair for us! The tall older bald guy!!!The one with a great sense of humor! The white version of my hubby! The real MVP of the night! ) you earned 5 stars actually! Train the others maybe?! Hope you didn't have to share that tip. Sorry if you had to. You really earned it all on your own accord!
author: Andrea T.

description: I've never been much of Greek and medi food but we had done all other types over the past couple  days and wanted something different. So glad we decided on medi and specifically this place as it was delicious. My guest who has tried octopus one time and didn't like it even manned up enough to try their octopus and she loved it. Our other choices were the whole grilled fish and the lamb chops which is their specialty. They even divided the plate and added one more chip to make four so we could share. Great place and I'll definitely be back. Next time maybe I'll man up and ask the beautiful hostess to dinner. ‍
author: Khanh N.

description:
I went to this place with a group of 6. Reservations are a must. We got there at 5:45 on a Monday and it was already pretty full. Reservations from 6-8 were all taken when we tried to get in, several weeks beforehand.

Great food and service. Our waitress was extremely helpful, but not pushy. She clearly knew the menu very well, because she could list all of the ingredients of each dish we asked about and explained the cooking methods. My wife is gluten free, and the waitress walked her through the menu. We also had a nice wine recommendation.

The food was excellent. We had an order of dolmathes, Spanakotiropita  and pita with tzatziki sauce. I'm often hit and miss on dolmathes, but these had a flavor that mixed well... the mint and grape leaf flavors were there, but not overpowering. The spanakotiropita was done just right. The pita was thicker and more like sliced wheat bread than your traditional pita, but it was still good. The tzatziki sauce was also not overpowering.

For my meal, I had a lamb shoulder with orzo. The portion was huge, with the meat easily bigger than my fist. It was cooked perfectly, with the meat falling off the bone and able to be pulled apart without a knife. The orzo and sauce was a nice compliment to it. My one minor complaint, was that there was no vegetable with the meal, but with a portion that large, I did not miss it that much.

Others at my table were equally impressed by their meals. Two people had kebabs which were cooked perfectly. My father had the whole fish sea bass, which he said was one of the best he had ever had. Even my mother, who went with the somewhat boring roasted chicken, thought hers was very good.

Two minor warnings... one, get reservations well in advance. Two, the prices are fairly high, but for a nice meal, with good service, it's understandable.
author: Tom D.

description:
Lunch review. 

Saghanaki (Cheese) - 5/5
Moussaka (Lamb casserole) - 5/5
Lamb chops - 5/5
Galaktoboureko - 4/5

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
This review is way overdue! 

My last visit here was for my 5 year anniversary in January! 

I wanted to surprise my boyfriend and take him to one of my most favorite restaurants in San Francisco. 

He was extremely impressed with this place and loved everything about it, including the food, the ambiance, and the service. I had made a reservation some time in advance to make sure we had our spot secured, as this restaurant is very very popular and gets busy. 

 I also wanted him to try my favorite dishes, so we decided to go all out. 

We started with the Mezethes (Appetizers):

1. Octapodaki tou Yiorgou (Has a strong grilled taste, which brings out a very unique flavor in the octopus)
2. Peinirli (Very warm and tasty pita, with a great addition of fig, caramelized onions, and ricotta)
3. Kalamari (Can't go wrong with this dish because it's flavors are to die for. Had to put in a second order because it was so delicious)
4. Arnisia Plevrakia (The meat just comes off the bones and has the best seasoning)


For the Kirios Piato (Appetizers):

1. Arnisia Paidakia (The lamb chops were extremely juicy and had the perfect zest of lemon-oregano vinaigrette)
2. Kokinisto me Manestra (The most tender and full of flavor lamb shank that I've ever tried. The orzo was a perfect combination to the shank, as it added it's own flavor to the entire dish)

The Glyka (Dessert):

1. Galaktoboureko (The most exceptional dessert with filo dough and pistachio ice cream. This is a MUST TRY dessert when coming to this restaurant) 
2. Baklava (The mix of honey, walnuts, and ice cream is indescribable. Truly something incredible and succulent) 

Our 5 year anniversary dinner was unforgettable. There were so many exquisite dishes and there was superb service which made the evening even more magical. I can't wait to be back for some more mouthwatering foods!!
author: Julia K.

description:
We had a good dining experience. Staff was nice and helpful. Ordered the famous lamb chops per yelp recommendations. They were cooked perfectly but had no seasoning:( I'm disappointed. I had high hopes for this place and wanted to keep it in the permanent rotation of restaurants we visit regularly but unfortunately it won't be happening. 

2nd entree we ordered was the grilled seabass with chimichurri sauce. The sauce was excellent and the fish was cooked perfectly but there was so much oil floating around the fish!!! 

We enjoyed the appetizers: grilled lamb meatballs and some mixed pita appetizers with sauces. 

It was my husband's birthday and the waiter says "please pick a dessert. You have to!" When he said that we thought it was complimentary but nope! It was included in the bill lol. For the price we paid for this mediocre meal, least they could've done is include complimentary dessert.
author: N G.

description:
The food and wine was great, ambiance was classy, but there's something superficial about this place. For one, I didn't appreciate the arrogance of the manager when I walked into the restaurant--no smile, and looked me up and down like I just interrupted his conversation. Where's the Greek hospitality? 

Food:
APPETIZERS
- Complementary table bread: Sourdough I believe, but I skipped this to make room for the real food lol 
- Grilled octopus: delicious. Very tender, great with a squirt of lemon on top. I definitely recommend for an appetizer. 
- Arnisia Plevrakia (lamb riblets): tender and flavorful. Came with 5 I think. The plating was well done. Great starter to have.
MAIN COURSE
- Psari psito ( grilled whole fish): I chose sea bass, but there's also a sea bream option. Again, very tasty, well made. I love that they give you steamed lemon to squeeze over the fish, it really enhances the flavor. Also comes with some streamed veggies.  I would try the sea bream next time. 
- Arnisia Paidakia (lamb chop): comes with 3, but they can add 1 more lamb chop if you're planning to share to make it fair. I would say do it if that's the main course for you. But otherwise, 3 lamb chops is perfectly enough to satisfy your lamb craving, especially if you're ordering other dishes as well. Very juicy, and well seasoned. I highly enjoyed this, and slightly man-handled my lamb chop. I definitely recommend this. 

WINE:I love Greek wine! Red or white, it doesn't matter. They are all so aromatic. White with fish, red with lamb? Or mix it up. Just get a glass! 

Overall: The food is delicious. I would return again, hopefully to friendlier and more gracious staff.
author: Cindy H.

description: Excellent meal and service. I have been for dinner twice and it's definitely a permanent member of my must visit list when in town for business. The Octopus appetizer and Lamb Chops are outstanding!
author: Robert L.

description:
Kokkari has never disappointed us and we have been dining with them for about 10 years. My 2 cousins are staying with us from Egypt so we decided to show them our favorite restaurant! They loved the food and of course they loved Max (our server) as much as we do. He ALWAYS wows our dining experience and he is one of the best servers they have! We've been going there forever so he even knows us by name. We've celebrated tons of birthdays at Kokkari and they always go above and beyond to make your birthday (or any occasion) special!
Their food is always 5 stars and we have never had anything that we did not enjoy. They have the best smelt and riblets! I usually opt for their lamb shank or goat stew if they have it as a special. DELICIOUS as always!
Thank you Kokkari, you will always be my favorite restaurant =))
author: Nari M.

description: I've been to this restaurant twice. Every time I've been there the service has been absolutely impeccable. During my last experience our waiter was fabulous. I really wish I could remember his name because he was that good. The food was fine and I had no complaints about my meal. I live in close proximity to the restaurant and would probably dine more often if I appreciated the style of cuisine more. However I can't hold that against a place. If you're looking for Greek food in San Francisco this restaurant should be high on your priority list. I couldn't see anyone walking away disappointed.
author: Robert C.

description:
Kotopoulo Souvlas ($19.95) - rotisserie roasted half chicken with lemon, oregano potatoes - Chicken was very moist and flavorful.  It was a generous portion even though it was only half a chicken.

Dolmathes - grape leaves stuffed with rice, dill & mint (9.00) - My vegan friend enjoyed this. 

Gigantes - oven baked giant beans with tomato sauce, olive oil & herbed feta (11.95) - My vegan friend enjoyed this. 

Lentil Soup -with vegetables & braised greens (9.50) - My vegan friend enjoyed this. 

Lamb Souvlaki - lamb skewered with tomato, onion, bay leaf with chickpea salad, tzatziki & pita (25.25) - My friend enjoyed this dish.  

Kataifi - It was delightfully moist and custard-like with every bite.  Topped with crushed pistachios, Kataifi ended my palate with a sweet finishing touch!  layers of custard and stuff that look like cheese (but no cheese) bonus point for not being to sweet  uniquely textured shredded phylloh dough, honey, custard, and whipped cream.

It's the dessert that looks like the bottom layer is a bed of crispy noodles. it's rich but not heavy, with just a hint of sweetness, and a nice finishing crunch from the shredded pastry. It really hits all the nice textural notes that an ideal dessert should have.


Ouzo Sorbet - Blood orange & ouzo sorbet with mixed seasonal citrus - Very strong licorice flavor.  I personally wasn't a fan because I don't like licorice. 

In a previous post, I said I would never come back.  Well, I'm biting my words because the food & service was excellent.
author: Candice H.

description: One of the best restaurants in the city and you must have a reservation (unless you get a seat at the bar which is like winning the lottery because it's not likely)! It's hard to get a reservation on OpenTable (which only allows you to make a reservation 30 days in advance) but you can actually call 60 days in advance and make one. We've gone now 2 times and have stuck with their signature items because they are amazing. The octopus, lamb chops, and Branzino - you can't go wrong! If you are into espresso after your meal, go for their Greek form of it and check out how it's made!
author: Natalie O.

description:
I had a great experience at Kokkari probably due to the fact I was wearing a wedding dress when I walked in, post my civil ceremony. 

The wait staff was courteous and directed me to the table where my family was already seated. We ordered a couple of things to share family style including the Greek salad, spanakopita (filo with spinach and feta), moussaka, grilled octopus and lamb chops. I can't complain about a single thing. Well maybe... the portions were a little small but I can't complain too much. 

As a huge fan of Mediterranean food I was so happy just eating the food here. The service was impeccable and the food was prepared perfectly. It also helps that my family enjoyed the food too and were singing praises about it the whole day. 

It is a little expensive for what you get, it's definitely not a hearty hearty meal but if you want good food and you have a not so big appetite I highly recommend this place, especially for special occasions.
author: Eunah T.

description: wonderful！Very Greek and special one. I like the butter. There are many desserts I haven't seen from the menu, but actually their styles look nice.
author: Xin L.

description: I was sorely disappointed when revisiting this place for dinner in April.  The Greek salad consisted of large chunks of cucumber, with hardly a tomato, onion, or olive to be found.  Other disappointments included the octopus (about six pieces), saghanaki (had congealed by the time it arrived), and spanikopita (very small).  It seems like they're resting on their laurels and do not care to cater to anyone but tourists who won't be back.  I certainly won't be back.
author: Allen S.

description:
Beautiful. 
Great service. 
Simple, yet delicious food. 

What I tried:

Grilled Octopus
Grilled Meatballs
Grilled Lamb Chops
Koulourakia- Assorted dessert platter

Just writing and thinking about these makes me want to go back ASAP! Everything was seasoned just right. The appetizers and entrees were full of flavor. I loved the desserts too. We fought over everything on the assorted dessert platter. There was one more dessert we loved, but I can't remember its name. It's like a just-baked pound cake and they topped it with strawberries. So good!

The interiors are beautiful. I would live in that space in a heart beat! 

Our waiter was extremely warm and personable. He made us feel like family. The only glitch came with our neighboring diners (who were seated after us). The weather on this particular day was just perfect (especially for a South Florida resident); a crisp breeze, but not too cold at all. We requested to be seated by one of the windows to be able to enjoy it. On pretty days it seems like they keep them opened. This diner kept closing my window and I became increasingly annoyed after it happened several times. It was ridiculous considering she had a sweater draped over her shoulders. Here's an idea, ya cold? Put on your darn sweater! I eventually had to play the snitch and our waiter had to tell them to keep the window open and offered them another table. They said no and instead continued to glare us down. Oh well...why wear a sweater solely as an accessory? But I digress...

So in love with everything about Kokkari. Care to open up in South Florida? Pretty please? 
I can't wait to return.
author: Brenda P.

description: Loved the food and ambiance. Having been raised around Greeks, I was excited to see a menu of non-stereotypical items.
author: Suzie K.

description:
I always have a great meal when I come here. I've been here 3 times and each time has been spectacular. The food is delicious, the service is impeccable, and the ambiance is top class. My one drawback is that you have to take a slow elevator downstairs to use the bathroom. :O

Most recently I had the Lamb Souvlaki, which has a perfect portion size but of course I wanted more. I didn't actually go through all of the fava bean salad and yogurt because I could have done with another whole skewer - but of course I was super full anyway. 

The prices are expensive but fair given the care given to the dishes. We had both a sausage special appetizer as well as the octopus appetizer which whet our appetite incredibly but also made sure that we were full at the end. Definitely should include appetizers to round out the meal.

Love to come back any time. :)
author: Alex K.

description:
Kokkari is definitely a top-notch Greek restaurant located in the financial district of SF. The restaurant is very fancy and the service is pretty amazing. Sadly this review might be a little biased as I'm not a huge fan of Greek cuisine. Came with a group of friends (7 in total) for dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday.

First of all, there is unlimited bread refills and the bread is pretty solid. I love bread so this was definitely a highlight.

We had some appetizers to share:
- Peinirli (stuffed pita): meh, I got a pretty small piece on the side so didn't get much of the stuffed filling, so it just tasted like a plain pita with some arugula.
- Saganaki: was not a fan of this, fried cheese was pretty heavy and definitely didn't suite my tastes.
- Spanakopita: spinach pieces. Again hard to split so just got a small bite. Was good but I couldn't really tell the difference between that and ones I could get from Trader Joe's.
- Octopus: very good, had a good smoked flavor and the meat was tender.
- Crispy Smelt: wow, this was pretty amazing: the smelt was just so crispy and went with the tartar like sauce so well, it was pretty addicting to eat.
- Pita with various dips: the pita was very solid and fresh. There was a dip that had a cod roe based flavor that was incredibly good (and went so well with the regular bread).

Then we also shared some entrees:
- Moussaka: I feel like this is pretty staple for Greek cuisine but unfortunately it was way too heavy for me.
- Grilled lamb skewer: lamb was very juicy and tender. Also only got to try a small bite.
- Roasted chicken: decent, chicken was tender but a bit bland.
- Braised lamb shank with orzo: wonderful, the lamb shank was just so tender it just falls off the bone. The orzo makes for a good pairing.
- Lamb riblets: again very tender, lamb had a good gamy taste.

Overall, the food experience was unique as I'm not familiar with Greek cuisine but it was a bit of mixed bag of ups and downs.
author: Alvin W.

description:
This was a pleasant experience. I wasn't expecting anything less based on the previous reviews. Service was outstanding, food and drinks exceptional. It's a thru gem of San Francisco especially for the ones who likes Greek cuisine. I'm recommending it to everyone. Make sure to book reservation days ahead for the weekend. 
Cheers!
author: Janos A.

description:
Service

Our server was named Johnny. You may already have a favorite Kokkari server but if you do, trust me, ask for Johnny. Not only is he the most knowledgeable server I have ever had the pleasure of knowing, his attention to detail was superb, his understanding of the food immeasurable and the phrase "he's a cool dude" was made for him. It is unbelievable that he is a newcomer to Kokkari. It was a pleasure meeting Johnny.

Food

The food was nothing short of spectacular. The arnisia plevrakia (grilled lamb riblets) fell off the bone and melted in my mouth. How the hell can a chef do that? The lentil and vegetable soup was unique and tasty, The grilled whole fish was to die for and the presentation artistic and the pan roasted halibut steak was cooked to perfection. This is one place where you can believe the hype. The folks doing the cooking at Kokkari can flat out "throw down."

To be fair I want to point out two SMALL items of concern 

Confirmation Personnel

My latest visit to Kokkari was November 7, 2017. I have been to Kokkari many times and just love the place. Today, I have a suggestion: If confirming reservations frustrates your employees, allow us to confirm on-line or via email. On November 7, 2017 at 3:11 pm I received my fourth call about confirming. The other calls occurred last Sunday. I immediately stated my name and I said I was confirming. After a brief hold I was asked "is your reservation for Thursday?" I said no today Tuesday at 6:00 pm. The lady responded: "contrary to popular opinion we do not have the reservation list memorized." I said, I was just trying to confirm. I received four calls, and twice when I returned the call to confirm the phone rang and never went to a voicemail.  The lady replied- "Well, I do not know about that," to which I said, "Good Day" and hung up. You were just named a top twenty U.S. restaurant by Trip Advisor, come on now, you should all be happy!  Initial impressions and words matter!.
Dress Code
I am not asking for shirts and ties, spatterdashes, or dresses but I would also consider a semi-dress code. Salesforce employees and other "not ready for the world" twenty-somethings took bar area of the restaurant yesterday and there was overflow bordering the dining area. Some people do not understand restaurant attire; I get that. San Francisco is an anything goes city; I get that. That said, patrons who spend over two hundred dollars minimum on dinner for two are entitled to more. I saw folks wearing reverse baseball caps, ratty jeans and tee-shirts. This attire is beneath this August restaurant. Patrons at tables on both sides of us commented. I know, things have changed but can we make a couple of exceptions? I do not think it too much to require folks to wear a collared shirt or mock turtleneck.
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
One of the most memorable meals I've ever had in my life. The traditional Greek food tastes like my own Yia Yia cooked it herself. I brought my family here for a celebration and everyone was thrilled with the experience, even my gluten-free, non-red-meat-eating cousin. I don't remember everything we had, but I can recall squid, lamb, and chicken. Every dish was perfectly seasoned, cooked to perfection, and incredibly flavorful. The appetizers alone were mind-blowing! And then came the desert...

Look, just eat here when you get the chance. It's not the cheapest restaurant, so save it for a special occasion. You won't be disappointed!
author: Matthew P.

description:
This is my favorite place in the city. Classy, elegant and yet you feel at home. I enjoy the menu and wine selections. In fact I have a hard time leaving Kokkari as interesting people gather together for lunch or midday, happy hour or after work. Wonderful infectious energy. 
Looking for a venue for group dinners ? They have several to choose from - and you won't be disappointed. High class service and menu. You might get a glimpse of a celebrity or two.
author: Ana Lucia N.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for years and finally got the chance to come for an anniversary dinner!

The food is stellar. I'll have a breakdown below.

The service was great, but not top-notch, or at least, it wasn't for me. The hostess in the front seemed very cold and when we asked her to take a picture of us at the end before we left, she seemed like she didn't want to and acted like she didn't know what to do and handed my phone off to a waiter that was walking by to take a pic of us instead. Awkward?!?

I also put that it was our anniversary dinner on our reservation. Both our hostess and waiter never acknowledged it, which is FINE. I know a restaurant isn't obligated to celebrate with you for events. But it was just weird when we opted to not have dessert after perusing the dessert menu, and then he was just like, "No celebratory dessert?!" "Nah.. we're pretty stuffed." "Really?!" Uhh.. way to make it awkward!

The dinner service in itself was fine. Attentive, but not overbearing. Overall, very good but those 2 events just kinda left me feeling.. weird.

FOOD:
COMPLIMENTARY BREAD - YUM! Slightly sour, soft, fluffy and chewy on the inside, with a nice crusty exterior. I'm not sure where it's from, maybe Acme?

STARTERS:
I was reading that people thought the apps were kind of small, so we ordered three starters between 2 of us. We were pleasantly surprised! I thought the starters were pretty big and good to share between 3 or 4 people! 

MARCHES TIGANITES / FRIED SMELT: OMG. 5 stars. Better than French fries. OK, OK, maybe not better. Totally different, but on the same ranking as delicious scale. Heaping portion. I don't even like fish, but this was one of my favorite dishes of the night. ALSO: for the curious, no, these didn't have bones or really any fishy flavor. That's probably why I liked it.

PEINIRLI / STUFFED PITA: 5 stars again! The pita was so fluffy and soft on the inside but had a pretzel-like crust. A little grainy, and you could taste the ricotta, feta, and garlic equally. SO GOOD.

SPITZPILAOA  LAMB MEATBALLS: 4 stars. I like my meatballs a bit more soft and slightly crumbly when biting into it. These were quite dense! But the sauce it came with was divine! It would make a bomb spaghetti.. I know this is Greek food.. but damn, it really would make a really good spaghetti!! The Greek yogurt was a perfect contrast to the savory meatball and the tomato sauce!

ENTREES:
We got the two specials of the day because it sounded so good! It was a Monday, so we got:

A pork chop attached with pork belly which is roasted over their fire, along with potatoes which cooks in all those drippings.. 4 stars.  The potatoes which soaked up all the yummy pork fat... MMM, artery clogging goodness. Could have been browner, but I'm not gonna complain. The pork chop was very lean, so it was a little tough. The darker meat, the crusty parts, and the pork belly were DELICIOUS though! Wish it came with more pork belly. It tasted better the next day when I had a clear palette and wasn't too stuffed from eating all the entrees. 

Goat stew - 5 stars! The bed of orzo with the goat stew was creamy and perfect to go with the goat stew. Makes me want to accompany all my saucey type dishes with orzo!  The goat stew was delicious, and not too gamey. This smelled and tasted even better the next day.

I would return again to try their lamb chops for the entree, and more starters! Would definitely definitely get the smelt again!
author: Emily C.

description: We brought a customer to Kokkari. My co-founder had booked for 1:30pm for 2 people, and we turned up at 12:30 with 3 people. The host could not have been more helpful, seated us anyway despite the place being packed, and could not have been more professional. The food is wonderful, especially their fish specials. Deserts were awesome too.
author: Sam A.

description:
It's definitley one of the best restaurants in SF. The ambiance is amazing. 
The service is great. For appetizer we had Dolmathes and Arnisia Plevrakia. For food we had Kokinisto me Manestra and Arnisia Paidakia . They were perfect. We had Kokkari Sundae for the dessert, and it was as great as everything.
author: Ashkan H.

description: Great food and ambience. I have been here for our anniversary dinner and everything seemed great. Lamb chops here are amazing!!!
author: Laxmi V.

description:
Holy awesome octopus, Batman! 

Kokkari is delicious. Hands down! I came here for a work lunch and loved it from start to finish - ambience, service, appetizers, bread, entreé, and so on. We went a little crazy with the appetizers since we were pretty hungry, but we had the octopus, fried cheese thing, meatballs and one other thing I can't remember right now. I probably can't remember because everything was so good and inhaled on sight. 

Since I indulged in the appetizers, I opted for the octopus salad since it was one of their lighter options. Good choice on my part! I loved the octopus appetizer, and this was almost the same thing, but more meat and greens. 

We paaaes on dessert, but did indulge in some cappuccinos to help stir us back to life. I'm so impressed and can't wait to come back!
author: Jessica M.

description: 4.5/5. As most of the time... yelp is dead on with reviews it's crazy. Not much of a Greek food eater but this place is elite. Melted cheese app was delicious. Very similar to an Argentine dish called provoletta. Had lamb chops for main course and among the best lamb I've had anywhere. Great decor as well.
author: J P.

description: Nice place. Pretty formal. Tough to get reservations. My wife and I both had the lamb chops which are the best ever. Comes with potatoes wedges. Greek salad was excellent.
author: C W.

description:
The BEST Greek restaurant in the Bay Area, hands down. The food is authentic and the staff is very attentive. I used to work down the street and often went for lunch. Literally everything on the menu is amazing. 

My favorites are the gigantes, kolokithokeftethes, saghanaki, both soups, horiatiki salalta, moussaka and rotisserie chicken. I'm not a big lamb fan, but if you are definitely get it. They roast it nightly to perfection.

Try to get a seat in the front room by the fireplace for the best atmosphere.
author: Demi T.

description: OH.MY.GOSH! Everything was delicious. I cannot say one bad thing about this place. It was perfect start to finish. Can't wait to come back.
author: Kel H.

description:
I heard so many good things about this restaurant that I probably got my hopes too high. I went for lunch and got the zucchini cakes (good but no remarkable) and the octopus salad (on the mediocre side, octopus chewy and salad itself basic in terms of ingredients and dressing).
Prices very high, especially for what you get....lamb may be extraordinary but I do not have read meat and, anyways, for this type of reputation, there should be a number of memorable dishes...
author: VIORICA C.

description:
My girlfriend and I  are in San Francisco for the week on vacation and this was one of the places we definitely wanted to try. We had booked a reservation for 10:30 p.m on a Saturday, but luckily someone had cancelled and we were moved up to the 9:30 slot. 

For a salate I started with a traditional Greek salad: Cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, pepper, and feta. Simple yet so delicious. It was a light way to open up the meal. We shared the grape leaves stuffed with rice. It had a slight minty note to it. Both were 5/5

Wine: I enjoyed a glass of chardonnay as well as a pinot noir. Fairly priced and absolutely delicious

Dinner: I was told by our waitress the goat stew is only seasonal, and if able it is something I must order. The goat was slow cooked to perfection. It was accompanied by some orzo. 

I would give this place a 5/5. From the food to the service it was amazing!! Definitely recccomend.
author: Marc C.

description: Our last visit was in 2012. I have always wanted to return. So we took the opportunity on the day we were in town. Our friend, Valerie, was available because her school was closed to the wildfires. We decided to go the mezes route and ordered a lot of different things. The saganaki and the grilled octopus were both fantastic. The latter was tender and not rubbery. We also had three spreads: tzatsiki, favosalata, and taramosalata. The last was the best. All were served with fresh pita. We also tried the lamb souvlaki. It was wonderful. Our server, Todd, took excellent care of us. We had two different wines and Greek coffee. Even the desserts were delicious! This is one of the best places around!
author: Nobbi L.

description: Great food, huge space, comfortable seatings and attentive service. Love the grilled octopus even though the portion is kind of small, we had the fried smelt it was flavorful too. Huge salad for ten something dollars, and the grilled fish is authentic. I would expect a larger bill for the overall experience!
author: Charmie L.

description:
Kokkari and Evvia are both delicious. The lamb is the staple dish here but as others have noted if you have a big appetite the portions are on the small side.  The fish sea bass and halibut are very good as well. 

Sides and desserts are solid as well.

For those that like to eat Steak! Yes I know the Estiatorio's aren't technically Steakhouses but their signature dish is Lamb so I threw them in this list. 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Icecream/Chocolate, Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Bay Area SteakhouseRankings: 
1 House of Prime Rib
2 Evvia Estiatorio 
3 Harris 
4 Espetus
5 Alexanders
6 Kokkari Estiatorio
7 Texas Roadhouse
8 Sundance
9 Pampas
10 5A5 Steak Lounge 
11 Prime 109
12 Scott's Seafood Grill
13 Ruth Chris
14 Outback
15 Horatio's
16 Papillon
author: Rod M.

description:
Wowza is this how they eat in their home country?? My goodness it's delicious! We were fortunate enough to have a table beside the rotisserie and enjoyed watching the chicken and ducks being orchestrated appropriately. 

Excellent customer service from start to finish and you can tell this restaurant has been around awhile because they know what they're doing.

We ordered the crispy smelt-bomb!, the feta appetizer-bombalicious!, lamb chops-bomb.com!, the special duck-bombtastic!, baklava-actually this had one too many nuts for me but still good and the special dessert that was almost cheesecake like on top with phyllo on the bottom-the real highlight for me!

We also ordered a Sancerre bottle of wine to accompany everything and it was perfect. 

Good date spot, but better have some dough available, just saying...

See you again sometime soon!
author: Guisela L.

description:
Octopus, musaka, champagne, dessert and amazing service.
We enjoyed sitting at the bar.
Everyone knows this is the best in town.
author: Anna M.

description:
I honestly wasn't a huge fan of lamb until I tried it at Kokkari!
One day I was in the area by myself around the lunch time and just decided to walk in and dine.
I ordered gigantes for starter, and even though I was little hesitant, I decided to try lamb souvlaki since I was at a mediterranean restaurant... and I instantly fell in love with this lamb dish! (Gigantes was great too but I knew I'd like it) Like woah, I cannot believe I almost decided that I didn't like lamb!! 
Everyone at the restaurant was very friendly and the server was quick and attentive.
After trying this place, I discovered Evvia which is much closer to where I live and which I've been visiting more frequently. Later I found out that they are sister restaurants. (No wonder!)
When I'm in the city and in the mood for some great lamb dish, I will definitely go here.
Thanks for opening a whole another world of lamb for me, Kokkari!!
author: Hyemin J.

description: I've been there couple of times and each time i got so satisfied, octopus appetizer was so delicious. For dinner lamb chop is my favorite but also lamb stew with goat cheese on top was awesome thanks to the waitress for explained that for us
author: Mehrnaz G.

description:
Everyone talks about the lamb here and I love lamb so I knew I had to try the lamb! I got that to share among 3 of us and they were nice enough to split it up into 3 plates since we said we were sharing (for an extra charge they didn't tell us about, of course). I thought it was pretty good. It was cooked pretty well, and the lemon wedge was really good with it, but I thought it could have used more seasoning or sauce of some sort. My mom makes rosemary lamb chops at home and I thought they were better. Don't get me wrong, it was still good, but I would have rather had my mom make them because my mom is that good . The potatoes that came with it were delicious! We also go the pork belly app which was good. It had peaches on top which added a nice sweetness and I really enjoyed it. We also go the watermelon with feta on top. The watermelon was perfect in texture and in sweetness. The feta added a nice saltiness contrast to it. Since we had room for dessert, we got 2 of them to share. I loved the baklava. It had the perfect combination of flaky, sweet, nutty and sweet. We also got the birds nest dessert (not on menu) and it was pretty good except I wish it had been sweeter.

Overall, it was a good meal with nice ambiance. The presentation of the dishes are beautifully plated as well. I personally wouldn't come back for the lamb since I like my mom's, but I would recommend it if you don't have a mom who can cook really good lamb.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
There are some restaurants you visit and never forget... Kokkari is one of them. This was hands down one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. From the ambiance, to the food, to the service, everything was spot on.

To start, we asked the server for his favorite appetizers. He brought us the artichokes, stuffed squid and the zucchini cakes. Each dish was absolutely delicious and seriously not to be missed. For entrees we each ordered something different. Most of the men in my group ordered meat so I can not comment on their dishes but my seafood "paella" was absolutely delicious. Instead of rice the dish used orzo which was a unique touch and simply delicious. 

100% recommend this restaurant, but be sure to make reservations well in advance as it's poppin!!
author: Rebecca D.

description:
I was searching for a great place like this for a special family dinner, this place made my trip to SF.
Waiters are amazing, they're all on the right place. Understand what the customer like, perfect taste & recommendations and artistic place.
I really respect a place where the waiters understand what we don't eat or can't have in our food, and he recommended us the dishes that we ordered and the dessert too and everything was just perfect not a single mistake. 
I'm not from the town and I didn't know that it's better to wear a suit not just a casual dress for this place. I added the pictures of our dishes it's a garlic butter shrimp which is great for appetizer, lamp chops and Seabass fish. As I always do give my stomach a time to see how it would act with the food and it's really perfect no aches like other restaurants which I can say it's great!
author: Mishari A.

description:
Kokkari is one of my favorite greek restaurants in SF! Shoutout to my favorite server MAX!! He was awesome! Great service, attitude, and super helpful. Honestly all the staff here is pretty great. The food was cooked perfectly, everything is fresh, and you will not be disappointed. I also love how they wood-oven roasted some of their meals too. I've been to Kokkari a few times and its always been a great experience! 

Things I ordered:
- Kolokithokeftethes: crispy zucchini cakes with cucumber & mint-yogurt dressing 
- Octapodaki tou Yiorgou: grilled octopus with lemon, oregano & olive oil 
Marithes Tiganites: crispy smelts with garlic-potato skordalia & lemon 
- Soutzoukakia: grilled lamb meatballs with spiced tomato sauce & Greek yogurt 
- Psari sto Fourno: wood-oven roasted with Yukon Gold potatoes, scallions &avgolemono
author: Jenn L.

description:
4.5 stars. Several of my friends had already been to Kokkari (multiple times) and I felt like I was missing out, so I made reservations for six on an early Saturday evening. Reservations can be difficult to come by, especially since they're only available one month prior online and two months prior over the phone. We booked for a 5:30 PM dinner which worked out great, considering we continuously ate and drank for 2-2.5 hours.

My boyfriend and I arrived first, and we were able to get seated while waiting for everyone else. Fantastic service upon arrival and throughout our dinner. We allowed our Greek friend (and Kokkari regular) to do all the ordering, and what an incredible feast we had!

For starters, we ordered a BUNCH of appetizers. My favorites were the grilled octopus and dolmathes, which are the grapes leaves stuffed with rice, dill & mint. Others at my table most enjoyed the crispy zucchini cakes and beets. Separate dishes. And of course you MUST get grilled pita and dips for the table. Everything tastes so fresh, it's amazing.

Once we were stuffed with appetizers, wine, and some Greek liquor, the main courses came out. Our friend ensured that we each got some of the lamb chops and ribeye. The lamb chops had this simple lemon-oregano vinaigrette that complemented the natural flavor of the meat, while the ribeye was accompanied by braised greens and potatoes which you can't miss out on. Would recommend both!

And because dessert belongs in a different stomach, we shared a few items that I can't remember because I was so deep into a food coma and didn't write anything down. I believe we had the Greek yogurt and Greek doughnuts. Well anyways, everything was fantastic. 

I'm not sure how my friend affords to eat here regularly, both in money and time. You seriously need to plan your Kokkari trips in advance, but it's totally worth it. The wait staff members are friendly and helpful, until you overstay your welcome, at which point they will stare you down. The food though... Incredible flavors and portions. I can't wait until the next time I come here and bring other friends!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Excellent service! Beautiful location inside 
All apps, entrees, and desserts were excellent 
Good size portions for price
author: H K.

description: We visited this place for our anniversary and both of us were very excited to finally eat here. We've lived in the city for over 15 years and have eaten at some very amazing places, making it a point to try as many restaurants as possible. This however was a major let down. I'm honestly shocked that the reviews are so popular for this restaurant. I expected much more from all of their dishes. We started off with the house bread and some champagne. The bubbly was good, but the house bread resembled something bought at a Safeway store, nothing special. Next we had their traditional house salad. Again the salad could have been prepared by myself in 5 min and resembled produce from a low end grocery store. I expected for that price a much higher quality tomato, since it was the main veggie in the dish. Tomato was bland and a bit unripe. For our mains we both took recommends from the waitress and were very let down. We ordered the pork loin and goat stew. The pork loin was way over cooked and dry, as well as glutinously large. Barely ate any of it. The goat stew was not a stew, but more of a rice dish. The meat was very stringy and jiggly along with the rice very oily. We did not finish our dinners, nor take them home. After paying $180 we left very puzzled. Perhaps we just ordered the wrong dishes. The waitstaff were lovely and the atmosphere nice, but food very average for the price.
author: Kristy S.

description:
Hmmm, we arrived here at around 9:45/10pm at night. At this point, we were so famished and tired from the long trek from SoCal to NorCal and visiting the beautiful Hearst Castle grounds, I thought anything would have tasted absolutely amazing and beyond anything our taste buds had ever experienced in the Greek food world.

We thought we could wait but about 20-minutes in, I had to go bug the maitre'd and luckily she seated us 10-15 minutes early. During the waiting time we used the restroom, which was so interestingly downstairs, you get to it by using an elevator. Getting sidetracked...

Our waiter barely attended to us and scarcely made any recommendations. Dining at 10pm apparently has the customer service gone out the door, at least from our male waiter. He was the guy hosting the table right next to the fireplace. Other staff seemed quite pleasant with a female host escorting my gal friend to the restroom. 

After asking for recos, he told us it was all about the lamb chops. My friend asked his reco on the chicken or lamb and he told her they were equally good. She was later quite pissed but did not say anything cause she's super polite and positive. But at $35 for this chicken, it should have tasted better or he could have helped her in the direction of ordering the lamb because she was not happy with her entree one bit.

Backing up a bit, they were out of the lamb riblets appetizer, so we ordered the famous zucchini app (it was pretty good but also very small) and the octopus. The octopus was not worth it for $17 as we could not finish it since it was so charred it was mostly burned. If our waiter had been more attentive, he might have asked what was wrong with the octopus that so many others were raving about--the only excuse I could give is that it was so late, the kitchen staff must have gotten tired and burned our food.

My boyfriend ordered the moussaka which had a nice eggplant cheese covering to it which nicely accompanied what seemed like ground beef. It was like shepherds pie without the corn, potatoes, peas, or carrots and a eggplants creme fraiche covering. It was ok. Noone was in love with it. They could've done something better about the presentation of this dish.

The lamb shank was the only really good dish. It was huge!!! The Kokkari potatoes complemented the dish well but not sure why they were coined Kokkari potatoes, they weren't out of this world either. 

Everyone was underwhelmed and we will likely not return. It's incredible that despite the fact that we were starving, the food did not knock our socks off.
author: Kristen Q.

description: I had high hopes for this place. Sadly the food did not impress, but the service is excellent here. We had a reservations for 9:45pm and had to wait a while until we were seated. Ordered the octopus, calamari, saginaki, and the fish special of the night, which was branzino wood oven roasted. The octopus was fresh, but I felt the pieces were sliced a little too thick. The calamari was too salty. Saginaki was just ok. The branzino was ok. it was fresh, but not freshly killed in the last few hours. The sides with the roasted persimmons were pretty good though.  For dessert, i had the baklava ice cream, which was ok too. Overall, the food is just ok here, but good service.
author: Lisa T.

description: The restaurant is huge and very classy and elegant...we ordered six starters but the most memorable was the live uni, the entrees were good but our server Jillian was spectacular.
author: Amy H.

description:
The first time I went here I got the lamb chops since I was told that was one of their best dishes. It didn't disappoint, they were cooked perfectly. It came with French fry wedges. These were incredible and I would come back for these. We also got a dessert special of the day, I can't remember what it was called but it had pistachio crumbles with multiple layers of cream and filo dough. Very delicious. We didn't get any appetizers or wine just cocktails. My cosmo was great and my husbands old fashioned was made very well. 

Service was on point and we never were left waiting or hanging. I made reservations on open table pretty easily, just a couple of weeks in advance. 

The other time I came here for work, I got the Monday special which was good but not as good as the lamb chops. This time we also got the Tzatziki, Favosalata and Tirokafteri with grilled pita trio, it was huge and delicious. You could definitely share this with a part of 4 or more. 

This spot caters to the business, local, and special occasion crowd. You can dress up or down, I would say it's business casual. They do have a room downstairs you can rent for private parties as well. 

Best spot in town for Greek food.
author: Mal L.

description:
I recently went back to Kokkari. It is a challenge to even get a reservation at this quite popular Estatorio.  It is easy to see why.   Everything, literally everything, on this menu is excellent....flavorful, excellently prepared and delivered.  

On this evening we ordered the appetizer, Tzatziki and Tirokafteri with housemade grilled pita, which is two kinds of dipping sauces with the warm and thick pita bread.  And also a single Horiatiki - the classic Greek salad of tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, oregano, olives & feta.  Both were yum yum yum and was perfect for the three of us.  

Then we went a lamb binge and ordered all three of the variations on the menu.  I had the rotisserie of the day..lamb cooked in the dining room fireplace.  We watched them carry the entire roasted lamb from the fireplace in the first dining room to the open kitchen.  The plate came with three cuts--the shoulder, leg shank and rib.  I also had the must have kokkari potatoes (made with seasoning and lemon--incredible).  That would have been spectacular if not for the lamb skewer and the lamb chops also ordered at my table.   Both were really, really great, but i would say the chops were quite spectacular and I would consider that a must have if you are only going to be here once.

We ordered a Stolpman Sangiovese which was truly one of the finest I have ever had--round and mellow ($70 on the menu).  They have a great worldly wine list here as well.  

For dessert we had the also must have Baklava Ice Cream.  This is inventive and super tasty.  We ordered two kinds of ouzo as well.  The Katsouros Ouzu is a bit mellower than ouzos are usually and I recommend that to go with the sweet.  

I have eaten at Kokkarri over a dozen times over the years and I have never had anything that wasn't delicious and wonderful.  This is truly one of the finest restaurants in the country--the only other one I have been that operates at this level of service, food and ambiance is Commanders Palace in NOLA.  This is truly as good as it gets.

However, be prepared to pay for the experience.  The bill for three people was $325, plus a $50 tip.
author: James S.

description: The hype on this place is real! My date and I tried the seasonal appetizer of lamb tongues and I thought it was fantastic, especially since it was my first time having it. He ordered the ribeye and I got the lamb chops (of course), and the ribeye was just okay. Luckily, my lamb chops were just as amazing as the reviewers mention! This would be the restaurant that I felt safe trying different things, especially if it's lamb.
author: Tien N.

description: This is one of the best restaurants in the world. We had the pita bread with babaganoush, lamb tongue, grilled octopus, peach salad, moussaka, and the lamb from the open pit BBQ. White wine from Santorini and a Greek ice cream desert. We recently spent a month in Greece and this meal was, by comparison, spectacular. Service was attentive. Somewhat expensive and worth every penny.
author: Gregg E.

description: There's nothing bad that I can say about Kokkari Estiatioro; indeed, I can say only positive things about this place. I have been here a few times and it's always packed. For some reason people love this place. The wait can be a little disheartening but it's a good thing that they do reservations and have delivery. Make sure to have enough time when you come to Kokkari, the waits are longer than the ones the Cheesecake Factory has. My favourite dish is the lamb chops and their crispy zuchinni cakes with the cucumber and yogurt sauce.. The lamb is always prepared to perfection and is quite juicy and flavourful. The zucchini cakes are crispy -- a delight to say the least. I recommend trying out Kokkari Estiatioro, you wouldn't regret it.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I LOVE KOKKARI! Came here for my birthday earlier in the year to celebrate with the hubby and some friends. The hubby tried making a reservation to accommodate 8 people and they couldn't. He called back every few days and even the day before the event (he had a back up reservation somewhere else). Kokkari had an empty wine cellar downstairs that no one was booking. The space usually came with a minimum order. They gave it to us without such minimum requirements! 

The food is FANTASTIC! Those lamb chops. I still think about them. So tender and delicious. Also the octopus was so good. Wanted more of those suckers :P The special was crackling pig, and while it looks so unassuming upon arrival, it was definitely an explosion of flavors! 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Got there Sunday night and the place was packed. Got 2 seats at the bar where we got to try some Greek wine. Bartender was really nice. 

We got couple of appetizers and a main dish, which was goat over orzo. It was delicious! Ended with a plate of assorted cookies, rose garden tea and Greek coffee.
author: SuSu O.

description: I went to Kokkari for a late night dinner and it was amazing. The servers were very knowledgeable and gave great suggestions. The wine selection is also great! We tried a bottle of greek wine to match the delicious food. Definitely recommend starting with the halloumi or saghanaki- both amazing! You can't go wrong with any of their lamb dishes- that's what they are known for, but we tried the ravioli and it was the perfect dish for fall!
author: Carol Ann V.
Miko B.

description:
I meet a friend roughly every 6 months for dinner. Last time we wanted to go to Kokkari but could not get in, so this time we made reservation way in advance.

I'm sorry to say Kokkari did not meet expectation.

We decided to split two appetizers, the zucchini cakes and a special, apriots (plum/apricot hybrid) with yogurt & honey. Agree with Yelpers that zucchini cakes really good. Small portion but it's an appetizer. The apriot was unripe, sour and hard. We both felt if a restaurant has a special made with seasonal fruit the fruit needs to be ripe, otherwise just use oranges.

I had been leaning towards halibut but server said rotisserie special is duck. We agreed my friend would get halibut, I'd get duck, and we'd trade bites. He got the better end of the deal. The halibut and fava puree were both really good. The duck was not. It was fatty & bony, which ducks are, which is why good restaurants work around that. What looked like impressive portion was much less so when I cut all the bones off. Worse, the duck was dry and tough, clearly overcooked, while the skin was flabby and fatty, undercooked. I later talked to a woman in the restroom who said she goes to Kokkari regularly, when I said the duck was disappointing she told me I should never order duck there, get the fish. But they put it on the menu. They should know how to cook it.

Dessert, decided we would get the baklava with nut ice cream and the baklava ice cream and split both. Dessert saved the meal. The baklava was good, not spectacular, but both ice creams were really good.

Service was attentive and courteous.

If I ever return I'll get halibut, but frankly I'm disinclined to return.

We have pictures but for some reason uploading photos not an option? Searched high & low for way to add photos.
author: Carol S.

description: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in SF. Came in late the other evening 9:45. Everything was great, the setting as always, the service and the food. We started with the lamb dolmas special. Very nice. Grilled stuffed squid, excellent. Two dips, (can't remember the name) one the eggplant one and the other the feta cheese one. Both delicious. Followed that with the lamb skewer entree, really delicious and perfectly cooked. Also at the table somebody got the Mousaka and my wife got the Branzino wonderful. Really, this is one of the best places in SF. Not cheap, by really worth it. On an off night, late, to have such a great meal, is so wonderful. Highly recommended.
author: Alex O.

description:
The fish is amazing (Psari sto Fourno) and reminds me of my grandmothers cooking (my family's from the Mediterranean area). I ate the whole thing #noregrets.

Service is phenomenal, drink menu is extensive, and no matter what you pick from the food menu it will not disappoint.
author: Maddie H.

description:
Flew in from Dallas, a Greek friend told me to check this out. We walked in at 530 on a Saturday and were able to get a seat at the bar luckily, I guess it's booked out a month or so.

You've read other reviews, the food was amazing, the service impeccable, really a random highlight of our trip.
author: Colin H.

description:
(for a visit in late Dec 2017) Must visit spot if you love food made in a wood fire oven or charcoal grill. We were seated right next to an open grill and were treated to all the wonderful aromas. 

They have an extensive wine selection. I really liked a red from Nauossa.
We ordered the zucchini cakes (crispy and flavorful) and grilled fish (with just lemon and some herbs), both were amazing. 

For dessert we tried Galaktoboureko (semolina custard on filo with pistachio ice cream) and Yiaourti me Meli (Greek yogurt, honey, dates and walnuts). Both of these were excellent
author: Arvind M.

description:
We had a wonderful time at Kokkari last Friday night.
Every dish was scrumptious, especially the grilled artichoke and eggplant skewer.  Being vegetarians we were happy to have many appetizers to choose from.  
Excellent service and presentation.
author: Tasha I.

description: We came on Valentine's Day and ordered from their pre fixed menu, averaging about $150 per person for 4 courses and a glass of champagne. Their cocktails avg $15 each. The food was not only wonderful tasting, but so was the service! In between each course, they wiped down the table and switched out each plate. Our server, Max, was fun and friendly! We would definitely return.
author: Natasha K.

description:
It was tough to get a reservation but, Lamb was excellent.. quality is really good and meat was really tender. 

Side note, cool decor and easy street parking
author: Mason L.

description: Some girlfriends took me here for my birthday on a trip to SFO. These girls know their food and I had high expectations since one of them said it was her favorite. I arrived a bit early and got a drink at the bar, which was very heavy on the whiskey, and delicious. Joey was our server and took very good care of us, including helping me navigate the menu towards choices that could be made vegan. We split the grape leaves, zucchini cakes and Brussels sprouts and they were all fantastic. The mint in the zucchini cakes put them over the top. I also loved the Kith and Kin Cabernet that I drank. My only complaint is that there were no vegan entree options. I would definitely return for those starters again!
author: Jana B.

description:
I had high expectations because I've heard such great things, and not only were they met, they were exceeded on every level.  For starters, love the valet service and we arrived a bit early and were seated immediately.  It was busy for a Saturday night, but not loud, it's actually quite intimate and the booths are so comfortable it was notable. 

We went a bit crazy and for appetizers ordered the lamb meatballs, spanakopita, carrots, octopus and lamb riblets. Every last thing was crazy good, memorable, cooked to perfection and just the right serving size.  For dinner we had the lamb and menastra, the pork shoulder special and the rib eye (which is so massive, we were stuffed and still took home about half of it.)  And finally for dessert the ice-cream sundaes with ice-cream they make in house along with the creme fraiche.  I dream about these sundaes!

I would highly recommend you ask to sit in Jeff or Johnny's section because the service from both of them was other level along with all the other bussers, food servers and front of house.  Just an example of how great the service is, we were talking about taking home the rib eye to eat the next day and our server Johnny told us he included a chunk of their fresh french bread in our to go bag so we could make sandwiches.

Honestly this was such a great experience from beginning to end, such a great night I won't soon forget and a very special restaurant I will continue to go back to.
author: C M.

description:
We were lucky to get a reservation for 7.30pm through Amex platinum. 

It feels like you need to dress up for this place but it is definitely not necessary. I saw quite a few people in all casual there.

Our table was perfect! The service was great from start to finish! Our waiter was beyond cool and helpful. He steered me away from a dish because of my gluten free preferences. He also helped us pick a delicious red wine as well as appetizers. 

The food was extraordinary: 
Appetizers
-grilled octopus - exceptional! A Must!
-roasted beets in Greek yogurt - fresh and flavorful 
Entrees
-goat stew - delicious and filling 
-roasted chicken - juicy, flavorful and a huge portion, I loved it! 

Amazing experience!
author: Kate N.

description:
YumZ. 
Just gonna leave that here for a second to digest. 

Yumz to the max! 

Great food, fabulous wine selection and amazing service, all heading one way = straight to heaven! .
author: Taraneh G.

description: I've spent time living in cities with reasonably large Greek populations (Detroit and Chicago). I've even spent a week in Greece. My experience at Kokkari was better than any Greek dining experience I have ever had. The ambience is warm and welcoming. My wife got the branzino which was quite good. I ordered the lamb and potatoes. Even though I typically like my lamb medium-rare, the waiter suggested medium-well and it did not disappoint! It was so tender and juicy and I could probably eat that meal for days without getting sick of it. This is a place I would definitely recommend to anyone.
author: Harnoor T.

description:
9/10

- Taramosalata dip 10/10
- Favasalata is ok
- lamb chop (supposedly their signature dish) was a little bland, just 3 racks of lamb
- mediterranean fish, their special, also 10/10
- overall having multiple perfect dishes is rare
- wine pairing was tasty, but i know nothing about wine
- good date night spot, comfortable seating
author: Yuen Hsi C.

description:
DEFINITELY OFF THEIR GAME

The evening started well---nice ambience, knowledgeable waiter,
good first course. But then---
1) Waited almost one hour for next (main) course.  Spouse's lamb chops arrived cold; sent back and waited 15 minutes for them to reappear.  Strike one.
2) My "house special" mixed-cut lamb dish consisted of a handful
of dry, unidentifiable shards of meat, surrounded by a mountain of potatoes and un-chewable bones and gristle.  $47 for this?!?
Strike two.
3) When our bill arrived, I found several charges for items we did not have, including a $150 bottle of wine.  Strike three.
Our server never stopped by to check on our dinner (including the bill.)
When things started to go wrong, I had to repeatedly flag him down from across the dining room.

Was this just an off-night for Kokkai, or the New Normal?  I had the distinct impression that the restaurant is coasting on their exalted reputation.  In any event, Kokkai management definitely needs to up their game and straighten out the wait staff act.
author: R.C. O.

description:
OVERALL (5/5):
Exquisite dinner from start to finish! I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean cuisine and Kokkari lived up to every expectation. They have lots of bomb specials on rotation, so definitely check them out!

Reservations are highly recommended!

FOOD:
- Spanakotiropita / Filo Pies (5/5) - Sooooo flaky and delicious. The filling is an incredible explosion of creaminess and saltiness.

- Kolokithokeftethes / Zucchini Cakes (5/5) - Crispy on the outside and moist on the inside, these are perfectly complemented by the tartness of the yogurt sauce. I didn't know zucchini could taste so good.

- Octapodaki tou Yiorgou / Grilled Octopus (5/5) - I've never had better octopus. The octopus morsels were grilled to absolute perfection--tender without being chewy. Then they're tossed in an incredible, tangy lemon oregano olive oil that might as well be crack.

- Arnisia Paidakia / Lamb Chops (5/5) - I kid you not, BEST LAMB CHOPS IN THE WORLD. And that's coming from someone who usually hates lamb. The were cooked soooo well and seasoned so perfectly with lemon and herbs. Almost stupidly juicy and tender without any hint of gaminess. The chops are also served with some of the best lemon potato wedges you'll ever have :)

- Psari Psito / Grilled Whole Fish (4/5) - Super fresh with a great char. It's paired with that same lemon olive oil that I still dream about.

- Souvla Tis Emeras / Today's Rotisserie (3/5) - Monday's special was a roasted pork belly/bacon slab thing, but it was unfortunately the least impressive part of the meal. It erred on the dry side and wasn't as flavorful as the other dishes.

- Yiaourti Granita / Yogurt Sorbet & Seasonal Granita (5/5) - The perfect way to end a heavy dinner. The lime (?) granita was SUPER tart, which I actually really enjoyed. It paired very well with the sweet and creamy yogurt sorbet.

- Ekmek Kataifi (4/5) - This was a dessert special of shredded filo layered with fruit, pistachio, and a layer of custard. Kind of reminded me of a coffee-less tiramisu. Really good, but a little too sweet.

AMBIANCE (5/5):
- Great for any occasion -- birthdays, work events, family gatherings, etc.
- Beautiful decor
- Spacious
- Comfy seats lol
- Unfortunately the dim lighting makes for some pretty terrible food pics

SERVICE (5/5):
- Attentive and fast
- Very knowledgeable about the menu/wines
author: Amy T.

description:
Very fancy place. Came here for a team lunch. I remember it was a big deal when Steve Jobs ate here (I think he was a semi-regular here).

Food was fine. Everything was very expensive -- but it was on the company's dime so our team ate well and very happily.
author: Andrew W.

description: Very nice ambiance, kind service, food was amazing. Their octopus was so soft, artichoke skewer was delicious, and lamb chops were great. We also had grilled fish. Thank you for wonderful evening in the Bay.
author: Jun Hee D.

description:
I wanted to go on a fancy date with my girlfriend and Kokkari came highly recommended due to the romantic ambience and dressy attire. From that standpoint, Kokkari definitely did not disappoint. It was very fancy and the service was excellent. The ambience was very nice. 

To start, we had the zucchini cakes.  They were excellent and I highly recommend them. The crispy outside was fantastic and the yogurt sauce complemented the dish very well. 

I ordered the lamb chops because they were rated as one of the top 100 things to eat in the city.  They were fine. They came out and were kind of moderately warm, they'd been sitting a while. The lemon butter sauce they're in was definitely good. But nothing really wowed me. 

Girlfriend ordered the lamb casserole. It was like a Greek shepherd's pie. It had a nice cream sauce on top and was good. Again though, nothing suggested this couldn't be made at home. 

The restaurant's saving grace was the dessert, something which wasn't on the menu. I can't remember the name but the waiter described it as shredded phyllo soaked in baklava syrup, topped with strawberry rhubarb jam, custard, creme fraiche, and pistachios.  This dessert was AMAZING!!

Ultimately, might go back for the ambience but it's a bit overpriced. It's a rustic restaurant where they do basic things well, but they don't really do anything a decent cook couldn't do at home (except the dessert)
author: Nick D.

description:
Excellent food! Everything from appetizers, main course & desert were super delicious.
& Finally A+ service from Majid from beginning to end. Made the entire dinner quite an enjoyable experience.
author: Mohammad R.

description:
Given that I'm not the biggest fan of Greek food and don't particularly like lamb, olives, or feta cheese, I'm not quite sure how I ended up for dinner one night. That said, Kokkari is the best place to convert a non-Mediterranean foodie like me :)

This place is busy, and we had to try two or three times to get a reasonable dinner reservation time. It's located close to the Embarcadero, walking distance from North Beach, Chinatown, and Financial District. The decor is beautiful--an old-world, rustic feel that encompasses almost two long rooms.

We started with the zucchini cakes, which are a signature dish of theirs and didn't disappoint, and the octopus. The octopus was advertised to us as the best octopus in SF, and I would have to agree. We also had grilled branzino and the spiced lamb skewers (debated back and forth between the lamb chop but chose this). The fish was perfectly seasoned and cooked, and the lamb (while I'm not the biggest fan) was some of the best lamb I've ever had. 

If you're a wino, treat yourself to the $8,900 bottle of old world wine ;) this place has so much wine that they need TWO menus for it.
author: Tim X.

description:
YES, it IS INDEED worth the hype.

But WHY? This is something no other yelp review could definitively tell me as I obsessively read through them last night before my very first Kokkari experience. Here's my shot at it:

1.) The space is really cool. It's large, warm, and beautifully appointed, with floor to ceiling windows, golden floor lamps, a giant fireplace, stone walls and beautiful tapestries. It's quite crowded, but everyone has enough space. You feel both fancy and also warm and cozy.

2.) There is an atmosphere of jollity--everyone is nicely dressed but the whole room buzzes with conversation and laughter. You get the sense that everyone there is having a blast, but the noise is just the right level, so your own voice doesn't get drowned out and you can hear your dinner companions just fine.

3.) The service is impeccable. The servers have perfect timing, you can always find them when you need them, and their knowledge of the food is outstanding. They can describe each dish in detail--the presentation, the flavors, the preparation--and are excellent menu guides for people like me who can never, ever make up their minds about what to order. Further, if you're someone like me who asks really annoying and specific questions like "I've never had branzino, what does it taste like," the servers don't even blink: our waitress proceeded to explain not only the texture and flavor of the branzino but that of the sea bream and mackerel that were also on offer, in adjectives that can only be described as poetic and that helped me to perfectly imagine the fish. 

4.) The food is magnificent. We had the octopus appetizer, the lamb chops, the branzino, the baklava, and the flourless chocolate cake. Each were nothing short of spectacular. "But WHY is it so good?" you ask. Because they have perfected the trifecta: 1.) absolutely top-quality ingredients and mind-blowing meats/fish, 2.) simple preparation with minimal ingredients, all of the highest quality, such as olive oil, herbs, and lemons, which allows the incredible flavor of the dish itself to stand alone, and 3.) a kitchen with both miraculous gadgets (I don't know who made their grill but it must have been Jesus, the smoky charcoal flavors effusing the branzino and octopus were to die for) and cooks who can execute Olympian feats of medium-rare or char-grilled mastery. 

It's rare that a restaurant in SF lives up to the hype, but Kokkari certainly does. Do make sure to make a reservation well in advance, and if this is your first time let your server's expertise guide your odyssey through the menu.

(Get it? Odyssey? Because the Greek hero Odysseus? You liked it, you know you did. Stop rolling your eyes.)
author: Ali M.

description: We had such a wonderful dinner here tonight! The food was incredible and the service was great. Our waiter, Johnny, was just about the friendliest person you could meet! He made the whole experience even better! From the appetizers, to the entrees (I had the branzino and it was the best fish dish I have EVER had) to the yummy desserts- we just truly enjoyed every bite!
author: Rosita J.

description:
This place does what they do well. Their wait staff is great. Their food is traditional and rustic, but I wouldn't put it on par with other upscale restaurants that have the same prices. For a $30-45 entree I expect whatever it is to blow my mind. I had the casserole, and it was really good, but I feel like I could probably make it. The lamb had great flavor, but again, not anything too special.  And the lamb came with potato wedges..they were good, but hey, they're still potato wedges.

The dessert however was very interesting and excellent. It was a special and not on the menu, but it has shredded filo dough topped with custard, rhubarb jam, creme fraiche, and pistachios. 

Honestly, the dessert is the only thing about our meal that was worth its price. The other food was great, don't get me wrong, but the price tags for this fairly basic food is a little ridiculous.
author: Elena K.

description:
We have eaten at Kokkari periodically ever since it opened. It was a lot better then than it is now. Leave this one to the tourists who are clamoring for tables. Kokkari and sibling Evvia were once stellar examples of a cuisine few restaurants offered after Square One closed up. But nowadays Mediterranean menus are everywhere, and many do the dishes far better than Kokkari.

Pros:
