- The feta is outstanding in quality. Really, really magnificent. The tomato/caper relish is fabulous with it. It will also be the most seasoned dish you'll have all night. Kokkari is really timid with the seasoning, which surprised the heck out of us and our 9 other friends.
- Gigantes (giant beans) excellent, as good as dish as Aziza/SF used to make.
- Roasted potatoes. Finally some seasoning: the whiff of rosemary and top-notch execution make these simple spuds a genuine gourmet delight. Add in:
- Tzatziki, which goes well with anything when it's this good (and yes, there are other Med. restaurants that offer spiced yogurt just as good, but not all of them), and is especially good with the roasted potatoes.
- Special skewer: roasted organ meats. Absolutely perfect: heart, liver, kidney - all lamb, all rare, all excellent; generously sized cubes. Notable since rotisserie lamb was dreadful and scant.
- The service is excellent. The waitstaff are true professionals, a relief after the ham-handed service most restaurants offer these days.

Okay/Good:
- Kolokithokeftethes, zucchini cakes. I prefer more delicate ones, but these were good if not remarkable.
- Marithes Tiganites, crispy smelts. A special, they were good but all of us found the skordalia dip tasteless and boring, as it always is.
- Soutzoukakia - grilled lamb meatballs. An okay dish, nothing unusual. Meatballs were very firm, the tomato acidity soothed with creamy yogurt. 
- Avgolemono soup. A "B" version. It's a chicken broth, good but weak, lightly thickened with egg and flavored with lemon. It's thinner than usual, as there's less rice than most restaurants use. There's a nice amount of chicken in it.

Thumbs down:
- Saghanaki, fried cheese. Cold and like rubber. Go to Three/SMateo or Gold Coast/Alameda to have this done properly, which means flambeed in ouzo.
- Spanakotiropita, spinach pie in filo. A disaster. Tiny, dry, overpriced. When did spinach get expensive?!?
- Octapodaki tou Yiorgou, grilled octopus. Tender but stingy. Our party had to cut rounds in half in order to have one tiny bite each. 
- Garides Skordates, roasted prawns. Stick with the Spanish Gambas Ajillo at any tapas place. These weren't very fresh and had little garlic flavor.
- Hirino, feta crusted Berkshire pork belly with curried cauliflower. Not much seasoning, no real evidence of feta crust in flavor; if cauliflower was curried we couldn't tell. Pork belly was soft and tender, well-executed if not remarkable in overall dish concept.
- Special: Lamb dolmades. If the waiter hadn't told us some rotisserie lamb had been added, none of us would have known these were anything but rice and feta. Just get the regular dolmades and save yourself some $$.
- Rotisserie special, lamb. The lamb was overdone and dry. There was no taste of any herbs or spices, just salt. There's a lemon half to squeeze over the dish. The plate was mostly potatoes. There was one slice of lamb and the rest were small shreds. The portion of meat was skimpy for the very high price. We wouldn't recommend ordering any rotisserie items in view of value.

Summary: What Kokkari does well is high-quality food, in a handsome restaurant that's easy to reach. Greek food is not a hotbed of complex spicing, and Kokkari understates even the spicing it does use. The menu is exotic enough to sound daring, but in reality is straightforward: not much different than a good Cal-Italian restaurant. Sub tzatziki for sour cream and you could entertain the most confirmed meat and potatoes lover. 

It's hard to remember there was a time when yogurt and filo, eggplant and lamb, in all their many permutations, were virtually unknown to most diners. But these days competitors are everywhere. Not just the little lunch cafes serving hummus and gyros, but food trucks and delis, even supermarket take-out steamtables. These days Mediterranean food is available in its various ethnic identities: Greek vs Turkish, Southern Italian vs Moroccan, Spanish vs Lebanese. 

You can eat well at Kokkari. It's just that you can eat better, for less, at any of at least 100 restaurants around the Bay Area. Your choice.
author: Jean K.

description: Favorite restaurant in the entire city. Rented out the wine cellar room downstairs for my bday dinner, and then celebrated NYE dinner here as well- with some guest from out of town. Highly recommend this spot for any occasion. Order everything off the menu, or ask your waiter for the daily specials- seriously, you CANT go wrong!!
author: Katie H.

description: Ugh, everyone is right about the hype. This place is damn good. I'm gluten free and they had a ton of options, and every single thing I tried was amazing. Obvi, make a reservation like 2 mo in advance because otherwise no chance of getting in.
author: Lindsay W.

description: I am incredibly sad that my very favorite Greek restaurant and favorite SF restaurant in general is one I won't return to.  I have been dining at Kokkari since they opened.  I used to dream of their food!  The last two times I dined at Kokkari the food has been inferior to the food I have grown accustomed to. The taramosalata barely had roe in it, the color was simply bread.  The melitzanasalata was flavorless and not up to par.  The dolmathes were mushy and the grilled lamb riblets tasted off, as in bad meat.  It seems they are cheapening their ingredients.  It is extremely sad to see a favorite restaurant reduce its quality.  Fortunately I have the Kokkari cookbook and can cook everything better at home!
author: T H.

description:
I'm not sure how I managed to live in the Bay Area for 7 years and not dine at Kokkari. It had been on my list forever, but somehow I never made it to where many say is the best Greek restaurant in SF. It took a recent visit to the Bay Area to make it happen. 

Everything my dining partners and I had was excellent and made for a fantastic lunch experience. We started with a the housemade pita and a trio of dipping sauces, all of which were packed full of flavor and complemented the pillowy pita. My husband is a sucker for saghanaki, so of course we had to try the fried cheese appetizer. 

My husband's grilled lamb chops were perfectly prepared, my mother-in-law's octopus salad was large, but not overwhelming. 

I almost never order dessert after lunch, but made an exception when I saw the dessert offerings. Kokkari, from start to finish, was a great dining experience. Think Greek food, but elevated to the next level.
author: Lee H.

description:
When we arrived the place was packed to capacity. We had a reservation but arrived 30 minutes earlier. The great host was still able to seat us promptly. The food is amazing and we ate at benu the night before and I would say we had a better time at Kokkari. 

We had the lamb, branzino, pork shoulder... sublime. The service was the best part as they were prompt, attentive and very knowledgeable even though the place was completely full. Would recommend to anyone. Will be back.
author: Zachary W.

description: Totally 5 star experience and food! Good choice for celebrations. Baklava is a must-try. Fish is just amazing.
author: Guler Y.

description: The lamb dishes are decadent and have a clean taste. We had the Arnisia Plevrakia (lamb riblets) and Arnisia Paidakia (lamb chops) and they weren't gamey at all. The lamb riblets had a lot more meat on them than we expected and although it was quite greasy, it was a good dish to share. The lamb chops come with three chops and three lemon potatoes which were good but the portion may be a bit small for what it's worth.
author: S K.

description:
For me, Kokkari lived up to the hype. I had heard nothing but good things about it and absolutely loved it. The atmosphere is pretty posh, so I wouldn't suggest rolling up here in your jeans and hoodie, although that seems to be the norm at other nice restaurants. You don't need to be in a suit, but put a little effort into looking nice! I'm glad that my sister and I dolled up a bit for the occasion, as we were seated near a lot of well-to-do looking people. 

We started with the crispy zucchini cakes, and loved them. They aren't very big, and for being fried, are delicate in flavor. I wish we had ordered 2 servings! But there is so much great stuff on the menu, I think filling up on zucchinni cakes wouldn't be your best move ;)
Next we had the lamb meatballs, as recommended by many people, and they were totally worthy of the praise. If you love meatballs, try them at Kokkari. 
Next up was the grilled octopus with lemon and olive oil. This was the highlight of my meal, amongst everything else that we ate that I also found phenomenal. I have never tasted octopus this flavorful, and the olive oil it is served in takes it to another level. 
With all of these small plates, we decided to share an entree. We decided on the rotisserie of the day, which was duck. It came on top of their famous roasted potatoes in a shallow bed of their swoon worthy olive oil. We ate every last bite, and I dipped my bread in the olive oil. So good! Everything was perfect, and I really really want to go back and try some of their other dishes! Who wants to treat me? :P
author: Liz M.

description: Beautiful spot near the Embarcadero.  Came here for lunch on a weekday, advance reservations highly recommended.  Attentive service and classy yet rustic decor.  Food is amazing, very fresh and a variety of options, including plenty of fish and vegetarian options (the starters are especially good, try their zucchini cakes and their spanakotiropitas).  Definitely something for everyone, great place if you love Greek and are looking for something special to splurge on in San Francisco.
author: Ken D.

description: I have wanted to take my wife here for years. Having enjoyed several business lunches and dinners here previously. The planning ahead to get a prime reservation was more than rewarded last night with a dinner we will always remember! Starters were the grilled octopus and a special house made sausage. Both were soft and succulent with very delicate flavors. Then the grilled fish and the goat stew. Both were very special. The fish, light, tender and yet sweet and the goat stew was bold, spicy and balanced on a bed of orzo. All of this was complemented by a delightful a Turley 2015 Zinfandel that was very reasonably priced. A destination worth the effort!
author: Tim E.

description:
This review is for their catering service. Tips for their management: 
(1) Service: 
Your barman is too busy to take payment for pickups. He made me late despite a confirmed pickup time on your order form. 
(2) Quality:
Take the roasted chicken off the catering menu- it was *really* dry, so maybe it doesn't travel well? Your lamb was great- maybe push for that instead. 
(3) Packaging: 
Your containers weren't closed well and I got tomato sauce and lamb sauce all over my outfit.
(4) Labeling: 
I got a box of cut lemons (thank you), but I didn't know if it should go with the lamb or the chicken. Most people used it for the chicken to offset its dryness.   
(5) Salad: I paid $180 for 18 salads only to get a simple bunch of greens from a bag. See pic. Also the Greek salad orders never made it into my pickup. Feeling a little ripped off with that one.
(6) Prices: 
With the exception of the salad, great prices. Spent $35/person and I have lots of leftovers (all chicken).
author: Naomi A.

description: All about the lamb! Went with another couple and had a fantastic dinner. Got three apps which was perfect to share for the four of us. The lamb riblets were our favorite but the grilled artichoke/eggplant and the octopus was no slouch either. Never had tried grilled octopus before and was pleasantly surprised by it. For the main courses three of us had lamb and were all happy with our choices. The shank, lamb chop and skewered lamb. I had the skewer and it was tender and juicy. The tzatziki sauce was really the unsung hero. Wife had the special which was 1/3 roasted duck. Again it was tender and moist. Restaurant is pricey but worth it for a special occasion or night out.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Classy restaurant. 

Kokkari Estiatorio took my Greek dining experience to a totally different level. I have heard a lot about this place from my friends and finally made it in here today. I came in for lunch with 2 of my girl friends. We did get in here about 11:45 AM but unfortunately, we did not make a reservation.So we got ourselves seated at the bar. And the hospitality was as good as, if would have been seated at those nice tables.
It is a great place to have your birthday lunch/dinner or come here on a romantic date or just with friends. But make sure you have a RESERVATION!

The service was perfect to the dot. Our waiter was very knowledgeable. He started off with the specials list and got our drinks and appetizers taken care off right away. The service was not too slow considering a fully packed house.
We were served with complimentary bread and olive oil (which by itself was filling up my tummy).

And this is what we ordered:
We shared 2 appetizers. Spanakotiropita (filo pies) and the Zucchini cakes (as recommended by Stephanie Y). I highly recommend the zucchini cakes. It came with a side of mint yogurt dressing which complimented the cakes so well. There were 3 pieces per order which was perfect for us.

For the entrees, I ordered the ravioli and my friends ordered the Chicken Souvlaki, which is basically chicken skewers. Since it is the season of Lent, I had to stick to vegetarian food. The ravioli was pretty good and I felt the portion was good enough for me.

I will be back for more. I definitely do want to try the non-vegetarian dishes after Lent.
This is one place I didn't mind paying a little more because of all the good food and hospitality. It came up to $45 per person including the tips.

Highly recommend this place!
author: Steffi C.

description:
I've had Kokkari for dinner on my birthday every year for the past 5 years and it never disappoints. In fact, it's become tradition and I love it. Every once in a while I head over for lunch and guess what? It's just as good!

Last week, my friend was able to get a last min reservation which is tough to do. I found out that they turn away over 300 calls a day because they are so packed all the time! Crazy huh? Never the less, we were seated with the consistent hospitality that I've experienced every time I've dined there. 

We ordered the following: 

Fried Smelt (Fries with eyes) - Probably my favorite appetizer. I mean, come on. Fish you can eat like french fries. Just silly. 
Octopus - Tenderized to perfection. 
Branzino (for each of us) - Head on and everything. Lemon, oregano, olive oil over an open flame. Stupid good. 

This place lives up to the hype and more. Book ahead and don't miss your reservation because they are impossible to get!
author: Benjamin F.

description: This is one of my all time favorite SF restaurants and go to places. Their consistent, food is delicious, service is superb and the atmosphere is beautiful.
author: N T.

description: I'll keep this short. I ordered the lamb chops blue and was not disappointed. The waiter remarked that it was only the 2nd time someone had ordered them that way since he worked there and despite the rarity of such a request the execution was perfect. Also the best taziki sauce of any greek restaurant.
author: Mike B.

description:
As I San Franciscan, Kokkari should be marked off my list a long time ago but probably because I'm not the biggest fan of Greek food and lamb. TRUST ME, after you give Kakkari a try, you will fall in love. Simply amazing!

Kokkari was the perfect place to take my friend somewhere nice for her birthday. I booked the reservation a month ahead to get the time slot I wanted. Reservations are hard to get for the best time frames. The restaurant gives you a coozy, fine dining touch. Decor has warmth with high ceilings. Open kitchen with a fireplace, cooking up chicken, etc. The restaurant is huge and they are fully booked every night. Wow! The bar area is first come first serve. Grab a drink and you might get a seat. 

Appetizers:**Kalamari-grilled calamari stuffed with feta. It's so freaken good. The calamari was cooked perfect with the feta, explosion of flavors. 
**Arnisia Plevrakia - grilled lamb riblets - Super tasty, did not have that strong taste you get from low quality lamb. 
**Pantzaria-roasted beets with Greek yogurt & pistachio - YUM. The blend of the yogurt and beets was delicious. Not cheese so its okay to eat a lot and not feel fat. ha! 

Entrees: **Arnisia Paidakia-grilled lamb chops (3). IT'S A MUST. Their most famous dish. Not a big fan of lamb but wow, it's super good. Cooked prefect with a good amount of redness. The seasoning was perfect. Not too salty. 
**Goat Stew (Special, off the menu) with soft cheese and artichokes. - My first time having goat. It's like a pork stew. Very tasty, not bad at all. 

Dessert**Baklava - Traditional walnut & honey baklava with vanilla-praline ice cream - Ordered for the birthday dessert. OMG so freaken good. Never had it before but its flakely on the outside and soft on the inside. YUM! Wantng for more! 
Loukoumades - Traditional Greek doughnuts with honey, cinnamon & walnuts. - The mini donuts was just okay but its super pretty and it came out hot. Fresh! 

I can't wait to come back!
author: Sandy B.

description: The best meal we have had in San Francisco in a long time. We started out with a great white wine from Santorini with a variety of appetizers such as grilled lamb sausages and heirloom tomatoes with feta. A salad of stone fruit was excellent. The entrees of note were the lamb shank,lamb chops, sole and branzino . The sommelier was friendy and extremely knowledgeable. A really well run top notch restaurant
author: Michael F.

description:
Loved the food and the atmosphere. Definitely a Greek menu. What was really odd though was that the cocktail list was just, well, plain. I could have gotten a better cocktail list in Iowa. There was nothing Greek about it. I was hoping to try some Greek inspired cocktails. 

Other than that, it was a great place. But what a miss on their part. It's such an obvious oversight.
author: Anthony T.

description: This restaurant was recommended to us by two different people. I initially was not going to go here because the menu seemed to favor lamb dishes (of course...it is Mediterranean) which my husband doesn't like. But in the end, we did go, and it was really amazing. My husband had the rotisserie of the day which was pork. It was probably the best pork we have ever had in a restaurant. I had the branzino and my son had the salmon. Both of the fish dishes were very good. For appetizers we had the lamb meatballs which were good, and the giant beans and fried cheese, both of which were very good. Tip: They give you a generous portion of bread and olive oil after you order...don't eat it all. If you order an appetizer, the bread will probably come in useful for sopping up the sauces.
author: Heather C.

description:
I had a subpar experience at Kokkari for lunch years ago but decided to give it another go due to the overwhelmingly positively reviews (both on yelp and from friends), Once again, I'm simply not impressed. 

I met up with two girl friends and we ordered 2 apps, 3 mains and 1 dessert. The apps were the lamb meatballs and the fried smelt. Mains were the rotisserie of the day (lamb), the lamb shank and the seabass. And we got the dessert that starts with a 'k' that I can't pronounce.

The apps were ok, nothing special. I like the smelt more than the lamb meatballs. I thought they probably took too long to bring out the smelt because it's no longer piping hot so not as crunchy as it should be. I thought it was oversalted. The lamb meatballs were pretty bad, I thought. It was too salty and the lamb was too dense and hard, not tender at all. The flavor was tomato heavy, with nothing more than just salty and sour. 

The seabass, which didn't look like seabass to me, was a whole fish. I thought seabass are huge fishes. This one was deboned for us and it tasted more like a river fish. It was too salty and also just not enough aromatics. I like my flavors layers and not one note and this dish definitely fails the test. The lamb shank was also too salty (see a trend here?) and also one note. Throw some figs into the braising liquid or something. I can't taste anything other than salt and it doesn't nothing to bring out the sweetness of the lamb shank. My favorite item of the entrees was the rotisserie lamb. Somehow they managed not to bombard the dish with salt (!) and I could taste more nuance flavors of the meat. I could also taste the herbs they used to marinate the meat. The potatoes were also good.

I think my favorite item of the night was the dessert. It wasn't perfect either. It's fried filo drenched in honey, topped with a pistachio (?) custard and on top of that, creme fraiche. I would have like the dessert much more if they used some sort of short bread crust instead of the slivered filo. The filo was stringy and stale in texture, either crunchy nor soft. It was just weird and unpleasant texture. The custard and the whipped creme fraiche was perfect combination, though.

The service is OK. The waiter was adequate but the bus boys were really great about refilling waters. Maybe I'm,just too picky, but for the reputation and the price, I expect a much better meal. The food was way over salted and just so one note. Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me. Definitely never coming back here again. It's really too bad because I really wanted to like this restaurant because the decor here is fabulous and romantic.
author: Alice W.

description:
Get the lamb chops here! You won't regret it. Some of my colleagues had ordered different entrees and said their dishes were just okay so I'm basing my 5 stars on my entree alone.

We came with a large group for lunch. Reservations were easy to get by phone. The service was exceptional and very attentive the entire time.

We shared the grilled octopus ($17) and calamari ($13) to start. The plates are rather small so you might need to order several plates of the same appetizer to share if you have a larger group. Both dishes were incredible but I really loved the calamari. They also serve you free bread which is perfect for soaking up the rest of the sauces in the appetizer dishes.

For my entree I got the grilled lamb chops ($32). It's pricey but if you're on a budget I recommend you try them during lunch over dinner since the price is a lot cheaper then. They were hands down the best lamb I have ever had. The meat was so tender and juicy. The potatoes were equally delicious and had been marinated in the amazing lemon vinaigrette. My only wish was the entree was larger since I wasn't completely full from it afterwards.
author: Linda X.

description: The food already speaks for itself, but Tara and Richard take it to the next level w/ the service. You can also buy a bottle of that great olive oil.
author: Ahmed H.

description:
This review is specifically for the waiter who served us: "Shane"
Even though we had a table for 10:45 pm and didn't order our food till kitchen's closing time, Shane didn't rush us and had a great attitude all the time.
He patiently answered all the questions and made great food suggestions.
We stayed until 1:30 and not even a single time we were asked to leave or get that feeling that we need to leave.
As a the side note, I had the goat stew which was tender and well-spiced. 
Thumbs up to Shane, a true gentleman!
author: Alex M.

description:
So good. Loved every dish. Will be back.

Favorites included the grilled lamp riblets and grilled octopus. I would highly recommend the carrots appetizer. 

Ambience and decor were classy without classy without feeling stiff.
author: Adrian D.

description:
Walked in at 9:00pm and there was another couple that walked in directly after us. They said there was no more seating left for us but put the other couple on a waiting list. 

Gay couple vs Non-Gay couple. Hmmm 

I guess they have a certain demographic they like to seat or don't like to seat. 

Thumbs down. Zero Stars if it was possible
author: Mr G.

description: If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would. This place is beyond gorgeous and the setting leaves you in ah. Came here with my coworkers for lunch and it was my first time! They are usually goers and I guess that means I going to turn into a usual. The food was phenomenal. I had the Chicken Souvlaki and I did not want to stop eating it. Can I have seconds please? We also loaded up on starters from the sample dipping platter, dolmaths, brussels sprouts, gigantes to my absolute fave saghanaki (I could probably eat this all day). Not to mention the wine selection! It was divine and I drank as much as I could before heading back to the office. I look forward to coming back for dinner! Thank you for one of the best lunches ever!
author: Hazel I.

description: The lore of this place is legendary. Willy Brown is a regular. Getting reservations is tougher than a cheap beef jerky and the accolades on yelp are testament to how great a place this is. The service is unmistakably remarkable. Our server was attentive, funny, friendly and everything one could ask for. All of the staff was polite and even on a table for 2 and as busy as the place was, the manager even came by to ask if everything was good. Why the 3 stars? Because food is everything and it was truly average. My halibut was very good albeit the chicken was so so and insipid. The salad was uninspiring and the baklava ice-cream was like any other baklava I have ever had in the USA, overwhelmingly sweet. Making Baklava is an art and you can spend an entire generation learning how to make Baklava. Decent dining experience but not worth the hype.
author: Kay J.

description:
Classy & Romantic. My husband and I enjoyed our dinner here and our waiter was excellent and also funny (I failed to remember his name). He introduced items that were not on the menu to us and we ended up ordering most of it. 

Appetizers: 
Zucchini cake - similar to crab cakes
Octopus (grilled?) - It was a bit crunchy on the outer, but soft inside.. pretty good for those who loves seafood.
Lamb's tongue - Now this is my favorite appetizer! Very soft and probably because I've had cow's tongue before and really liked it... so I especially like this one too.
Lenthil soup - Veggies, tastes sweet & salty.

Main Courses:
My husband ordered the Goat stew is scrumptious! It comes with Greek rice and the flavor is pretty sweet. I would highly recommend this, you will not be disappointed. I ordered Lamb Shank and it was good, but after tasting the goat stew, I wish I would've ordered that instead. Lamb shank was more bland to my taste but the meat is pretty soft. 

For dessert, we had this "cake" layer that has a name started with a K (too long to remember). We were in love with this dessert, it's the best. Sort of reminded me of panna cotta. A must try!

So why 4 stars when I had a great experience?
My husband's glass of wine had something floating in it and the waiter took it to the bartender to remove it, but told us it was a new glass that he handed us. We just wasn't favoring the lie.
And at the beginning when we entered the restaurant, we told the host & hostess that we had a reservation. The man host asked for our last name, he was having a hard time with the spelling and looked annoyed with a slight attitude toward me then turned it over to the hostess. 
For the price we paid for our meals and the classy / fancy presentation that the restaurant tries to deliver to the customers, little things like should be examined by the upper management. It would have been beyond perfection.
author: Lynn T.

description:
WOW! The service was outstanding. The food superb. 

I ordered the special spit roasted lamb. It was enough for three people. Definitely a keeper.
author: Harry R.

description:
I've been here twice now and am a fan. I do think it is a bit overhyped but if you are a lamb lover, this place is a must!

Atmosphere (5) - The atmosphere is great for a dinner meeting, date, or special occasion. It is nice but not too fancy. The first time I wore jeans and a blouse, the next time I wore a nice dress and heels. All in all, you can make it what you'd like (just don't show up in shorts and flip flops). They have a beautiful private room in the back with their wine collection, which could be great to look into for a large party or event! 

Drinks (5) - Their cocktails are very good and the bartenders were super friendly! They have an extensive wine list with new age and old age varietals. I highly recommend their wines, the list is great. If you'd like to bring your own bottle, which I did the second time around, the corkage fee is $25/bottle with a max of 4 bottles per table. 

Food (4) -  Both times I have been, I have thought the food was good but not necessarily incredible. For appetizers, the Saghanaki is a must!! It is pan fried Kefalograviera cheese and essentially salty goodness. I'm not a huge fan of cheese but I've ordered it both times. Zucchini cakes were amazing too (only two in the appetizer though). For entrees, I am only speaking for fish dishes (since I don't eat lamb/beef). The sea bass was good and the portion is large (entire fish); but all in all, the fish entrees are very simply done and I was expecting more. I also tried the salmon this last time, which had more flavor, but was a bit overcooked. 

Service (3) - This is where my main "eh" is. When you walk in to the restaurant, you can tell that the servers know they work in a great restaurant. I was eyed up and down by a couple of the food runners as they stood in the back near the kitchen area. However, they are very knowledgeable in the food and wines. When I comment negatively on the service, I'd also like to point out that as I was walking out of the restaurant this last time, one of the food runners made a joke to another saying "that girl is wasted" and laughing (I didn't hear because I was walking past but my boyfriend overheard as he was following me). They do tend to stand in a huddle near the kitchen and look/make comments to one another. Unfortunately I was not wasted (3 drinks over those two hours), I was just super giddy/smiley since it was my boyfriend's birthday and we had just had a great time. 

I debated giving this review 3 or 4 stars. I decided on 4 since it is pretty unique for a Greek food spot. If they improved their service and attitudes, and stopped having all of the food runners just stare at you throughout dinner, I would definitely consider a 5. All in all, solid place but maybe not the first I'd recommend.
author: Kendra W.

description: Really enjoyed my bday dinner- to be honest I didn't expect so many people on a Wednesday night after 8! On the other hand that might mean something  we had some rose before trying some red wine  spot on! My boyfriend tried the special (goat stew!) and we shared some terrific appetizers! I love the fried cheese and the skewers with artichokes and onions. If you like Mediterranean food, that's the place!
author: Serena P.

description:
This was/is the best Greek restaurant I've ever been to. We ordered the tzatziki w/ pita bread (made in house), the Lamb Skewers, and the Rib-Eye steak. Everything was extremely tasty and the ambiance was 10/10. The service was also exceptional and the price wasn't astronomical. 

This is the perfect spot for a birthday, anniversary, romantic dinner, or any kind of special occasion. 

Will definitely return again when in SF.
author: Boris T.

description:
The BEST Greek Food I have ever had, and I've been to greece, many times! 
Ambiance is so nice, its cozy and comfortable inside, I would like my living room to look like that lol. Love the big fireplace! 
I tried many things on the menu and never get disappointed. Lamb is so juice and flavorful. The grilled octopus. Wow. I wish I could eat here more often, but for the price, its a "special occasion" thing. Cant wait for next time!
author: Jo L.

description:
I'm in love with this place.

We had a reservation at 8, we got here a little later than that but we were seated right away.

We started off with appletinis, which were bomb- very sweet and tasted like jolly ranchers. We decided to order a bunch of appetizers and one entree to share. The entrees are pretty big, and we decided we would rather try more things.

For our appetizers we ordered the grilled octopus, grilled lamb riblets, and cucumber yogurt with pita. For our entree we ordered the dry-aged rib-eye and it was cooked to perfection.

Everything just tasted amazing. My favorite was probably the octopus and the rib-eye. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Group of us went to Kokkari yesterday for dinner and we ordered a lot! 

My personal favorite was the persimmon salad with feta; and the squash ravioli with wild mushrooms oh and the lamb riblets from the appetizer menu! So so so good! 

The atmosphere and decorations will remind you of a Tuscan villa, attentive service will make you forget about the worries of the day. 

I also noticed the coat check. How wonderful not to drag your coat with you and then wear something wrinkled. 

I would like to be back, hopefully soon!
author: Anelya S.

description: This place is special.  Their lamb chops and shanks are among the best I have ever had.  Every time I eat here, I walk by the bar and kick myself that I haven't bellied up there because everyone is always having a lot of fun.  Love this place.  I just might go now!
author: Brian N.

description:
My favorite restaurant in SF.

The closest you can get to Greece in Northern California 

I really enjoyed the appetizer meze plates. 
My favorite dish was the appetizer - a special not in the menu called barbunya fish (red mullet). This is a true delicatessen.

I usually order the branzino whole fish as an entree (lavrak). It's a delicate meaty fish with a great flavor and soft texture. A touch of  and it's perfect. Also a side of Greek fries was a great addition.
Another popular choice is the lamp chops which melt in your mouth, so juicy and tender. 

Finish off the meal with a nice Greek coffee (cooked on coals) and some baklava. 

Yasso!
author: Eyal G.

description:
My BF took me here for out anniversary. This place fills up with reservations super quickly so we ended up having a later one at 9PM on a Friday night. 

Ambiance: The place is huge and I really enjoyed how rustic yet modern the place feels. We were seated in the back room so we got to pass the roaster on our way to the table as well. Our server was very friendly to offer us recommendations on what we should get and for dessert he even customized it to say happy anniversary! He was really friendly and made sure we had what we needed and didn't interrupt us too often to check on us. 

What we got: 
- Oysters - Nice big oysters that they pair with their homemade sauce which was delicious. Tons of onion, dill, and other spices paired well with the lemon and just made the oysters so great. 
- Grilled Octopus - AMAZING. The octopus was so simple but so tender that it melted in your mouth. We finished it so quickly! 
- Grilled Lamb Chops - Nice and juicy and cooked perfectly at medium rare. Not too gamey either. 
- Lamb shank with orzo - The lamb shank was so tender that it basically fell off the bone, literally. I tried to cut a piece off and the whole things came off the bone. It was so hearty and rich in flavor and with the orzo it was oh so satisfying. 
- Loukoumades - AWESOME. After seeing these made on the food network you know I had to get them. They're basically doughnuts but they're covered with rich honey and and other delicious things that the sweet tooth in me just died.
- Galaktoboureko - MY OH MY. We couldn't decide between the two desserts so we just got both. This was a great alternative to the sweetness of the other one. Simple yet so tasty. The pistachio ice cream definitely had to be my favorite part especially with the spoon sweet. 

***Honestly I can see why reservations fill up so fast for this place and for the raving reviews. After coming here I have nothing negative to say about anything and that goes to show you that with great service and food, people will do the talking for you. 

As a fan of med food this is my favorite place to go, but obviously with the cost of this place I sadly can't go as often as I want. haha
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Kokkari always provides the most hospitable experience.  Service was very friendly as always.  

Trio of dips (tzatziki, cheese, and olive) - with cucumbers, pickled vegetables, olives, dolmas, and pita bread (off menu appetizer)

Moroccan spiced carrots - baked to perfection and spiced just right

Grilled octopus - octopus was not tough as some octopus can be

Moussaka - bechamel is to die for

Fish of the day - a sea bass, grilled whole.  Lots of small bones left in the fish, but it was cooked perfectly.

Goat stew with orzo (special of the day) - homey comfort food

Greek coffee - I order it very sweet and it is perfect for me, as it is a rich coffee flavor but also sweet like a dessert.  We didn't even need an actual dessert because we were so full, and the coffee hit the spot.  Just be wary of the silt at the bottom of the cup.

Kokkari is definitely one of my favorite restaurants.  I always love it there!
author: Christina G.

description:
I came here for lunch almost a year ago but only now writing the review. 

I never had Greek food and didn't know what to expect so I was anxious when I was invited for a work lunch. The one person in our party of 3 who's been here made the reservation and we were seated promptly. 

At the recommendation of our colleague, we ordered the zucchini cakes, octopus and grape leaves appetizer. Besides the octopus, (because I LOVE octopus, squid, calamari, etc) these were starters I would've never ordered had someone/Yelp not recommended them. And they were AMAAAAZING. I did not expect to like zucchini cakes or...grape leaves (???) as much as I did. 

All 3 of us got the lamb chops and the serving was appropriate for lunch. It was very good. I definitely would like to try their fish special next time! I cannot wait to go back here with my significant other to share the delicious food.
author: Kelly L.

description:
THANK YOU JEFF!

What a great 1st Anniversary Dinner we had last Sunday. Our server Jeff was awesome, the food was amazing.  The ambience was amazing, although next time, I want table 2.

I ordered the Ribeye. It was enormous.  Although it had a little more marbling and fat than I like, it was cooked perfectly (the 2nd time) ... Initially It came a bit more rare than I would have liked.  They were happy to put it back on the fire and when it came back out, it even had fresh potatoes on it!   Nice touch.

We brought our own wine and they were more than happy to uncork it for a reasonable fee.  My Wife had the octopus and I also ordered the prawns.  They reminded me of the cajun ones you get in New Orleans ..big and kind of delicious in a scary looking kind of way!   YUM

We plan to make Kokkari our annual Anniversary dinner destination.  Oh and I also got to shake hands with Mayor WIllie Brown.  He is a regular there with his two blonde dates.  What a player.

I don't always give out 5 stars for restaurants, but WHEN I DO, it's at places like KOKKARI ESTIATORIO.
author: Paul R.

description:
Amazing food! Came here 2 days in a row as it was that good! The stuffed calamari was absolutely delicious, so we're the zucchini cakes. I highly recommend the grilled branzino - all it had was lemon and oregano, but when fish is fresh and grilled to perfection, that's simplicity at it's best!

I would have rated as 5 stars, but the wait time was ridiculous. We had a reservation and still had to wait 30 minutes! I find that unacceptable for such a place, but the food makes up for the wait
author: Oren P.

description: Came here the other night while in town for work.  We were seated at the bar and our server was great.  We shared two apps and got a salad with chicken which was more than enough food.  Highly recommended!
author: Rachel S.

description: Last night turned out to be an amazing night! I was on cloud 9 after this meal with two of my best friends! None of us have particularly enjoyed Lamb dishes in the past, but damn and I happy that we branched out!! That was the most amazing lamb dish I've ever had!! Everything was cooked perfectly! Everything was flavored perfectly!! Even the desert was killer!! I couldn't have asked for a better dinner.
author: Gayle W.

description:
Amazing food!

Great Atmosphere!

And amazing service from our bartender Bret!  Great restaurant to have a great Greek meal
author: Eduardo L.

description: Quality and quantity served at kokkari have declined massively. Fish quality isn't what it used to be. Portions are much smaller than in the past. Branzino they serve isn't as tasty as before. Been coming here hundreds of times but last few times have been very disappointing so won't be back again
author: Eric G.

description: I still dream about the meal I had here. The lamb meatballs and the creamiest yogurt that's served with them...the tender baby squids, grilled and swimming in a pool of the most beautiful olive oil I've ever had....the fried cheese. I mean, you had me at "fried cheese." On top of that, the atmosphere is just beautiful. Gorgeous heavy wooden furniture, gleaming copper, everything is so cozy. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation here to celebrate something special. I can't wait to come back!
author: Alicia G.

description: Excellent food and the best service I have experienced in quite some time. Jeff was perfect with the descriptions, right on with each course and will be one of the main reasons l will return.
author: Robert M.

description: Food is rather sophisticated.  Live uni is so fresh and sweet.  Lamb chop just melts in your month.   Great Greek coffee.  Service is very attentive.
author: Jing C.

description:
Wildly popular UP$CALE GREEK FOOD in a formal dining room in SF

PARKING: Valet parking $8. Or was it $12. We were super lucky and found street parking.

RESERVATIONS: Must call in advance. I called about a month ahead, OpenTable is showing only a couple days available during the entire next two months so call the restaurant to see if they can take you even if OpenTable says there's no available spots. 

AMBIANCE: I immediately felt underdressed when I walked in! This is definitely a special occasion type of place, perfect for date night or girls night out. There are 2 large dining areas, one with a huge fireplace rotisserie cooking the daily special "spit" items. There is also a private dining room downstairs by the bathrooms that is nice and quiet and away from the bustling upstairs. If you don't have time for a leisurely dinner, stop at the bar, which stays open between lunch and dinner.

FOOD: we ordered a bunch of small dishes to share and a bunch of entrees which we devoured family style. I've never been to Greece and the only Greek food I've ever eaten is gyros and hummus, so it's hard for me to even compare the dishes that we had to anywhere else because I've never had anything quite like it. We ordered lentil soup, whole fish, meat from the huge rotisserie, octopus, eggplant, and stuffed grape leaves with shredded duck! It was all well prepared and was the perfect way to end my short trip to SF. 

SERVICE: top notch. I told our server I had a plane to catch and he made sure we got through all our courses in time.

I had such a short time in SF that I wanted to find a dining experience unlike anything we have in Hawaii. This was definitely a good choice. Well picked, my yelpy friend.
author: Lori I.

description:
Approaching 5000 reviews, this place is a SF favorite. Went to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it was totally worth the occasion. Especially during Christmas time its the most inviting. 

Ambiance is very warm, classy and unpretentious. Decor is more rustic traditional with a huge fireplace and big, comfy chairs. They also have many tables for large parties.

Reservation is MUST unless you are open to sit at the bar or go early at 5 or late as 10PM. This place is ALWAYS busy, even on week days. Reservation must be made at least 3 weeks in advance. 

Come ahead and spend some time at the bar. Its a full bar with great wine and cocktails on the menu.

SERVICE is exceptional. Inspite of being very busy that night, the food came perfectly on time.
Our server was professional, very attentive and friendly. 

FOOD: The simplicity of Kokkari is part of its charm. The menu is clean and simple. The food is basic Greek but of very high quality and executed with perfection.

We ordered:
Zucchini cakes ($8) - Its a MUST! The star of the night. These cakes are delish, not soggy at all for a vegetable like zucchini. Its perfectly fried and crispy on the outside. Served with a creamy mint yogurt sauce.

Calamari stuffed with feta ($14) - It didn't live upto my expectation as the stuffing had too much olive for my liking. Didn't do the magic.

Lamb chops ($38) - Served a trio, its grilled to perfection. Well seasoned and juicy. Served with potato wedges.    

Lamb shank ($35) - Ohh this dish was perfection to the T. The meat fell of the bone, so tender. Served with orzo and sauce, the orzo was perfectly seasoned.

For dessert our server suggested the Galaktoboureko and we were so glad we went with his choice. This simple looking dish was mindblowing. 2 pieces of filo rolls filled with semolina custard inside, served with the best pistachio ice cream I ever tasted! 

Kokkari is great to celebrate special occasions. A killer Greek restaurant, everything about this dining experience is on-point.
author: Payal B.

description:
My initial encounter with Greek cuisine was at Evvia, Kokkari Estiatorio's sister restaurant in Palo Alto. I had the Arnisia Plevrakia, kalamari, and Arnisia Paidakia. For dessert, I had the Galaktoboureko. 

Prior to coming to this restaurant, I did not enjoy lamb. But this place was a true gem that changed my opinion on lamb. On most nights, I actually find myself craving for the Arnisia Plevrakia coupled with the potatoes. The food was exquisite and the dining staff was accommodating. This is definitely my favorite fine dining spot in San Francisco.
author: Mariah D.

description:
After all these years, they are still on the top 10 list. As soon as I learned I was going to be in the area, we made a reservation via open table. They like to call you to confirm reservation a couple of times, a bit annoyed by frequent calls. They are open from 11:30am. We showed up at 11:20am and the door was locked. It would have been nice if they let us in to wait inside the restaurant as it was cold outside. There were about 10 people stood outside waiting for them to unlock the door.

I really liked the ambiance of this restaurant. I like the way the decorated. Very traditional and classy.

We started with our lunch with two appetizers. Based on the reviews here, I wanted to try the grilled octopus. Nicely flavored but the quality of octopus wasn't the best I had. Perhaps I had too much expectation. Traditional filo pies were good but I wasn't overwhelmed by them.

I ordered grilled lamb chops for my lunch. This one met my expectation. Two large lamb was served with potato, a bit tangy taste from lemon went good with plain potato. Very large meat, I was very full after lunch, I had to skip desert. 

Our server was very friendly and attentive. Enjoyed his good service throughout.  They were very busy during lunch time when we went. They were completely full, yet our server kept up with great service.
author: Yuko H.

description:
Best steak in the Bay Area and amazing atmosphere.

Completely worth it the wait, make sure to book early!
author: Marily N.

description:
When you enter Kokkari, the ambiance is warm, lively, and inviting and you know you're in for a special evening. We went here to celebrate two birthdays and had a royal experience both times. Everything from the gracious service to the outstanding food, makes Kokkari one of the best restaurants in SF.

Highlights from our meals included: the Melitzanosalata (eggplant dip with grilled pita), Kalamboki (roasted sweet corn), Kalamata PIta (flatbread with kalamata olives) for starters. For entrees, we loved two of the lamb dishes: the tender lamb rotisserie special and the savory lamb chops. The roasted King salmon was also delicious and cooked perfectly. 

With baklava for dessert and Prosecco to celebrate, we had a stellar experience. This restaurant is a wonderful choice for special occasions.
author: Shira W.

description:
If you're looking for top notch (and expensive) Greek food, Kokkari Estiatorio will be your jam. The beautiful interiors makes you feel like your enjoying dinner over looking the water in Santorini. The menu is simple and easy to navigate (a little easier if you're Greek?) but with the help of your waiter you'll know exactly what to choose with some recommendations. 

To get the best bang for your buck, share a number of small plates and an entree or two with your group. I recommend the beets, lamb meatballs, lamb chops and zucchini cakes . For dessert, be sure to try the loukoumades and baklava ice cream. DELICIOUS! They also have amazing seafood. 

Yes, your bill will reflect the quality of the food, but trust me it is well worth it. This place is perfect for a special night out or a "treat yoself" splurge. 

On my list of places to return!
author: Kahfii K.

description:
I came here for a birthday. I called a month before to make a reservation. My reservation was 8:15 but we arrived at 7:40. They gave us a table soon.
The service was really good. The server explained is today's menu well. He is knowledgeable.
What we ate were
1. Octopus. Sooo soft and tasty. How did it make them so soft?! Massaging?
2. Goat stew. Goat, artichoke, other veggies w many spices. So many flavored and I can enjoy different taste every spoons.
3. Lamb chop. The best lamb chop ever. Sooo tender and tasty. We ordered as
Medium rare but that was good choice. Medium could be good too.
4. Custard and ice cream as dessert. The custard was not too sweet and the best.
We all shared the dishes but we were really full and got half of stew back to home.
I wanna come here and try another dishes too.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: Expect A fantastic experience if you wish to indulge in amazing Greek / medi food. We went there for a business meeting / dinner, were 6 of us and it turned out to be a great choice. We ordered a bunch of things, and loved ALL th dishes we ordered. The oysters were really well cooked, the lamb chops and the shank were succulent and juicy - melts in your mouth with all the flavours. The baklava icecream to top it all was great too. Great collection of wines and whiskies if you prefer having a drink with your meal. The service was great too, if you are undecided, go with what they recommend, you won't be disappointed. :)
author: Rohit K.

description: This is now one of my favorite places. As you enter, it is difficult not to have your breath taken away by the warm ambiance of big, comfy chairs and an extremely impressive and large fireplace. The food is absolutely amazing. The whole fish is quite moist with the right amount of spices and lemon to compliment but not overpower the natural flavor of the centerpiece. The kolokithikeftethes (zucchini cakes) was absolutely delightful, light and crispy. The sunchokes were accompanied with orange zest but could have done with a bit less oil. Great service. And don't miss on their wonderful greek coffee, which is somewhat like an espresso and comes in three levels of sweetness.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Absolutely love this place - amazing, high quality food. Servers were very attentive, made solid recommendations, and overall, tries to take care of you and your party. I'd highly recommend the rib eye steak and the lamb shanks. Of course, the fish of the day is great too, if you're willing to pay extra. This place is busy, every night of the week, which is a solid sign. 

My only complaint is the valet is $15 and when handing them $20 - they ask if you "want change." That's an un-classy move for a classy establishment - be humble - while the food and service inside were amazing, the valet service certainly leaves a sour taste in your mouth at the end of a great experience.
author: Mark S.

description:
My favorite restaurant ever. As a fellow Greek, it is always so hard to find authentic, delicious Greek food. Every time I come here the food is just as delicious as the time before. The only downfall is trying something new because my favorite dish I can't seem to get away from are the lamb chops! 

I bought the cookbook, and it's all similar to my Yia Yia's cooking, so it makes me feel right at home! The olive oil is the best thing ever, I swear I would drink it if I could!! 

Service is top notch, no matter where you sit. It's amazing just watching them work, they are fantastic. Can't wait to go back!
author: Anna H.

description:
Went with work and the service was impeccable as well as the food.

The lamb and all the dips, as well as the blood orange Dessert
author: Laura G.

description: My sister, niece and I were here tonight before a theater engagement, a place we have been before for appetizers and drinks. We ordered two rounds of drinks by the window where you can perch a drink while we waited for seats to become available at the bar. Finally my niece found a seat at the bar a few feet away from us, ordered some appetizers, but customers rushed ahead of us whenever a place was available so we simply stayed in place. After an hour at our perch, my niece handed us a tiny appetizer plate with two hors d'ouvres. Suddenly a manager, I believe Dimitrios confronted us angrily for eating food when we were not seated at the bar. We tried to explain we had been waiting for a long while, and had ordered things, but others who hadn't been waiting as long as us had taken the available seats. He did not relent: and was obnoxious. We settled our $100 bar bill not having sat down, and left feeling very hurt, and humiliated. It was degrading and unpleasant.
author: Ms S.

description:
I came here for my birthday a few months back with my best friend from high school and I wasn't super wowed after having huge expectations based on all the high yelp reviews. People go crazy over the zucchini cakes and I didn't think they were anything special. We ordered the octopus appetizer which was good enough but a little small. I had the Psari Psito (traditional grilled whole fish with horta & lemon). Don't remember what the fish was but I do remember that it tasted fresh and hearty. We also had two desserts that were great. Service was attentive. Price is right for the type of "casual upscale dining" in SF.

TLDR; (I know it wasn't that long) --- I think it's overrated, but it is good enough to warrant a visit. I would definitely recommend going if you LOVE Greek food.
author: Liz R.

description:
Came here for lunch today with a friend after hearing so many good things about this place not to mention the high rating on yelp. Wish I had known better and gone elsewhere for lunch. We ordered 5 starters and an entree to share (wanted to try as many dishes as we could):
Zucchini cakes $12.25 - small, lukewarm, nothing special to say, just literally 2 zucchini cakes
Spanakotiropita $10.25 - again, lukewarm, and honestly the worst spanakotiropita I've ever had... don't know how they managed to make such tasteless, subpar pastry
Kalamari $12.75 - baby squids on a plate, nothing special to say about them, edible
Peinirli - good texture, really liked the bread, but again, the toppings were just ok
Grilled Meatballs $14.35 - 4 mini meatballs in tomato sauce, would have at least expected this to be served hot, but obviously that was too much to ask lol at this point my friend and I were just annoyed by all the food we had been served and after a bite we did not want to waste any more stomach space. 
Grilled Lamb Chops $32.5 - the only dish that was actually good. The waiter knew we were sharing the dish so had served us the lamb chops on two separate plates.

The waiter had told us that the starters are in very small portions and would be be what we expect them to be; he was too right on that... every starter were so small and when they're charging on average $14 per starter dish, the only justification would be their taste. I honestly have to say every single one of them were just disappointing, bland, forgettable, subpar, and worst of all, they were all served lukewarm as if they had been made a while ago. This is just literally the worst Greek restaurant I've been. Do not at all understand how it has such high ratings, can only say I felt so scammed....

If you like wasting money then go see it for yourself, otherwise save yourself the trip and go to a local sandwich place because it'd give you more satisfaction than this place by a long shot. One word: BAD
author: Ping L.

description: Romantic restaurant with rustic decor, great for dinner dates. Food from appetizer to entrees were delicious and seasoned well!
author: Kay D.

description: I hate to repeat everything that has already been said. I will simply say outstanding. Food was unreal and the service was perfect. Warm and attentive but not hovering. We've traveled the world and this rates in the top 10 of all time.
author: Mark S.

description: Among the best meals that I've had in this city. The lamb is out of this world, as are the octopus and shrimp appetizers. Do note that the food manages to stay close to its traditional Greek roots -- this is not at all experimental. Strong recommendation.
author: John L.

description:
After a lifetime of worshipping the ground that John Stamos walks on, it's official-- I finally have a Greek boyfriend.

Prior to dining at Kokkari Estiatorio, my only familiarization with Greek food was Daphne's Greek Cafe, which is probably the equivalent of Jollibee to Filipinos or Taco Bell to Mexicans. I know, shame on me. Then in the early days of courtship, he suggested we eat at Kokkari to introduce my palate to Greek cuisine. I thought Wow, he must really want me to like him!

Needless to say, Kokkari does not disappoint. The dining rooms are dimly lit and very intimate, and we were set next to the fireplace-looking rotisserie which really made for a romantic setting.

To start, we ordered the housemade grilled pita bread and chose tzatziki, melitzanosalata (eggplant), and taramosalata (carp roe) as our spreads. It came with dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves), kalamata olives, and pickled vegetables. While tzatziki is definitely one of the most popular Greek dips, I liked the taramosalata the most because it had a very rich, almost caviar-like flavor.

We also ordered the grilled octopus, spanakotiropita, saghanaki (pan-fried cheese), and lamb riblets. The octopus was deliciously seasoned and had the perfect balance of tenderness and char. The spanakotiropita was a yummy, flaky crisp of spinach and feta goodness, and the fried cheese had a delectably salty yet lemony note to accompany its gooey richness. 

He must have been REALLY excited to introduce me to Greek food because we ordered so much food for two people. I don't know if the waitress forgot our lamb riblets or she just noticed that I was huffing and puffing to finish the appetizers, but I was actually thankful that they didn't come out because I was incredibly full and we still had lamb chops coming. We really must eat with our eyes though because I saw those beautiful, medium rare lamb chops and started drooling again. They were tender and mouthwatering, and they instantly became my favorite part of the meal.

We ordered galaktoboureko for dessert, aka filo-wrapped semolina custard. It was a delightful union of textures and flavors with the flakiness of the filo, the smoothness of the custard, and the crunchy-creaminess of the pistachio ice cream. It was the perfect ending to an already beautifully executed meal.

------------------------------------------
UPDATE: I have now eaten here maybe about 5 times. Usually what we've done is order a bunch of mezethes (small plates/appetizers) then skip to dessert. See above for my diary entry and skim for a description of some of the dishes.

Menu items I recommend:
-Spread platter w/ pita bread: Still get the taramosalata, tzatziki & melitzanosalata, but I also recommend tirokafteri. It's a hot pepper and cheese spread, and I may even love it just as much as the taramosalata.
-Grilled lamb riblets: Still love the lamb chops, but the riblets are fall off the bone.
-Octopus
-Spanakotiropita
-Branzino (great option for non-lamb eaters)
-Galaktoboureko over the baklava, but both are good

Items I could skip:
-Crispy zucchini cakes
-Grilled calamari (kalamari)
-Greek coffee (almost like an espresso; really thick with coffee sediment on the bottom)
-Selection of Greek cookies
-Loukoumades (Greek doughnuts)
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: The staff was warm, friendly and informative. They were able to help us choose apps or salads that would feed just the right amount of people. The food was fabulous. The service was excellent and the ambiance in the room was just perfect. The lighting was not to bright, lots of candles to give it a warm, cozy feeling. Kokarri never lets us down, and is always more than a pleasure to go!
author: Kimberly W.

description:
The best Greek restaurant hands down. I worked in a Greek restaurant, in SF years ago and I know my Greek quite well. These guys are the bomb and then some, the garlic prawns , artichoke and eggplant Souvlaki , Taziki , and rack of Lamb!! superb !! I've had the Branzino here before fabulous too!! 
The atmosphere is an incredible mix of family ran, display kitchen with elegant linens and great service. Come dressed casual or dressy all are welcomed here.
author: Dulcie C.

description:
Everything about Kokkari impressed me. Service, ambience, and most of the all... the food. In my opinion, there is nothing better than high class food served in a casual and lively atmosphere. This is exactly what you get here. The food is rustic and just so delicious. 
There are two must order dishes when you're here... The grilled octopus appetizer and the grilled lamb chop entree. Game over!
author: Sam A.

description:
I started with the grilled calamari stuffed with feta, fennel, orange & black olives, then the main course of Arnisio Souvlaki: spiced lamb skewer grilled with onion, bay leaf, tomato, tzatziki & Kokkari potatoes lamb on a skewer.  Both of these dishes were excellent; portions were generous and perfectly prepared. 
We enjoyed the Hitching Post Hartley Ostini Merlot which was ideal with the lamb. Easy to rate Kokkari 5 stars.
author: IQuack D.

description: I've been here many times throughout the years and food was always pretty good. A day ago decided to have dinner there. The positives: wait staff is very friendly and hopeful that I had enjoyed the food. Unfortunately the food was not great. I had souvlaki which were supposed to be medium done and just slightly pink inside. I've received chunks that were raw inside and so chewy I didn't know what to do with it . The meat quality was AWFUL. There were 3 pieces of meat left on my plate when I finally decided I can't eat this and sent it back to have properly prepared dish. When my replacement was served ... there were exactly 3 pieces of meat on the plate LOL! How low and cheap! I probably wouldn't have been able to finish the dish anyway, but it's bad form to just replace exact leftover portion. No apology. No offer of comping anything . I am sorely dissatisfied and WILL NOT BE BACK. in a city like San Francisco to serve such substandard food is unacceptable. There are plenty of other establishments that take pride in the food they serve. Kokkari is not one of them.
author: rinna s.

description:
A killer Mediterranean restaurant with a unique decor and an eclectic menu!

I was a little over doing the expensive-italian-cuisine-route for my birthday and was craving some Grecian flavors! #firstworldproblems

I am so happy I did because the food here was extraordinary! First off, you must try the Kolokithokeftethes (crispy zucchini cakes with cucumber & mint-yogurt dressing). These bad boys taste similar to a vegetarian version of a crab cake. They are cooked to perfection and the mint-yogurt is the perfect tangy offset.

Next up were the entrees- I got the Psari Psito - traditional grilled Sea Bass with horta & lemon or. It's really nice that they take the bones out for you so you are not awkwardly plucking them out of your mouth, though I did find one or two little guys! Anyways, the fish was cooked to perfection and I loved the crispy skin. It also felt nice to go out and eat something fairly healthy.

Last but not least we got the baklava and ice cream. To me, it is necessary to eat baklava at a Mediterranean restaurant. The baklava ROCKED (flaky, flavorful, perfect portion size) and I love the ice cream addition.

Next time I will also be taking home a bottle of their olive oil! It was amazing.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Lamb is what they are known for and I would agree! Both the halibut and lamb chops were out of his world. Packed with flavor and cooked perfectly.

I don't know what else to say. The ambiance is homey. There will probably be a wait so reservations are recommended. We got lucky and two seats opened up at the bar as soon as we arrived so we didn't have to wait but there were plenty of people waiting for a table.
author: Jess A.

description: I have been here multiple times and never had a bad meal. They have two different fried cheese options on the menu... Do I really need to say more? I would go here every week if I could and suggest you do the same:)
author: Holden C.

description:
Love this place! I'm a huge fan of Greek food and was looking forward to having dinner here. Appetizers of saganaki, and also roasted cauliflower were delicious. My lamb chops were spectacular in lemon and oregano. Others with me had the chicken, the sole, and the goat stew. No one was disappointed. I love to have dessert but it's always a challenge as I have issues with both gluten and dairy. Pear/ouzo sorbet?? Whaaat?!! Fantastic!!

Special thanks to the manager, Robert, for so graciously allowing me to add one more person to my party (bringing us from 4 to 5) just a couple of hours before our reservation. You made my night!

This is truly a special place. Large enough to be lively and fun but decorated so as to be cozy and intimate. Would love to come back!
author: M S.

description:
Made a reservation to eat here with my family because I've heard amazing things, and I was not disappointed.

We ordered a slew of appetizers, including the yogurt stuffed calamari which was gorgeous, delicious, and texturally impressive considering the preparation of the squid was likely boiled(?)

I got the lamb burger, which was incredible. I never order burgers, but this sounded basically like a gyro with a patty instead of shaved meat. It was so much more. The patty was thick and dense but still wieldy, and the pita wrapped around it was the perfect soft texture.

I felt like I ordered a bunch of seemingly casual/basic items, and I was amazed by how they created masterpieces from the crayons that are burgers and calamari.

That's not to say I didn't try the halibut steal my mom ordered, which was super moist and delicate. I was lead to believe that no item on the medium/large menu would serve you wrong.

Pros:
-food was amazing
-atmosphere was rustic but uber-classy
-service was speedy and superb

Cons:
-$$$$
-popular joint, good luck getting a reso less than a month in advance
author: Gabriel D.

description: Attention to detail separates great restaurants from good ones. Kokkari has figure this out--from the attentive wait staff to the amazing presentation of the dishes served at every course. The spreads here were such a cut above, from the tzadziki to the       Lemon yogurt sauce. You can't go wrong with any of the lamb dishes. The lamb on a skewer was the best I've had. Every fish dish we ordered was so fresh! Ambiance was amazing too; like dining in an upscale living room. Great for a conversation too. So worth the $$.
author: Nancy K.

description:
The biggest difference between Kokkari and its sister restaurant, Evvia, is that Kokkari has more interesting (IMO) starters. I've been a frequent diner at Evvia for years, so I rolled in here with a good idea of what I wanted to order.

The lamb chops (duh!), wood oven roasted prawns, and kataifi dessert were amazing. No surprise there. The duck ravioli sounded good, but the filling was too dense. I also tried the baked feta, which turned out to be too salty for my taste.

For a guaranteed good meal, skip all the frills and fancy shit and just get the lamb chops.
author: Suany W.

description:
I'm really not sure what all the hype is about this place? The experience was top notch, but the food itself (which should have been the star at a restaurant, am I right?) was lackluster. 

Kokkari is impeccably decorated and the attention to detail with decor is fantastic. It feels like you're stepping into another world when you walk in and from start to finish you'll be treated like royalty. They really have nailed the service aspect of things- every person my group encountered really seemed like they would bend over backward to make sure our visit was a great one- they obviously take great care and attention when hiring staff!

My group wasn't overly hungry so we opted for a mix of the "mezethes" or appetizers. We got a broad range and got the grilled octopus, hummus & taramosalata dips with fresh pita bread, lamb riblets, grilled artichoke and eggplant skewers and the saghanaki.

I guess the problem with places that are so hyped up is that you expect to be blown off your seat with the food. It was GOOD food, it just wasn't worth the hype in my opinion if that makes sense? Definitely a good meal but nothing was more special than you'd get from any of the other Greek restaurants around town.

If you're in the mood for killer Greek food my recommendation would be to go somewhere else- if you're in the mood for an overall great experience where you'll feel like a princess and can live with good but not great food then this is an excellent choice!
author: Elliott W.

description: Still one of my all time favorite places!  Yummy! It's a San Francisco institution and I try to visit each time I'm back in town.
author: Comet E.

description:
It took a couple tries for me to find the right door to enter the restaurant, but once we did, I was super duper happy.
...It was raining pretty hard outside. Who wouldn't be excited to get outta the rain?
Great place to go if you want to test someone's pronunciation skills. The names of each item on the menu are complicated. I think that's why my girl decided to take me here for my birthday! They even test the waiters' pronunciation skills! 

Price: Look to spend at least $30 per entree.

Parking: Street. We UBERed.

Food:
- Zucchini cakes (actual name is complicated!!), per yelpers suggestions, was our appetizer. It came out to be two thick zucchini cakes, probably the diameter of a tennis ball or so, and some tatziki sauce. It was super delicious, flavorful, and just the right texture. I enjoyed it very much!

- WHOLE FISH is what I ordered. The fish of the day was sea bass which I took grilled with lentils. We were laughing about how this dish could not possibly be a whole piece of fish, but it was! I did SERIOUS damage though. This was super tasty and quite refreshing. I loved squeezing the lemon on which added zest. My only complaint would be that this dish was swimming in oil.

- Pork chop special is what my girl ordered. There were about 5 hefty pieces of pork that were moist and lean, had the right amount of fat. Of course she only ate 3 pieces because she's notorious for never finishing her COFFEE!

-Baklava - Sweet, crunchy, sticky, not bad

Overall, this restaurant is huge but I would still make reservations. Restrooms are downstairs.
author: Krystle T.

description: AMAZING! let's cut to the chase: order the octopus, grape leaves, lamb meatballs for appetizer. Try the lamb shank or lamb chop for entree and you cannot go wrong. Baklava for dessert and you will leave a happy person. This place is great from the service to every last bite
author: Tian S.

description:
Kokkari is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco and I am a repeat patron! Their food is Amazing! Being raised Greek, it can be hard to impress me with Greek cuisine, but Kokkari hits out of the park every time and has a way of making their food feel authentic yet refined. This is a great place to catch up with a good friend, have a date night, or host a gathering. I would highly recommend this place to my Vegan and Carnivor friends alike! 
Looking for dress code recommendations? Smart Casual
author: Afroditi Dionysia P.

description:
Another week in San Francisco and another fantastic meal at Kokkari! I reserved about a month out and I am so glad that I did, as they book up far in advance. 

I arrived with a colleague a few minutes before our reservation and we were immediately taken to our table. We decided to order family style and tried all new dishes! Feta stuffed calamari was excellent, unique and very tender. The Greek salad was classic and simple with perfectly plump tomatoes. The artichoke and eggplant skewer was very good and is definitely a new favorite. We shared the seabass or branzino, that was simply grilled and made me feel as though I was back in Europe, eating fresh fish. We washed it all down with a glass of their Santorini white wine. Service was wonderful and we left full and so satisfied. Such a staple restaurant in San Francisco!
author: Brittany F.

description:
Just one of my favorite buildings in SF in a beautiful location nestled off into a nook of SF.

The ambiance is beautiful, but not stiff like many places that try. It gets a five star for a great location and service..

The food is different and I don't have too much experience with Greek food, but give it a shot. It isn't my particular favorite cuisine, but some dishes definitely stood out.

Lamb riblets. Yes. Moussaka. A sort of stew. Ok, not necessarily a favorite, but the choices are endless. I'll be back to try others, but Greek cuisine just isn't my cup of tea. Yet.

All in all, simply put a lovely location that I highly recommend you check out and forge your own experience. If anywhere to try Greek, this is it!
author: Joseph L.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco hands down! The meatballs are my favorite and the watermelon is the best watermelon I've ever had. The service is second to none the ambience and romantic scenery always allows for a great evening especially coupled with the wonderful food that this restaurant serves.   Special occasions, holidays, or just a brunch -- it's the place to go!  Dress well.
author: Shuwaski Y.

description: Yup. Solid everything. On point. Here's what I tried. Prawns, zucchini tart, meatballs, lamb shank, rib eye, ouzo sorbet, chocolate cake and yogurt with fruit. A*++
author: Adidas W.

description:
We had a nice meal here. I really expected to be blown away. I was told this was going to be the best meal of my life. It was good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. 

Great wine selection. Ambiance is awesome. Service was unmatched. Food was just ok.
author: David E.

description:
Such an incredible experience. We came without a reservation and they were totally full- so we were just planning on waiting for something to open up at the bar. After about 30min- one of the managers came over an introduced himself and we told him that we really wanted to eat there but didn't have a reservation and no one was even looking like they were leaving from the bar. He walked away and like 2 min later showed us to a bomb table in front of the fire place. The food was BOMB! We were able to capture a bit of footage here if you want to see it live:

https://youtu.be/Ohu78ghe39A
author: DustinVeronica L.

description:
Kokkari is on my list of 'must visit' San Francisco Restaurants whenever I'm in town. One does need to make a reservation about a month in advance though for the more popular dinner times.

On this visit, I started with the grilled octopus which was exceptionally prepared. The seasoning was perfect and octopus grilled to perfection. Instead of a main, I elected to have the shrimp appetizer which was also well prepared albeit a bit heavier than I had expected. Dessert was an amazing Greek yogurt with honey and dates...finished with traditional Greek coffee. 

The only downside to this visit was that it was too warm for them to have a rotisserie option, which I have enjoyed in the past. As I don't eat lamb, it limited my main options. Otherwise a great dinner.
author: Michael R.

description:
I've been to Kokkari for lunch and dinner (as well as its sister restaurant in Silicon Valley). It's the best Greek fine dining I've had yet in this city. While that's not a terribly competitive category, Kokkari is a great restaurant all on its own. The service alone is notably friendly, thoughtful, and efficient -- better than multiple Michelin-starred restaurants I've tried in the past.

My top recommendations are the grilled octopus and a roasted or pan-friend fish. Get it with the head and tail on for the full experience. If you're price-sensitive, it's worth asking what the AQ items cost that day; don't expect that they'll be about the average of the other mains.
author: David S.

description: An absolutely fantastic Greek dining experience. The food are unpretentious and overall tasty. Among the dishes we tried, the octopus is the best one.
author: Alisson H.

description: Great food.  They may be getting a little complacent. Expect to be treated like a second class citizen If you don't have a reservation. The service is good but not great. Sit at the bar if possible and enjoy great food and drink.
author: Matthew C.

description: If you get the chance try Kokkari. Very professional staff. Great place for anniversary or take someone special.
author: Jaime V.

description:
You must come here super hungry!  There is so much to choose from.  We had a hard time picking what we wanted, but ended up getting an assortment of foods to try with the help of our host.  Everyone here is very helpful, so A+ on service for sure.

Kokkari is fun for any occasion - we got drinks at the bar before our dinner so that was a treat in itself - the drinks are good.  I can't say my moscow mule was that strong, but my dates martini drink was!  We had the hummus - I went for the one advertised as "spicy," but don't worry, it's not spicy at all.  The pita bread was buttery delicious.  Then we went for the grilled octopus which was good.  My date had the lamb chops and I went for the sea bass.  Everything was mild in flavor, but you can tell it was fresh.  

Overall, you'll have a fun night at Kokkari.
author: Julie C.

description:
Kokkari Estiatorio is one of the most popular dining hotspots in SF. It took months in advance to secure a reservation (yes, they're THAT hot).
