A brisk 10-15 minute walk from the Pier/Embarcadero, Kokkari Estiatorio is where the party is at in this neighborhood (all else around is a small park, a bank and lots of apartments). In all, parking is quite do-able in this area...but I still prefer to walk (only a 9 minute walk from the Embarcadero bart station). Although the food was good, I was not blown away. Sure, it'll always be a safe location that won't ever disappoint if I were to ever recommend a place in the city to dine at but, at the end of the night, there wasn't much that captivated me/left me lingering to come back for more....except maybe the kolokithokeftethes! Really a 3.5 but I'll round up.

Kolokithokeftethes - What a tongue twister! They're crispy zucchini cakes/fritters and they were the best dish of the night. Formed into discs of patty perfection, these zucchini cakes look unassuming but once you become acquainted, there is no going back. The zucchini cakes melt in your mouth on first bite. The addition of feta bits in the mix is what makes this dish so sweet and savory. Dip it in the pecso with cucumber & mint-yogurt dressing and it's golden.

Marithes Tiganites - I've been a fan of fried smelts for quite some time now. These were crispy without being over fried and I was so glad that they weren't drenched in oil- i could attest to this as I may have accidentally wiped my "greased" fingers on my white shirt instead of the table napkin. Major fail. After freaking out and then thoroughly examining my top, the stain was only mild and there was nothing to worry about! Phew!   

Moussaka - Eggplant, lamb, and potato all strategically laid in casserole form. This dish faired much better than the rest of my group's entrees. I've have overly creamy moussakas before and was quite happy that that didn't occur at Kokkari's! Go ahead and satisfy your tastebuds with this savory dish. 

Ippoglossa -Pacific halibut steak with fregola, spinach, artichokes & a farina pepper puree. The halibut was very bland. I was never a fan of fish steak and the Ippoglossa, sadly, reaffirmed that feeling.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
5 starts for the food, minutes one star for keeping us waiting by the door even with a reservation for about 20 minutes, and the bartender being so rude. 
We tried many of the appetizers .. the frets, souvlaku, and octapus were top notch
author: Shirin E.

description: Really good restaurant. The waitstaff and bartenders are beyond the highest standards and set the tone for a wonderful experience. All the food was delicious with the seafood being the highlight. Huge restaurant, but not loud.
author: Harper T.

description: I've recently visited Kokkari and was nicely surprised! Food was delicious and thanks to Sophia the only Greek girl , who gave me tour- menu and  explained me Greek dishes plus told me about the Greek culture. Sophia was very friendly and helpful ,I really felt like I'm in the Greece . Definitely will come back enjoy Greek vibe !
author: Veronika L.

description:
Lived up to its hype - which is always such a pleasure to experience. Went here for a fairly quick business lunch-for-two, was seated right away and they even placed us by the window seat as I'd requested in the reservation!
Though the menu has big-ticket items, the quality of food and service is well on point to justify it. We shared the Grilled Octopus starter and had the Lamb Chops (pictured) for our main each. They forgot to bring my colleague's lime soda which was a tad disappointing, but no biggie in the grand scheme of things. 10/10, would eat here again :-)
author: Gia P.

description: This place is so good. Even better if you can convince them to sit you in the front room. Like most restaurants, I could live solely on the app menu. In particular, and mentioned a thousands times before, are the zucchini cakes; I wholeheartedly agree. No one makes these better, except maybe and granny (or gramps) on some Greek island somewhere. The octopus is superb as well. They employ state secrets to ensure the octopus is the most tender, exactly the way you'd find it in Greece, Portugal or any country lining the beautiful Mediterranean and adjacent seas. We mains, we were treated to an off-menu goat stew with artichoke hearts, spices with cinnamon and star anise and also took the grilled branzino (forget the greek name they call it there.)  Corkage is $25, yet there's no better way to start the evening than their Anderson Valley bubbly by the glass. Cheers.
author: Brian J.

description:
It was actually crowded for a Sunday evening but had a nice vibe - a bit more of an "upscale" dress code for SF which is a nice change from the jeans and sneakers you see every day!  I liked the hand painted plates with fish, definitely nice attention to detail here.  

The menu had a wide range of choices.  We asked our waitress how big the portions of dip were and she motioned a circle the size of plum so we naturally decided to go with 2 dips.  However, when the appetizers came out, they came with a large portion of pita bread and a few cucumbers and pickled vegetables.  The dips were bigger than what we expected but they were really good.  Taramosalata was yummy.  

We also tried the Octopus which was nicely grilled and soft not overcooked at all.  The Greek salad was simple but fresh as well.  

The lamb main course dish was good, I felt like it was a tiny bit dry.  My grandmother always prepares leg of lamb at Easter and it's juicy and full of garlic, lemon and those yummy roasted potatoes.

Overall, I think the food was really good, service was a bit slow in the beginning but I guess for a Sunday evening, shouldn't be expecting really fast or rushed service. 

I will definitely be back to try more dishes!
author: Kimberly L.

description: OMG, serisouly best Greece food in bay area. Nothing to complain. Make sure to book an appointmet early before going. Highly recommend peach salad and lamb chops.
author: Shannon S.

description:
If you are in the mood for high end Greek food, Kokkari is the place to go. You will need to make a reservation ahead of time if you want to dine between 6-9pm but I found a 10pm a few days before my visit.

The restaurant is dimly lit and attracts a chic crowd. The server talked of it as an institution rather than a restaurant and thought we were lucky in landing a reservation. He explained the menu in detail and pointed out his favorite items.

To start, I tried the Kolokithokeftehes (crispy fried zucchini cakes) which were surprisingly fluffy and light, and the Papio Manti which is crispy baked duck ravioli. The best dish was Arnisia Pardakia which was a beautifully seasoned grilled lamb chop. The highlight of my meal was without a doubt the dessert: the Galaktoboureko is filled with a self indulgent custard in a golden crispy pastry and was the perfect ending to my meal.

Nothing I had was lo-cal here but it was certainly delicious, and I fully enjoyed my dining experience.
author: German M.

description: Pretty good food and ambience. The serving staff is welcoming too. They have valet parking available which is a big plus. But more than that - the food is really good. The starters are amazing. I tried a lot of items from their menu and must say that they all were delicious. Their meatballs, octopus, goat stew and steak was very flavorful and delicious. Have been here twice now and won't mind visiting again.
author: Varun V.

description: Great place with great food. The stake was much better than many of other places I was. Trendy place with a good atmosphere and pleasant staff.
author: Victoria R.

description:
Make a reservation!! And well in advance! Even for lunch reservations. My friend and I came for lunch on a weekday and it was definitely pretty busy (even all the way until 2pm when we left)

The restaurant is pretty classy, so thank goodness I wasn't wearing the brightly-patterned yoga pants you'd normally find me in. Definitely a good spot for any sort of special occasion or a business lunch. Service is what you would expect from a nice restaurant - friendly, attentive, nothing really noteworthy though.

They serve complimentary bread and olive oil while you're waiting for your food. Nothing special, but the bread was soft and moist.

Per 7x7 and Yelp's recommendations, my friend and I ordered the zucchini cakes as appetizers. I got the lamb souvlaki for my entree and my friend got the grilled lamb chops. A lot of the other appetizers sounded really good too, like the grilled octopus and grilled calamari, but there's only so much two people can eat :( Next time!

Overall, food is well prepared and well seasoned, and I would definitely return, but unfortunately I wasn't impressed enough to be dying to come back, especially at the prices. Lunch is reasonably affordable but dinner is on the pricey end. 

----------

-ZUCCHINI CAKES ($11.50) - 4/5
[with cucumber and mint yogurt dressing]
2 perfectly fried zucchini cakes. Great texture: soft, moist and cheesy on the inside, crisp and lightly battered on the outside, and not overly greasy like fried things tend to be. The tzatziki was nice and tangy and complemented the zucchini cakes well. Pretty good overall, but I'm not a huge fan of feta and the zucchini cakes were a little too cheesy for me to love them.

-LAMB SOUVLAKI ($24.50) - 4/5
[marinated lamb skewered with tomato, onion and bay leaf; served with chickpea salad, tzatziki and pita]
I asked for my lamb to be cooked medium rare but some pieces, while still pinkish, were a little overcooked (more on the medium side of medium rare) and a little too tough for me. Flavors were still good though. I don't really like chickpeas, but I enjoyed the refreshing acidity and the rest of the components of the salad. I liked the light/tangy tzatziki as well (although I wasn't really sure what I was supposed to eat it with), and the grilled pita was soft and surprisingly delicious.

-GRILLED LAMB CHOPS ($30) - 4.5/5
[with lemon-oregano vinaigrette and potatoes]
I tried some of my friend's lamb chops (medium rare) and they were pretty amazing. Super tender and flavorful, but super fatty (although I'm pretty sure that's why they're so good). Well-made but as delicious as they were, they were lacking something that distinguished them from other lamb I've had. Kind of pricey for only 2 somewhat small lamb chops too.
author: Jessie L.

description:
On a Thursday I made a reservation for an important business lunch on a Monday. 

On Friday I left town on a trip. When I got to my destination Friday night, I saw I had a voicemail from Kokkari asking me to confirm my reservation. I'm thinking, "why? I just made it yesterday". It was too late to call back.

On Saturday they leave me *another* voicemail. Now, I'm thinking, wow, they mean it - they are going to give my reservation away if I don't return this call. I try to return the call at 5:30 during business hours  - I get a recorded message, and they ask me *not* to leave a voicemail confirming. I need to talk to someone live. I don't call back since I'm entertaining people.

On Sunday night, I try again during dinner hours around 6:30. Again no one answers. 

I get back from travels on Monday. They don't man their phones in the morning, so I can't confirm. I now think I'm in serious danger of losing my reservation - they imply on both voicemails that I need to call if I want to confirm it. And why would they call me twice if that wasn't the case?

This is an important lunch - I can't afford to show up and find out they gave away my reservation. So I cancel and go somewhere else.

Yes, I know why they call to confirm reservations - if people don't show up they want to try to backfill and not lose the revenue. 

But this story illustrates why it is such a freakin hassle - especially when they don't staff their phone line and don't take voicemails. 

What is the point of online reservations if you need to call the next day and say, yes, I really did mean to make that reservation?

The food at Kokkari is great, but if you make a reservation you are signing yourself up for a couple of days of telephone tag with the threat of losing the reservation that you just made.
author: Michael W.

description:
I want to start by saying that the customer service and the food have never disappointed any of the handful of times I have been into Kokkari. If anything, it is some of the clientele that they attract that can truly ruin an experience. On Saturday 10/28, I checked in at 8:30 with a brunette hostess who very politely informed us that a few tables were still paying their tabs and as soon as they got up, they would get my party seated. I could see that they were a bit backed up and I understand that this is by no means the restaurant's fault, as they were doing the best they could for a busy Saturday evening. As I was waiting on the ramp to be seated, a very disgruntled group of four who had been told the same thing about their table caused a disturbing scene. A man from the group got into the poor hostess's face and was literally yelling at her because he had had to wait to be seated. She tried calmly to explain that this was not personal or intentional, and that she was sorry for the inconvenience. This man continued to berate her and became increasingly aggressive until she told him she was going to get a manager. This man then yelled at the manager and yelled, "I am a CEO!" My party and I were both appalled and entertained by the sense of entitlement and self-importance. When he started cursing loudly at the manager and drew attention from diners, the manager asked him to leave, and he and his cranky friends stormed out and were saying this was "racist". APPALLING. Nothing that any of the staff did was rude, unprofessional, or racist in ANY WAY and I felt compelled to reiterate this. Unfortunately Mr. CEO didn't get what he wanted and calling the service racist seemed to be his only way of vindication. Too bad. 

The food is great, with a nice rustic ambiance that is not too stuffy. You NEED a reservation, unless you are open to standing for awhile to nab a bar seat. Highly recommend the lamb chop and the baklava ice cream!
author: Keith R.

description: My husband and I love, love, LOVE Kokkari! It is our go-to spot for a romantic date night. The service is great and attentive, beautiful ambiance & restaurant overall and the food is outstanding! They have great appetizers and wine and we always split the fish when we go. I highly recommend trying it. The lentil soup is also fantastic. On any given night the restaurant is crowded or fully booked, for obvious reasons since it is insanely popular. If we feel like dropping in without a reservation we gladly find a seat at the bar and chat with our favorite bartender Fatah. Kokkari is a must try spot in San Francisco and you will not be disappointed!
author: Tobi A.

description:
One of the most popular upscale Greek/Mediterranean cuisine in the Bay Area. Had the opportunity to dine here with a friend and we really enjoyed our evening here. We had a late reservation so the restaurant was quite empty. This is definitely a restaurant for a special occasion but we were just here for a casual dinner. I recommend dressy attire to fit the classy ambience. It was a beautiful rustic type of atomosphere with tables dimly lit with lamps, throne like velvet chairs, with an elegant bar filled with a wall of liquor. They have no cocktail list, but there is still a wide variety of spirits and wines offered at Kokkari. Be sure to check out the impressive wine list and the wines they offer btg. 

The pan seared greek cheese appetizer was quite ordinary. It just tasted like a good fried cheese. It was amazing with the wine but I did expected something to wow me if I'm paying that price for a medium sized, rectangular shaped with a side of lemon and oregano fried cheese. I was also highly interested in other appetizers such as the baked feta, watermelon feta, zucchini cakes, lamb meatballs, and lamb riblets but a person can only have so many appetizers, right? The grilled octopus was really good, grilled to perfection with a hint of lemon zest, fresh oregano and olive oil as the sauce. Simple, good, but not memorable. There are daily rotisserie specials that are roasted in an open fire in the beginning of the shift. I don't know how I feel about having the rotisserie special late at night when I know that it's made hours ago, hmm. I don't want the ends and bits so I opted for other main plates. Honestly, I wanted everything lamb from the beginning to the end but I told myself to relax and don't get too excited. I ended up having the lamb chops, very very simple (just like the octopus dish, not memorable) three chops nicely grilled but not evenly flavored with a lemon oregano vinagrette and potatoes for a banging forty-six bucks. Let's just say I've had better. 

As for service, I expect better coming from a restaurant like this. It's just not as comfortable when the server and busser try to clear your plate a couple of times before you are done. I get the hint, they want me to move along with my meal but the server should be able to tell that I'm trying to enjoy my meal after the first two times, What's the rush? Prior to ordering, there server just didn't seem enthusiastic overall. Did I have to tell him I wanted a spectacular first time for that to happen? 

Overall, very impressed with the establishment itself but the service could be more warm and welcoming and the food can be spiced up a bit. It might or might not been a bad night. I might come to a conclusion that I've ordered the wrong combination of dishes for my meal but don't steer away from trying the other dishes and giving this establishment a try.
author: Carrie C.

description:
Kokkari. I've eaten so many meals here over the last couple of month. This is my favorite restaurant in the city. 
Ambiance is sophisticated, understated charm. Service is friendly and perfectly attentive. 
The food is a real showstopper. Flavors perfectly balanced, simple, fresh. I've been trying to work my way through the menu and everything I've ordered has been perfect. This level of consistency is truly unique and what makes this place one of the best in the city.
author: Becca B.

description:
I've been on a bit of a mission to try all three "highly recommended Greek restaurants" in NorCal  -   Kokkari, Evvia, and Nemea.   

After eating at Kokkari this past weekend I can finally conclude that my favorite out of the 3 is Nemea followed by Evvia and then Kokkari.   

Even though Kokkari only ranks 3rd on my list i'd still recommend it to others.  

Here are the items we got

Taramosalata -  This is the one dish I always get whenever i'm at a Greek restaurant and Kokkari's version does not disappoint.  The flavor and quality is there and the pita bread is on point.  The one thing that kind of made me sad was that their regular bread (the free bread they bring to every table) was not as good as the ones at Nemea or Evvia.  The bread at Nemea and Evvia had this nice slightly burnt char to it and it was even more delicious than the pita bread when you dipped it into the Taramosalata.  If anyone knows if this style of bread has a name please message me!

Traditional whole grilled fish (branzino) -  This was a good dish but not as good as Nemea's version.  The fish itself was slightly overcooked and the spices were not as flavorful

Grilled lambchops -  This was really good and whether or not you like this version or Evvia's version depends on how "fatty" you like your lamb.   Evvia's version was super fatty while Kokkari's version was very tender but not overly fatty.  Kind of like Japanese Wagyu vs. USDA Prime.   

Rotisserie roasted duck -  This was the off the menu special of the day.  For around ~42 dollars you get about 1/3rd of a duck that is slow roasted on a rotisserie stuffed with an assortment of spices.   I was surprised how similar it tasted like Chinese Roasted Duck....which I personally like better...and I would have been able to get an entire Chinese Roasted Duck for less than 40 bucks.   Not to say the duck here was bad, on the contrary it was quite good.

I know my review makes it seem like Kokkari is more like a 3 star restaurant but I do really think it deserves 4 stars...it's just that when compared to Nemea and Evvia I didn't enjoy the food as much at Kokkari.
author: Ben Y.

description: Phenomenal food. Although pricey for me, I would go back to have the trio pork, lamb chops and goat stew every opportunity I get! Kudos to  the quality of food , ambience and service.
author: Sandra M.

description:
Have you heard of Kokkari?  

She's a real beauty, w a chic, sophisticated interior.  

She reminds me of Napa.

A gorgeous fireplace anchors the main dining room.

The table in front of the fireplace?  That's the best table, in my not-so-humble opinion.

The vitals...

The "fries with eyes..."
That's what they call the fried smelt.  Sounds exotic & maybe on the adventurous side.  But dive right in.  I can be a bit squirmy, but these are totally ok; no need to be weirded out.  They're delicious & addictive.

The baked feta is major delicious.

The baked beans?  Divine.

If you love lamb, you'll love it here.  There's the lamb meatballs, lamb riblets, the moussaka, lamb shank,  lamb skewers, & lamb chops.  

The lamb chops are fantastic.  

Don't leave without trying her baklava.  It's fabulous.

And going to the ladies room here is like going to the spa.  You have to take the elevator.  For some reason, I love that.  You walk all the way through the restaurant, past the adjacent dining room, to the elevator.  Then you step off of the elevator into a soothing oasis.  It's just elegant.  

Classy & classic.  A shining star in SF's constellation of restaurants.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I have been coming to Kokkari for years and I love the ambiance and the service staff has always been very professional and friendly. About a month ago, I came to dinner at the bar and as the food and drinks were good, the bartenders were quite rude. This seems disappointing given it is one of our favorite spots for many years now and we are paying a high premium for the experience. 

Thank god Fatah was there the next time I went in. He has the utmost respect for the clientele and I have always been so happy to see him.
author: Brett S.

description: All I can say is love love love i highly recommend the grilled sea bass and the smelts for a appetizer. Best restaurant for a romantic evening or special occasion.
author: Mirna P.

description: Everything I had tasted great. The service was wonderful and the ambiance in the room was just excellent.
author: Brylee C.

description: Off night at Kokkari, food,service just ok. The bartender was salty, unwelcoming to the point of  being rude rude. Been to the restaurant several times, dinner last night was just average. Lamb chops, roasted lamb, and fish dishes were bland and not very exciting. All six people at the table felt the same way. Half the deserts and coffees never made it  to the table!
author: Dan S.

description:
Amazing. Really amazing. My friends and I came here on Saturday evening for dinner and it was wonderful. The restaurant itself is very large, I kept wondering when we would finally get to our table! We brought our own wine & champagne ($20 corkage fee per bottle) and the waiters were very attentive, but not overbearing. The food itself was delicious as well. The chicken item I had was perfectly cooked and moist.  
The restaurant is great for a date or a group. I did notice a small private room downstairs if you want a more intimate party. Beautiful location and great venue. The only eh thing about this place was that the chairs weren't as updated and had cheaper cushions on them, but other than that, nothing but a great overall experience.
author: Sarika S.

description: What racist customer service when we were asked to wait wait for 40 minutes after my reservation was booked two week before. When I called to inform them of us arriving late, I was informed that RSVP was cancelled, which no one canceled. For a good few hours I was surprised how well the manager handled it and was appreciative that the mistake they made was fixed. Once I arrived we weren't treated the same. Disgusting service and this how you treat customers when your are not of the color that they represent ? I saw people walking after us and being seated even without a reservations and of the opposite color being seated. I spoke to a "manger" who clearly wasn't the manager, which we discovered later on.No more business from my side towards the restaurant because I don't appreciate such treatment and silent poison of racism.
author: Ishpreet R.

description: I came here with my boyfriend for his birthday celebration. We had such a great time. The octopus stuffed with feta cheese was delicious and the olive oil accommodated the octopus very well. The pork sausage (special of that day, not on the menu) was filled with lots of herbs. The lamb chops cooked just right. Good ending with the rice pudding and apricot. I didn't know that apricot would go well with rice pudding. Lastly the long island ice tea was very smooth.
author: Pim N.

description: The service and food was very good. I don't know if 've ever had better lamb chops! Our server knew the food and wine menu inside and out, and really made the experience special. My critique would be the ambiance and the slight hectic feeling in general.
author: Louise S.

description:
Kokkari is one of my favorite restaurants in the city! The space almost feels like an intimate dining room in a fancy hotel that is classy and romantic, but also cozy and inviting. The restaurant has a rustic chic type of warmth with wooden accents, plush oriental rugs, and a wood-oven fireplace. The beautiful interior is really only the icing on the cake though because the delicious Greek fare is the real treat!

I've had the fried zuchinni cakes, which are perfection with the pickled cucumbers and creamy tzaziki dressing (cucumber mint and yogurt). I love the contrasting textures and hot and cold combination. I've also had the persimmon salad and the grilled calamari stuffed with feta, olives, and fennel, which was quite good and definitely packed a punch with the intense flavor from the olives. There were so many appetizers that sounded yummy. I'll be back to try crispy duck ravioli, lamb riblets, and fried smelts! I had the goat stew for my entree, which was amazing! I wasn't sure what to expect with goat meat, but it was so tender and flavorful and the orzo was a nice complement. The portion was also generous and is enough to split between two people. 

The Kataifi Ekmek is a must-get dessert with a uniquely textured shredded phylloh dough, honey, custard, and whipped cream. It was SO good. We thought the desserts would be tiny, so we ordered rice pudding as a backup, but both portions were huge! I actually had to take some home...and if you know me that never happens! 

The service here is really quite excellent. The food comes out at a good pace and the servers are knowledgable about the menu and happy to give suggestions. I also rarely find servers that are not only attentive and friendly, but respectful with how they both approach you and clear your dishes. They even offered to keep our dishes warm for us when one of us left the table, which earned them big brownie points!

Lately, I've had a string of bad luck with "fine-dining" restaurants disappointing me. When I go to a nice restaurant, I expect excellent service, delicious food and drinks, a killer dessert menu, and a pleasant ambiance. I don't think it's too much to ask for. Kokkari nailed it and I can't wait to come back!
author: Deanna Y.

description: Absolutely fantastic! Our waitress said she was new but we would never had known if she hadn't told us....vey knowledgeable, made great recommendations and spaced out our meal perfectly. My husband and I had the lamb meatballs and the artichoke/eggplant skewers - both were delicious. For our entree we shared the grilled lamb chops - which were absolutely amazing. To top off our meal we indulged in the Kokkari sundae for dessert which was gigantic and very yummy. Such a wonderful experience and can't wait to come back!
author: Kelley H.

description: Good Greek place in San Francisco. Very good lamb riblets and grilled calamari. A little high end but not too bad. Nice atmosphere too. It's kinda trendy, so there might be a wait.
author: Peter K.

description: Classic fine dining ambience with rustic touches and very friendly staff. A full bar to start, and wonderful bread. If you can, have the lamb that is roasting on the spit in the center of the front dining room. Delicious. Even better is to be seated at the table in front of the open fire. The fish is magnificent. Make sure to save room for the sundae - decadent.
author: Victor F.

description: My favorite go-to lamb chop restaurant.  Casual dining but tough to get reservations on big days.  Superior customer service paired with succulent dishes have me wanting more every time I go.  Excellent menu choices as well.
author: Gab T.

description: The best Greek food ever !!! Amazing service and delicious food!! Especially lamb skewers , yummy
author: Valery M.

description:
Location: walking distance of montgomery bart, valet available, street parking available (if you drive around a bit)

Service: our server was nice but towards the end of the meal he kind of spaced out and disappeared. I saw him walking around but he kept skipping our table even though we were clearly waiting for the dessert menu. what really appalled me is that I saw the manager (I'm assuming) walk around to each table to greet everybody, but he took one glance at us (dressed nice but clearly in our young 20's) and walked right past us. things like this irritate me because it was a celebratory dinner and we were willing to go all out for the dinner. 

Food: 
-zucchini cakes: reeeeally delicious! I love the sauce that goes with it. 
-grilled sea bass: dry and even though they say they debone it, there were still so many bones
-chicken: probably not the best thing to get here (only got it since I don't like lamb or fish). the thigh/drumstick pieces were really juicy and great but the breast was so so dry it was difficult to get down. I asked for some sort of broth to maybe help me eat it, but he brought me oily salad dressing instead. 
-baklava: ice cream was good, baklava wasn't that good... BUT I took one piece home and ate it today and it was even better the next day! 

if I ever come back I'll probably just order a few of the small plates for myself since I think they're more of a star than the mains were. warning: if you don't dress nice then they will judge you. I was wearing business clothes and still wasn't enough.
author: Shelley K.

description:
As much as I want to give this five stars, it was unfortunate because I couldn't try all of the lamb dishes since I went with two pregnant ladies who refused to eat lamb. LOL!

So I was forced to try everything ELSE. The dishes were pretty good and I definitely have no complaints about the service, great people, nice ambient; very romantic.

Nothing that specifically blew me away..but one day i'll come back for the lamb dishes and that might change my review :)
author: Samantha T.

description: Kokkari, what can I say. My wife and I have been here several times. Everything from the service to the food is outstanding. We had the chance to sit near the open fire place during our last visit which made it even better. The chicken that I had was so good. The half a lemon sprinkled on the chicken... Wow! I can't wait to return!
author: Philip O.

description: One of the hardest reservation to get in SF. The Omni Hotel concierge fixed us up for 10PM on  Friday after Thanksgiving. We were thankful. The place was buzzing with late diners. Ambiance was definitely festive. Staff were attentive and nice. I went for the lamb shank , my all time fave Greek food entree. The serving was huge. Tasty, but not as good as on the Ss Ioannis. I could have taken the leftover but we were tourists.  Not so cool to do that. The appetizer octopus tentacles were a must have.  No aspro rizzi for Leo. No pacha either.
author: Rod D.

description:
Haven't been here in years, so went for dinner on Sunday night.  The service was mostly good, but the food was really a mixed bag.  We had dolmathes and tzatziki to start with.  The dolmas were just ok, nothing special.  The tzatziki was excellent, probably the best I've ever had, and both of us agreed later that it was the best part of the meal.

The entrees were a huge disappointment.  I had the halibut and it was full of large bones and way overcooked.  I'm not the type to send it back and it was edible, so I ate it.  My companion had the soggy ravioli, which tasted ok but  was certainly nothing special.  These dishes were both misses.

For dessert, we had the flourless chocolate cake.  It was super rich.  I really like flourless chocolate cake, but this one was a too rich for even my taste.  Not bad, but not good either.

We ordered a bottle of pinot and they must have stored it next to the oven.  It was way too warm, even well above room temperature.  I was going to ask the waiter to chill it, but he had just dumped half the bottle in our glasses already, so there was no point unless I wanted half too warm and the other half too cold by the time I got to it.  They have a nice wine list, they just need to educate their servers on some wine basics to keep from ruining it.

The quality here has severely dropped and they are living off their reputation with tourist business or we hit them on a bad night.  Either way, there are too many other places in town where we can spend $100 each and have a much better experience.
author: Holger B.

description:
If you like seafood this is the place to be.  Getting a reservation was a bit hard, but the service was very good.

Get the octopus and the lamb meatballs.  Very good stuff for appetizers.

Bathroom location is downstairs through an elevator, which seemed to be a strange location.
author: Louie S.

description: My favorite Restaurant in San Francisco. Very popular. Plan early if you want to go. Reservations required. Excellent food. Great ambiance. The staff is super and very knowledgeable.
author: Bryan D.

description:
Delicious food, consider the place get so crowded that you will hace to wait for your table
Impossible without a reservation
author: Enrique L.

description:
I have a confession to make---I like it dirty. There's nothing like some stimulating palate foreplay before you conquer an exotic set of moist lamb chops. Mmm. 

Yeeeep, I thoroughly appreciate the savory flavor of a good dirty martini. Not only did we have a great experience with our drinks, also with the food and service here. Due to impromptu dinner plans, my fiancé and I had to resort to bar seating. Though we didn't score a table, we were delighted by our overall dining experience at the bar. Special thank you to barkeepers, Tony and Fatah, for their warm hospitality. 

Popular restaurants can often succumb to their own success, but according to all the glowing reviews of this superb place, service and food seem to stay consistent. We actually prefer the experience we had here, compared to the one we had at its highly revered sister restaurant, Evvia, in Palo Alto. 

We ordered: 

+  Octapodaki tou Yiorgou (Grilled octopus): This one excited me, so I would definitely recommend this as an appetizer. Perfectly firm, yet oh so fork-tender, flavorful grilled octopus. The fragrant lemon, oregano, and olive oil coating on each piece of octopus made this app even more scrumptious. 

+ Goat stew (not on menu, need to ask server): I heard about the hype regarding this specialty dry stew, so I wanted to request for it. Some people have reservations about goat, but I did NOT think it was off-putting/gamey at all. Chunks of goat were savory and tender and I really liked the soft cheese in this stew. Hearty, delicious stew, BUT nothing memorable. We agreed we wouldn't order this next time. 

+ Arnisia Paidakia (Lamb chops w/ lemon oregano vinaigrette): Medium-rare cook was perfect and this aromatic dish was beautifully seasoned. Disappointed by the side of 'Kokkari potatoes' it came with. The potatoes were unappetizingly tough. 

+ Galaktoboureko (Semolina custard filo with blood orange spoon sweet and crème fraiche ice cream): This was thee climax, at least for me. Surprisingly delish, simple, egg-roll looking things. Crisp. Warm. Delectable. Even my fiancé stole a few bites and he doesn't even appreciate sweets! I wasn't feeling the blood orange zest though, so I shoved this to the side--too intensely tart for my taste. Nevertheless, this is a MUST for dessert.

+ 5 stars overall dining experience
+ 5 stars for its handsome, sizable venue and cozy, exotic ambiance 
+ 4 stars for food: Hearty meal, nothing complex or monumental  
+ Be sure to call at least 2-3 weeks in advance to secure your table reservation

Superb service was EVERYTHING here. You'll definitely feel taken care of.

We will be back when our wallets permit! ;(
author: Merica S.

description: Best Greek food since Yiayia's!  While we did not have all my family's standard fare, all the food was delicious.  We started with the grilled octopus, one of my favorites. It was wonderfully tender (they marinate) yet still had enough tooth feel to satisfy.  It was deliciously seasoned.  Avgolemno was just like my aunt's.  Not overly thickened and just the  right amount of lemon.  The romaine salad was delicious, although a dressing of  feta and kalamata olives is inherently salty and the large plate was easily a splitter.  The chops were exceptional. Tender and perfectly cooked.  Simply but nicely seasoned.  The lamb shank and orzo was really good, with a great lamby saturation to the orzo that reminded me of Yiayia's.  The final test was Galactabourdico.  While not the same sheet pan preparation as Y's (so less custard) it was crispy and delicious.  We loved the atmosphere, which is comfortable and cozy.  Service was great, with knowledgeable and friendly staff.
author: Mark S.

description: We enjoyed our visit here very much. My sister is on a gluten free diet and she ended up enjoy this place a lot. She had many, assorted gluten-free options provided by our server, who double-checked with the chef every time we ordered food. We got the lamb belly special which was unbelievably tasty. We also ordered the grilled octopus, it was a little chewy but good. The Kokkari salad was fine too, it was really fresh and light. I had a superb wood-oven roasted fish that I shared with my brother and we both liked it a lot. Despite being stuffed, I  had no option but to order a dessert (I can't live without sweets) and per our server's recommendation we got the Yiaourti me Meli (Greek yogurt with spiced dates and walnuts and honey) which was just fabulous. We had a great time and we'll be coming back soon.
author: Ed M.

description: The staff was vert friendly and helpful. They were able to help us choose apps or salads that would feed just the right amount of people. The food was wonderful. The service was amazing and the vibe in the room was just excellent. The lighting was not to bright, lots of candles to give it a cute feeling. Kokarri never lets us down, and is always more than a pleasure to go!!
author: Kylie R.

description:
No clue how the food is. We came here and they told us it would be an hour wait.Besides the very unfriendly tone of the hostess, the bar was full, so they said they would call us on the cell as soon as the table got free. Never happened.
So by the way they treat walk-ins, I guess they don't need business. I wouldn't go ever back here. Plenty of other good restaurants in town.
author: Dirk A.

description:
Best lamb chops $46. Worth it
Greeting- pretentious
Vibe- hunting lodge in Reno
Price- high
Parking- $15
BRM- 2/2/2
Service- great at bar. Ask for god
Wine- hitching post merlot $12 glass
Food
Best lamb chops $46 huge delicious better than any steakhouse chops
Table bread- good
Lamb meatballs- light and very minty
Grilled octopus very good
Zucchini fritters not good
Prawns in garlic very good
Desserts
Baklava ice cream not good not creamy 
Donuts not good 
WIGB? Yes those lamb chops!
author: Hungry K.

description:
Kokkari never disappoints. I had the goat stew, which was amazing; not the first time I've ordered it. There are many delicious choices but the goat stew is unusual enough that I'll order it as often as not.

I was disappointed to see they have dropped taramosalta from the appetizer selections. I only find it in Greek/Mediterranean restaurants and even then not all the time. It helps make a meal special and I'm sorry Kokkari has chosen to drop it. 

Nevertheless, Kokkari is always a treat. From the service to the food and beverages, it is top notch.
author: Rob P.

description: We had one of the best meals in SF. One can tell the ingredients are super fresh and of the highest quality. The balance of flavor is outstanding. For appetizers we tried octopus and stuff squids both of which we can taste the sea! Delicious. For mains we had the Roast of the Day which was Roasted Napa Lamb on spit and was falling apart tender, juicy and sweet. The serving size is generous and perfect to share family style. Will be back. Matter of fact we did and just as good.
author: G C.

description: Lamp was well seasoned and perfectly cooked. and the prawns are juicy and tasty too, totally met my expectations. Good but not like great, I won't wait for a table to eat here.
author: Joyce W.

description: All time favorite! Everything from the ambience, drinks, appetizers, food, and the service was awesome! Khalid was our server and took really good care of us. I couldn't have asked for a better night. Kokkari and his service made my gf birthday one of the best! Thank you. See you soon.
author: Khalid H.

description: In November our close friends invited us to join them for dinner at Kokkari Estiatorio.  They had been several times, but it was a first for us. What a great evening we had! The restaurant has a beautifully designed interior that makes you feel instantly welcome. Our chairs were upholstered and so comfortable. The open roasting oven was sending us tantalizing aromas. Our server Jason was excellent and knew the answer to all of our questions. We were impressed by his friendliness and professionalism. Our food was absolutely perfect in preparation and flavor. We had roasted chicken, halibut and petrale sole. We will definitely be back! Love that there was valet parking. A true treasure in San Francisco!
author: Linda W.

description: We've been going to this restaurant for years. We don't live in SF anymore but each time we visit, we make sure to make a reservation here. This time we went for the grilled branzino which was at market price for $46. It's a whole fish which they de-bone and serve with some greens. I honestly thought for the price this was a mediocre dish. Also the fact that it was at room temperature not hot made it worse. Everything else we ordered was fine. I hope that next time we come back to town and go to Kokkari, it will be as good as I remember for years and years.
author: Pooneh R.

description:
Overall: great food, slow service.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while, and, happily, we were able to snag reservations for my birthday (made them ~1.5 weeks in advance). When we arrived (at 8 pm on a Tuesday), it was pretty crowded, and remained so the whole night (was still popping when we left after 10).

Our waiter was very nice, though I was slightly annoyed that we had to ask him about the specials (rather than him volunteering that info), when I heard him explain them to other tables unprompted. And there was a fairly long wait between dishes. Overall, though, a delicious birthday dinner! We ate...

Saghanaki (pan fried cheese) - The lemon juice balanced the fat perfectly; great crunch from the pan frying, but gooey in the middle. I tried it with their pita, but I think it shines best by itself. 

Oktapodaki tou Yiorguo (grilled octopus) - Fantastic; so soft and not a bit chewy. I was hoping for a little more crunch from the grilling, but overall it was great. The micro-greens paired perfectly.

Arnisia Paidakia (grilled lamb chops with "Kokkari potatoes") - Very yummy; I was lickibg my fingers (...and the lamb bones...). The "Kokkari potatoes" turned out to be fairly unremarkable potato wedges - fine, though slightly on the dry side.

Pagoto Baklava (Baklava ice cream) + side of hot fudge: Noth quite yummy and satisfying! Our waiter was a bit surprised at my request for fudge, but I was not about to have an entire birthday go by without eating chocolate, so that was non-negotiable. They were super generous with it, though - it came in a little gravy boat, and tasted great with the ice cream (...and alone )

Galaktoboureko (basically an egg roll filled with semolina custard; served with a scoop of pistachio ice cream and some quince paste): Quite good, but I think the ice cream was better.
author: Liz F.

description: The service was very poor. He spilled our bottle of red wine into the lamb meatballs and all over the table. He put some napkins over it and moved on. One of our entrees was wrong, and by the time they got the new one out the rest of us were done. The octopus appetizer was good- the rest of all of it was mediocre at best. A manager never came by to apologize for the red wine spill or the wrong entree order. They didn't offer to buy us desert, a glass of wine or take care of their many mistakes in any way. At the  end of the night when we were in the front of the restaurant putting on our coats a manager asked us to "move out of the way" for a seemingly more important guest. He was arrogant and rude! I would never go back and I'm very disappointed in the entire experience of Kokkari- which is the restaurant of our week long trip that we were the most excited about.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Updated review: after a 7-year hiatus, motivated by that nasty case of food poisoning, I decided to try Kokkari again. We had the chicken and the halibut, as well as some appetizers I won't try to spell. (Spanokopita? Hm. You know what I'm talking about.)

Service, food, cocktails -- all superb. Go.
author: Todd D.

description:
My date was able to make a same day dinner reservation on a weekday and I was excited to finally check out Kokkari. It was only 6pm when we arrived and the restaurant was almost full.

We ordered Kolokithokeftethes (zucchini cakes) as a starter, Arnisia Paidakia (grilled lamb chops) for my entree, and lamb rotisserie special for his entree.

We were so hungry waiting for our food that we munched on the free bread. The zucchini cakes were very delicious but they were tiny for $11.75.

I really enjoyed the lamb chops and they were cooked to perfection. I know that my date had food envy because my entree was much better than his. The lamb rotisserie had too much meat and not enough veggies to balance the meal.

For dessert, we shared an order of baklava. The ice cream was excellent and as expected, the baklava was way too sweet for my taste. We ended up leaving behind half of the dessert.

Overall, I liked the food but the prices are about 20% higher than they should be.
author: Yi Z.

description:
We had a late night reservation and took a shot based on the reviews of our Yelp friends. We had an overall good time and would recommend for all (especially greek food lovers).

The feta app was great. The soup was good as well. My wife had a plate with fish and it was 10/10. I took a chance on Mousakka and enjoyed it pretty well (never had it before). 

So for two yelpers from TN on a visit I would say add it into your meal plans if you head to SF.
author: Jared M.

description: Excellent ambiance, service and food. Would definitely recommend.  I ordered the zucchini cakes, lentils soup and lamb ribs and loved all three.  For dinner we ordered the lamb chops and the halibut.  Would definitely return.
author: Sahar A.

description:
Being one of the only fancy Greek restaurants in fidi - this place is always booked full. The only other way to dine here without a reservation is to scope out a spot at the bar or get a really late reservation. 

Is it worth the 1.5 - 2 hour wait for bar seating? Maybe not but if you can get a reservation - it's a great spot to check out for Greek. 

The decor is beautiful - nicely adorn with wood accents, gorgeous center fireplace (where they roast the meat specials), classy furniture, chairs, table tops, and nice bar setup. The restaurant isn't that big - small to mid-sized - the crowd tends to be older.

The bartender was personable and recommended a great sweet reisling. I scoped the place out for a business dinner and the hostess/host were super helpful in doing their best to try and secure me bar seats as I didn't have a reservation.

The menu had a good selection of appetizers, main entrees, and a number of specials. We tried the appetizers - skordallia and a cheese dip which were both delicious. The octopus app was ok - a bit too charred/smokey tasting for my liking. The grilled lamb riblets were amazing though - tender/ flavorful , a must try.

Main entrees - my boss got the lamb special that they were roasting on the fireplace and I got the grilled fish. Both were delicious - the fish cooked and seasoned perfectly. The lamb special was amazing - super tender. 

For dessert - we got the greek yogurt drizzled with walnuts and honey - out this world - the yogurt was definitely fresh and made in house - the light sweetness of the dates/walnuts/honey paired super well with it. The Galaktoboureko - custard in filo dough with ice cream - delicious as well. The dessert was the standout in my opinion. 

Great option for fancy greek but make a reservation. You don't want to be stuck waiting over an hour at the bar.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Cozy, rustic, wooden interior; greek food, wood oven, lamb chops; superb service, suit & ties, extensive wine selection. You mix all of these together and what do you get? Kokkari. 

Came here on Easter Sunday night to celebrate my Dad's birthday and we all had an amazing time. I reserved our table one month in advance and we arrived 20 mins early to our reservation, they were able to accommodate us and sat us down right when we walked in! The atmosphere is classy and elegant. Our server was very well-mannered and explained to us the popular items on the menu, the specials of the day, and gave us the time to decide on what we would want to order. 

For appetizer, we got the recommended grill octopus, fried zucchini cakes, and the fried smelts. The fried zucchini cakes were soo delicious! It was rich and creamy, a hint of cheese, and the side of cool tzatziki sauce was the perfect sauce to balance out the heavy flavors. The fried smelts were good but I would skip this next time. The side lemon garlic hummus was great though. Last but not least, the grill octopus!! Sooo good. Big meaty chunks of octopus grilled to perfection, a little lemon juice on top, it was perfect. We all enjoyed this dish a lot. 

For entrees, we got their lamb chops at medium rare, rotisserie special of the day - roasted goat from napa, and the braised lamb shank. The lamb chops, wow, seriously super delicious. They were so soft, so succulent, so juice, so perfectly seasoned and the side of lemon was excellent to balance out the fattiness and also bring out the flavor. After I sliced the meat out from the bones, I went for it with my hands and ate every little edible piece off the bones. My sis's roasted napa goat was phenomenal as well! The goat had a bolder taste than our lamb chops and the seasoning was also more dense in flavor. My sister enjoyed it a lot. My dad's lamb shank was very tender and the meat was pretty much falling off the bones. Very good. We also thought the yukon potatoes were also very sweet and tender, delicious. 

When our waiter came around to check in on us, I told him that it was my Dad's birthday. He knew exactly what to do and asked for my dad's name and what I want to order as the dessert. He proceeded to come back with ice cream on a bed of dulce de leche with a lighted candle and happy birthday words. The presentation of the dish was beautiful! I think my Dad was smiling all the way to his ears. We all sang our birthdays softly and dug right in. The ice cream was very creamy, smooth, and the dulce de leche was sweet. Maybe a tad bit too sweet for me but I was never really a sweet tooth person. 

After a month of preparation (of my wallet), finally I find myself to the big bill that came at the end of our meal ($270 w/ tips). I think for everything Kokkari has to offer, the price is right and well worth it. It was a wonderful dining experience. My family was still talking about it the week after our Kokkari meal.
author: Hoyan L.

description:
There are already 4000 reviews of this place. I am not going to add much. 

Simply put, some of the best lamb chops, lamb souvlaki, octopus, and homemade pita bread in the city, maybe even the country, maybe even the planet. Pricey but worth it.
author: Sai S.

description:
This was my second time.. Went there on Saturday night.. we couldn't find a seat so we sat on the bar.. the atmosphere and service was good but food not really. 

I was a bit disappointed, I got the same chicken dish I got last time (about a year ago)but wasn't good or warm enough and I actually got sick afterwards. Not sure if quality or chef changed.
author: Ibrahim S.

description: Great ambience and pretty good food. A little overpriced for what it is ($30 for skewers??) but you're paying for the decor and service. Would be a good place for a business lunch, or if you're trying to impress on a date.
author: Alicia H.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place because I love Greek food! My fiancé at the time, which happens to be my husband now surprised me with a text telling me he made reservations to Kokkari! I asked what the occasion was and he said it's because I always wanted to try it and it was our wedding week! I was so excited!! 

When we sat down, we were greeted by our wonderful waitress who gave us a few suggestions on what to order.. She was so patient with us. 

For a party of two, we ordered a ton of food! We are big eaters!!

As for appetizers, we tried a few things.. 

Grilled Calamari- it was new to us because we're used to eating fried calamari. This was actually more delicious than any friend ones I've tried. I felt this was more healthier and I had no problem eating it all! It was nice and tender and I love the taste of grilled foods!

Spanakotiropita-Who could hate spinach and cheese in a nice flaky filo crust!! Yum! 

Baked Cheese! OMG!!! I love this stuff!! They give you free bread! Get the cheese and eat it with the bread! So good!! I love the ooey gooeyness! Heaven in my mouth!! 

Taramasalata- It's basically a fish roe cod dip which they serve with pita bread! SO good!!

As for our meals...

Lemon and oregano roasted chicken served with roasted potatoes. The chicken was not dry, it was actually very moist! I love the taste of fresh herbs!!

Lemon and oregano lamb chops served with potatoes. My husband actually ordered this dish and I ended up eating it all! So good!! 

Dessert- 

My husband wanted to try this ice cream, which the waitress recommended. This one I was not able to try because it had some type of nut and I am allergic. When the waitress saw I want having any, I told her I was allergic so she brought me a chocolate ice cream!!

Love the service! Love the food! Love coming here!!
author: Darlene M.

description:
+Yelp Pro-tip...Kokkari for lunch = $$$deal, dinner is probably about twice the price $_$ so why spend more money when you can get it for half off (sort of)

There are a lot of things I enjoy here for lunch:
-greek salad
-oven roasted prawns
-meatballs
-whole fish (to share with a group)
-chicken souvlaki

I highly suggest you go with at least one other person so you can share a few different dishes :D

++Yelp Pro-tip...this place is one of those places where reservations are HIGHLY encouraged... but if you ever decide to eat here on a whim for lunch, you will usually be able to find a spot at the bar and Tony/Chris (the best bartenders) will take care of you.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
A yelp buddy recommended Kokkari, citing it as a hot restaurant in SF.

Hard to find a flaw with Kokkari!

Off the bat, you notice the customer service from the staff.  Lydia was stellar!  Always approaching with a smile...!

We started off with a couple of apps: grilled stuffed calamari & prawns.  Thank you, Lydia for the recommendation on the calamari!  We loved both apps!  

The calamari was fresh & tender--not tough/chewy.  Good grilled flavor adds a nice touch.  Cap it off by stuffing with cheese!  Yummers!

The prawns were basking in garlicky butter.  Garlic & butter--one of my favorite & popular combinations!  Deshell the prawn and swish it around the garlic butter for extra sauciness before engulfing in your mouth!  Good eats!

I had a tough time choosing the entree--everything in the Yelp pics looked soo good!  In the mood for lamb, I chose their Moussaka.  Great decision!  This dish delivered rich flavor yet wasn't gamey tasting from the lamb.  I could definitely order this again!

Not a must-try for tourists simply because SF is not identified with mediterranean cuisine, but Kokkari won't disappoint you!
author: Mark H.

description:
Was lucky to visit this great little gem with friends over the weekend . 
It wa  birthday celebration and the meal was perfect
author: charlene s.

description:
Kokkari has been on my Yelp bookmark list for as long as I have had a Yelp account. Finally, I decided to make the reservation after my white coat ceremony to celebrate with my parents. Kokkari provides you fine dining with excellent service at a price that for San Francisco standard's is not too bad. To go down the list of food:
***Kolokithokeftethes: a zucchini latke, maybe I'll make them for Hannukah next year
***Marithes Tiganites: my father was obsessed with these and said they reminded him of his childhood on the Black Sea and he has never seen them in the states since we moved here two decades ago
***Arnisia Plevrakia: well seasoned bite size lamb pieces
***Avgolemono: tangy tasting soup - if you are a soup fan, I say give it a try
***Arnisia Paidakia: this is the hallmark dish of Kokkari. Now, for some backstory, my mother cooks excellent lamb chops. Therefore, these chops were good, just as good, but not super out of the ordinary for me. However, if you do not eat lamb chops often or did not grow up eating them, then I am sure you will love them. This is the best lamb chops I have had outside of my mother's kitchen. 
***a goat goulash special that day (not on the standard menu): full of flavor and delicious
Overall the savory dishes were delicious, felt homemade, and were accompanied with excellent service. However the dessert, I was honestly not as big of a fan of:
***Galaktoboureko: nice pistachio ice cream, but kinda bland custard
***Loukoumades: this is probably the type of dish you love if you ate it growing up, but otherwise, it is just a regular sweet donut

This also seems like a great place for a formal dinner party.
author: Nikita K.

description: The food are unpretentious and overall tasty. The service was excellent and the ambiance in the room was just perfect.
author: Selah H.

description: San Francisco has more restaurants that it knows to do with, but Kokkari is easily one that can hold its own in a city that can make any food lover pass out.   Awesome food and outstanding service!
author: M M.

description:
First time to kokari celebrating 5 year anniversary ---- amazing experience . Everything was superb from the food to the wait staff. Definitely would go back. Try the calamari and ask for duck dolmas from the small plates. 
The portions from the main dishes are ample so you definitely  get your money's worth w quality and quantity . 

The bill was 200$ (w tip included). This includes 3 small dishes, 2 mains , and 4 drinks total. Bread( which may I add is fresh baked and amazing ) was complimentary. But it alone was so delish w the olive oil that it could have been an appetizer. 

Thanks kokari-- cheers.
author: Ewa U.

description: Vanessa is the best! And Doug too! Came here the other night for an impromptu dinner at 9:30 pm and they seated us right away and we had an incredible dinner.  For appetizers we ordered the delicious grilled octopus and vegetable platter and salad with fresh peaches and feta cheese (in season and so delicious)!  They finished the meal off with flourless chocolate cake - they heard it was my bday month (August) so put a sweet happy bday message and a candle. Very thoughtful and memorable.  Most of all, Vanessa took the best care of us!! She was so cheerful and knowledgeable about the wines and every dish.  Just a delight!!  No wonder this place has such rave reviews and it is always popular- consistency, incredible food and exceptional service. Next time I won't wait so long to come back!! :)
author: Namita D.

description:
The husband and I were chasing Pokemon in our sweats nearby the restaurant a couple of weekends ago. We decided give this place a shot, especially since we did not have reservations. We were welcomed by their hostess who explained they were booked for the night, however we were welcome to check out the bar for seats and a full menu. 

While the food we ordered was decent (gilled octopus, roasted potatoes, and a couple glasses of wine), we were more impressed with the service and the ambiance. 

We would come back again if we were in the area and had reservations.
author: Tracy C.

description:
FOOD: Great
Spanakopitorpita- good, not amazing
Zucchini Cakes- really good
Grilled Calamari- super unique and flavorful. This is not your typical calamari at all. It's stuffed with a feta and has olives and orange and fennel...but really great.
Greek Salad- standard and good
Mousakka- really delicious. I hate lamb and I loved it. Didn't taste gamey and gross at all. Very well seasoned and creamy.

SERVICE: Great
Waiter was fun and playful and stayed attentive throughout.

AMBIANCE: Very nice
It's actually a huge space that goes on to the back, but each section feels very warm and cozy. More of a sophisticated vibe.

PRICE: Pricier
author: Deana K.

description: My go-to restaurant every time I'm in San Francisco's. It's shocking they haven't received a Michelin Star yet. Always packed so get a reservation 3 weeks in advance!
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
While I live in SoCal this is one of my most favorite restaurant . The food is amazing , service is great and environment is so intimate and lovely !
For appetizer I had Kolokithokeftethes recommended by our lovely waiter . Keep in mind I don't like zucchini that much but I just loved this perfect appetizer , how great it was ! Then I ordered today's rotisserie , to be honest didn't think how well they can cook the lamb . It was just amazing with Pinot noir . Baked potatoes which was my main course side was the best baked potato I've had .
In the end I ordered pomegranate sorbet which it was good but not the best one .

Finally I really recommend this fabulous restaurant to everyone who has opportunity to be there . I just would like to appreciate to our friendly Greek waiter that I forget his nam but he made our night !
author: Hooman I.

description: Came here for my boyfriends birthday and it was so yummy! Will definitely be coming back!
author: Alexis G.

description:
I brought clients here for a big weekday lunch and it could not have been better! This is one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at in the SF area (which to be fair, is not many, but they were all carefully selected). 

The restaurant itself is rustically beautiful. We were seated at a large family-style table right in front of the partially open kitchen. 

Service was top-notch. Our server was incredibly friendly and really made our experience better. With a party of seven you assume something will come from the kitchen wrong but not a single thing did. He effortlessly managed our entire experience like a pro. 

We tried the following:
APPETIZERS:
- Dolmathes - grape leaves stuffed with rice, dill & mint ($9.25): very lightly stuffed, which actually allowed for better flavor. The grape leaves were so tender. 
- Zucchini Cakes - with cucumber & mint yogurt dressing ($12.00): fantastic. Absolutely delicious. 
- Saghanaki - pan fried Kefalograviera with lemon & oregano ($16.00): this is basically a fried cheese topped with herbs and a squeeze of fresh lemon. It's bright and summery. Recommended! 
- Grilled Octopus - with lemon, oregano & olive oil ($17.25): yes to this one! So good, and beautifully plated. 
- Tzatziki, Favosalata or Tirokafteri with housemade grilled pita ($10.00 each): we selected these three of the five options available and they came on a platter with pita, stuffed grape leaves, fresh cucumber slices as a crudite, and pickled vegetables. The pita was so very light; apparently it is cooked with Greek yogurt for fluffiness and tastiness. The whole table enjoyed all the dips. 

ENTREES:
- Greek Salad of tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, feta, oregano & olives (appetizer size is $13.50 and entrée size is $17.75): we split two of these for the table. This is not the iceberg lettuce salad you envision but a large serving of roughly chopped veggies. Really yummy!
- Whole Fish, traditionally grilled with braised greens, lemon & Cretan olive oil (market price): options the day we visited were local sole or Mediterranean sea bass AKA branzino, the sole being the smaller portioned of the two. Quite tasty!
- Lamb Souvlaki - lamb skewered with tomato, onion, bay leaf with chickpea salad, tzatziki & pita ($26): the chickpea salad was especially on point but the lamb was also very tender and cooked perfectly. Large enough for two to split, honestly! 
- Moussaka - traditional casserole of spiced lamb, eggplant, potato & yogurt béchamel ($25): while this may be a bit heavy for a lunch item, it was hands down the best thing I tried. Think of this as the ultimate comfort food! So tasty! 
- We also tried the special of the day: short ribs on a bed of housemade pasta. Honestly, this one was not noteworthy compared with the rest of the dishes - but I'd venture that is a rare miss as everything else was great. 

DESSERT:
- Rizogalo: arborio rice pudding with honey roasted pear ($10): delicious. Sipmly divine.
author: Lexi W.

description:
Kokkari had been on my bookmarks for a long while. Finally had the chance to go with some friends. 

Pros: 
-Valet Parking quick and easy but pricey
-Tzatziki is super fresh and delicious 
-Lamb was cooked perfect even though I usually hate lamb 
-Portion Sizes were decent
-Bar knows how to make great mixed drinks

Cons:
-Drink Service was a little slow
- Menu isn't very share friendly 
- Hype was built up very high 

Overall a good meal but for the price I would pick a few other places to eat instead.
author: Mike T.

description:
I had to make a reservation a month in advance to eat at 6:15 on a Tuesday, but it was worth it!

I love that the menu is varied and designed for sharing. My companion and I split 3 appetizers and an entree and walked away perfectly content. 

The food:
Saghanaki: amazing flaming cheese appetizer!! The two of us gobbled this up so quickly. 

Zucchini cakes: I don't even like zucchini but these are so delicious, a must-order. Goes so well with the yogurt sauce.

Octopus: the only thing we didn't love. Although it was highly recommended by our waiter, we didn't think this stood out or was particularly flavorful.

Souvla: the rotating rotisserie meat, which for us was lamb. So delicious! A very large portion, so I am glad we shared it.

Ambiance is nice. Would be good for a special occasion.
author: Sara M.

description:
Highly disappointed
We went to Kokkari restaurant for our anniversary with my husband. I did a reservation a week before and asked to make a note that we will celebrate anniversary. 
First: when we came exactly on time host said that we have to wait, and only after 30 minutes we got our table!!! 
Second: we weren't satisfied with food at all. The main reason why we go to restaurant is to try something that I wouldn't and couldn't cook at home. I ordered a cheese appetizer (don't remember the exact name). I was so surprised when they brought one fried piece of cheese without any sauce, spices, decorations or anything else.
Third: nobody even tried to congratulate us with our anniversary (needless to say that we didn't get any cake or discount or even some card with warm wishes)
Conclusion: terrible service, average food, and absolutely no attention to their clients.
author: Anna I.

description: This restaurant is simply outstanding in every way. Dinner in one of their private dining rooms was a wonderful experience. We all started with cocktails (many cocktails...!) and almost all the appetizers on the menu. The grilled lamb meatballs were delicious. The halibut with artichokes was beautifully presented and perfectly cooked. We then ordered one of each of the desserts on the menu because they all sounded so good and after so many cocktails and wine, no one could decide what they wanted so we had them all. It's that good! Needless to say, it was an Uber night.
author: Kochia S.

description: Best steak and desserts are delicious.  All the other dishes great to as I went with large group so we sampled off each other's dinner.
author: Lisa N.

description:
I had honestly never heard of Kokkari until my team went out to lunch today. As someone who is pretty lactose intolerant 10/10 would return if I am feeling like a meal splurge as the entrees themselves cost around $20-$30 for lunch. We ordered the following dishes as starters:

Baked Feta - I am lactose intolerant but everyone else enjoyed it thoroughly.
Dolmathes - 5/5
Zucchini Cakes - 5/5 (I never thought that I could like zucchini more than I already did but Kokkari managed to change that)
Roasted Squash - 4/5 Screamed fall. It tasted wonderful but compared to the other starters it was somewhat underwhelming.

I ended up splitting 2 entrees with a coworker.

Chicken Souvlaki - 5/5 (The chicken and peppers had a really nice char to them. The side salad had a wonderful vinaigrette dressing)
Octopus Salad - 5/5 (Disclaimer: I am NOT a fan of salad. I have not been converted into loving salad overall but I would definitely eat this salad over and over again)

Overall, this gets a 5/5 for me despite the cost which is expected in the Financial District. I wish I took pictures of the food because it was also aesthetically pleasing in addition to being tasty. Definitely would recommend it to people coming to SF.
author: Christina N.

description:
4.5 stars

Arrived on a sat evening around 6 pm hoping for bar seating. Lucky us! A couple was just finishing up and leaving. We quickly snagged these seats and had a nice view of the fire pit. 

Started with a nice strong vodka soda with lime and grilled artichoke and eggplant on skewer. The veggies came with some yogurt and was delicious. For the main course my bf and I split the whole grilled fish. They had 3 different types of fish that day. The fish was absolutely delicious. It was very simple but the garlic and lemon flavors really complemented the fish. You can request they they debone it. The fish arrives in its entirety with head and all. I was phased at all coming from a Chinese family :) 

We weren't that hungry so sharing the fish worked out but it could easily be one serving. Had a great time and we didn't feel rushed at all. Would love to come back and try some of their heavier meat options. Expect to spend close to $100 per person for a few drinks, appetizer and entree.
author: Yin H.

description: This is a fantastic Greek restaurant. My wife and I had been missing Greece after a trip there over the summer so we got a little bit of everything. My wife is vegetarian and there were tons of options. The wine was fantastic and the service impeccable. One of the best restaurants we found in SF after leaving NYC.
author: V S.

description: Beautiful and quiet environment. I loved the blaklaba and the ice cream. Will come back, the employees were so nice got me everything I needed. Food was great
author: Jane B.

description:
I don't know where to start... My girlfriend and I came here on Saturday to celebrate our anniversary and this place turned out to be the perfect spot! Immediately upon entering, we were greeted by the friendly staff and seated at our table which was right next to the giant bread table/roasting fire (it was a little hot at first, but then it cooled down).

Appetizers:
Spanakotiropita - delicious pies that were warm and well balanced with feta and spinach. Best I have had.
Zucchini Cakes - pretty good with the yogurt!

Entrees:
Pork Shoulder Special - roasted for 48 hours. So tender and moist... amazing! The olive oil/salt dressing on the side was excellent. I really liked how they served a lot of meat and topped it with a few pieces of chicharrón which was delicious too!
Sea Bream Special - very good! This was roasted as well. It was a little on the firmer side and not as flaky compared to sea bass and halibut, but it was still very soft. It did have more of a ocean/fish flavor, but that just added to the fresh taste. The fish was huge!

Dessert:
Bird's nest (made from wheat shavings) topped with homemade dulce de leche ice cream and caramel. It wasn't too sweet and the crunchiness from the nest made it a nice end to our meal. Coffee was good too!

The ambiance is very warm and personal with floor lamps and large cushioned chairs adding an elegant feel. The service was great and our waiter really took the time to explain everything and answer our questions. At first we thought the place was small, but after walking back to the restrooms (which are in the basement) we saw how big it really was. The front part of the restaurant seemed more formal than the back. If you come on the earlier side you may get lucky and find street parking (it's worth looking) if not they have valet. Definitely make reservations.
author: Josh L.

description: One of the most memorable experiences I've ever had. From the moment we pulled up to the restaurant, I felt completely taken care of. The staff were all warm, attentive, and also knew when to back off and let me enjoy sitting and talking with my date. I've lived in the mediterranean and this is real, authentic mediterranean food. The karides are off the damn charts good, as are the fish. LOVE that both are served whole, with the heads still on - that's how it's supposed to be. Everything is just so, so good. The olive oil is like the stuff you get freshly pressed from small producers in the Turkish countryside. The olives are pure heaven. The lamb chops are so tender, with just the perfect amount of sheepy flavor. Incredible.
author: Jenny R.

description:
sigh! This place has always held a special place in my heart - it was one of the first restaurants my parents and I visited when I first moved to sf 4.5 years ago. It was a great experience then, so it seemed appropriate that when it was my last day at my first job out of college, I had my goodbye lunch here... 

We showed up right on time for our noon reservation, and it was PACKED! We were squished at the front with everyone else who were here for their rezzie. Poor supply chain management.. But we were promptly showed to our table for 2 and brought waters and menus and yummy acme bread. The restaurant is quite large, and the decor is nice. You can also see the whole animals roasting out on the fire pit. Pretty cool. 

We ordered - spanakopita, lamb riblets, flaming cheese, and lamb chops. All were good. But not amazing! It was sad.. :( Chops were definitely the best item we ordered - tender and juicy and flavorful. The cheese was not a hit with my friend - too salty, but I enjoyed it with the bread. I also need to find out what olive oil they use - it's soooo good.

They have a great wine list - by the glass and bottle and magnums. Nommmmm. And the service is quite good - they noticed my friend was chewing gum and offered a paper napkin without asking!! So observant.
author: Christina L.

description:
This place absolutely lives up to the hype. The ambiance has an old world charm. It would work well for date night or a lovely group dinner. 

The service was very good, although they didn't have the bottle of wine we initially ordered and it took a very long time for them to figure that out. Overall service was slow but since I was having a leisurely dinner NBD. Outside of that, this was a superb dining experience. 

The bread with the olive oil to start - I mean, why am I even ordering dinner? "Good olive oil" is life changing. But, we didn't stop with the bread. 

Appetizer: Kolokithokeftethes (read: "zucchini cakes")
One word, Delightful. Crispy and perfectly accompanied by the cucumber-mint yogurt sauce. 

Entree: Moussaka
This is basically a greek sheppard's pie, only better. The lamb was so perfectly perfectly seasoned and melt-in-your-mouth good. Eggplant and potato to top made for a comfort food on another level. And the beshamel... If I could swim in a pool of this beshamel with my mouth agape to catch all of its creamy goodness, I would.

Dessert: Baklava
Yeah, we went there as if we weren't stuffed enough. Go big or go home people. This was so, so good. Up there with the top 3 I've had. It doesn't get much better.

I know this place is pretty spendy but we didn't think it was terribly priced and portions sizes were generous. Perhaps being from DC we are used to $75+ dinner bills. I thought it was reasonable for what we ate and would absolutely recommend this place to anyone and everyone who asks.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Want to impress -this is the place-outstanding  wine list, friendly professional staff -Think upscale greek fusion, in a good way-exquisite decor, valet parking-a plus in HTF parking area. People wait months for reservations in a town of fab eateries, however it draws a rather "stiff" crowd, or at least on the night we happened to be there. A quiet political conversation with a group of friends would definitely cause raised eyebrows, even if your on the same side! Don't even think about taking the best behaved child- not that kind of place. I don't know how readers would feel about this-but if Im paying top dollar, and am a well behaved, politically correct and self aware adult-part of my experience should be to feel comfortable with my guests, tis the liberal anthem-correct? BTW I arrived with a group of medical professionals-
(Just to paint a better pic of our experience) 
The food is very good, but in all honesty, if you take away all the  pomp and circumstance-the actual "eats" happen to be just as good as any authentic excellent greek dinner.  Some say tomato-some say......
author: Darlene D.

description: By far the best Greek restaurant I ever been to. The food is amazing and the service is excellent! I like to eat small portions of everything.
