I want to try the lamb chops and 1 order has 3 pcs, my server said to me, I can make 1 for you, can you believe that? Is that a Service or what? Just amazing food and service. Love love this place! We will be back the next time we are in SF.
author: Kristine M.

description:
I don't usually opt for Greek/Mediterranean food, but my boyfriend received some Kokkari gift certificates from his holiday party so we decided to try this restaurant for dinner. Neither of us were familiar with Mediterranean food and had no idea what to order from the menu. Luckily, our server was super nice and made some recommendations. 
We ended up ordering grilled octopus, stuffed grilled calamari, crispy baked duck ravioli, and the goat stew. The octopus and calamari were tender and not rubbery, which is alway appreciated. The goat stew was recommended to us by our server and we thoroughly enjoyed it even though I had never tried goat meat before. The duck ravioli tasted fabulous and I completely regret not ordering more of it. I will not make this mistake next time.
The food is definitely pricey here. I don't think I would've tried Kokkari if it wasn't for the gift certificates. However, now that I know the food is delicious, I look forward to coming back some day.
author: Helen P.

description:
This is an all-time favorite for lunches and dinners, whether with colleagues or friends. The lamb chops are amazing, as are most other dishes. 

Only dish I've ever not enjoyed is the tagine but some of my friends love it. 

One of my favorite things about this place is the interior decor and layout - it's got a substantial bar that you can dine at but is often a little crowded, which is unfortunate because it would be perfect otherwise.  But the dining rooms are huge and have lots of options for seating arrangements.
author: Alexander G.

description: I've been here twice now...once for my boyfriend's birthday last year and once for a firm lunch. The food here is great quality and really flavorful. There are tons of great vegetarian options too! My coworkers raved about the lamb chops and octopus so those are a must try. I am not eating meat right now but I still found plenty of options. We got the zucchini cakes which were delicious and I got the artichoke entree which was perfectly grilled and hearty. I would love to try the ravoli next time, which I also heard is amazing. Finally, get the donuts for dessert! You won't regret it.
author: Joan S.

description: Truly exceptional. Service was impeccable, food delicious and beautifully presented, timing perfect. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. One of the best for 19 years.
author: Peter S.

description: Wow, amazing service! Like really, Wow! From the beautiful and helpful hostess all the way to the entertaining server. A buddy and I were in town for a concert and needed to be out in a timely fashion. The hostess got us squeezed in quickly(I probably owe her dinner for that) even though it seems like this is a reservations preferred kinda joint. Our server Frank was outstanding. He knew the menu and specials very well (which I highly recommend the lamb. if they have one roasting on a spit, it will change your life) and gave us the new York version of the menu so we could get our meal and get to the concert on time. The moussaka was the best I've ever had. Don't forget to finish up with a tasty Greek coffee. Biggest thing that stuck out was the friendliness and effort to accommodate our schedule by the staff despite us being out of place and woefully under-dressed.
author: Tyler D.

description: We had a wonderful meal with great service.  We started with several appetizers including calamari and garlic shrimp.  For dinner, we all had specials.  I had a seafood stew that was filled with mussels, clams, fish and shrimp in a tomato broth.  The wine selection was good.  Very nice restaurant with nice ambiance.
author: Dika M.

description:
I had a annual year end lunch from my company here 
During lunch time, it's crowded. The price is a little bit high but I didn't pay for it so it's ok.
Food is ok. However I gave them 4 stars since nothing to complain and they are in good location
author: Diem H.

description: Great restaurant, great atmosphere, good service, had octopus for an appetizer, had lamb shank for dinner, greek  beer and an ouzo for dessert,  overall top notch. You need reservations but it's worth it I will go again
author: Mike D.

description: I Love Kakari and often visit their sister restaurant in Palo Alto. The ambiance is warm and the fire place lighting makes everyone look better . The bar is perfect to meet a friend  or business contact and share appetizers and wine. I recommend the lamb shank for the main course too ; its always amazing.
author: Stables R.

description:
Most important thing to know about eating at Kokkari: make a reservation.  Having taken the aforementioned precaution, I was quite blown away by the size and classy interior of the restaurant.  Granted, I was already excited about getting lunch with three very good friends, but Kokkari definitely heightened the experience.  

Thanks to a bit of Yelp research beforehand, between the four of us girls we got the zucchini cakes, grilled lamb meatballs, and wood fired prawns for starters as well as the Tuesday special and lamb souvlaki.  Our waiter was very helpful in making suggestions as well.  Among the appetizers, I preferred the zucchini cakes: rich and almost cheesy.  The cake was offset by the freshness of the yogurt and cucumber that accompanied it.  The meatballs with sour cream in the sauce and the prawns were tasty as well.  Wasn't as much of a fan of the bread; bit too cold and tough for my taste.

As for the entrees, the souvlaki hirino was huge, a sort of greek wrap that did not lend itself to dignified eating.  Inside were pieces of pork, a portion of veggies, and a white mayonnaise like sauce.  Very filling.  The lamb was a bit tough, but the side dishes that accompanied helped with the chewiness of the meat.  

Altogether we each paid $24, so about $96 in total.  I hesitate to give the restaurant 5 stars because while the food was delicious, it was not truly mind-blowing for me.  The initial bites of every dish were amazing, but slightly greasy tastes started creeping in towards the end.  In any case, the service was fantastic, the interior design of the restaurant (complete with roasting spit on the fireplace) was a pleasure to behold, and ultimately we were all very satisfied with our dining experience.  Thanks Kokkari!
author: Emily Y.

description:
My pops has been wanting to visit Kokkari for years, and once his birthday rolled around, I knew we had to take him here, so several weeks in advance, I stayed up until midnight to make reservations the minute they were opened on his big day. Fun fact - online reservations don't seem to be available between 6:30 and 8 pm.

LOCATION.
Parking is hard to find, so you'll probably end up shelling out the $12 (!!!) for valet parking, but it will be a time saver. It's situated on a corner near the Embarcadero, so if you're seated next to a window, you're bound to see someone vastly less fortunate than yourself (I'm assuming if you're eating here you can afford to, and then some) wandering past. Definitely a humbling reminder to be grateful for what you have.

SERVICE.
The majority of my time at Kokkari was absolutely fantastic. Our waiter was witty, attentive, offered great advise on the menu, actually called dishes by their appropriate Greek names, and was genuinely engaged with us. However, once we received our entrees, it felt like we dropped off the radar of our waiter. It kind of felt like a "welp, you've most likely spent the max amount you will at this point, bye", which is not a great experience. He came by exactly two times after that - once to drop off dessert menus (and disappear for 15 minutes), then to drop off the bill (and then disappear for another 15 minutes).

THE FOOD.
We ordered the following below, as well as one of their appetizer specials I'm blanking on right now:
++ GRILLED OCTOPUS
- SAGHANAKI (far too rich & small portion-wise)
+ GRILLED LAMB CHOPS
+ ROASTED LAMB

The grilled octopus was my favorite part of the meal. I'm not a big meat & potatoes kind of gal (despite my upbringing), so I found the entrees a bit too heavy, although delicious. I foolishly ate half my plate and assumed the waiter would box up the rest when he took my plate, but nope, chucked it in the bin, so that was a bummer.

PRO TIP: 
No complimentary birthday desserts are offered here, so just keep that in mind. I didn't really come in expecting anything, but was surprised when there was nothing. I guess it's become such a common thing at both nicer and more casual restaurants, it was odd to see the opposite.

I definitely understand the hype behind Kokkari, and I had a relatively nice experience, but not enough to want to come back (especially with the bill we racked up!).
author: Claire S.

description:
We walked in for lunch. I asked for a table and they say we are booked. Not even telling us the wait time until we forced them to tell us the time. I should have not gone in this place. The reviews declared this place good but it's not.
One Terrible hostess and rude. The waiter Benjamin was very good. 
Being Of Greek herritage I have eaten all over the world at Greek Restaurant s including Taverna Tony's in Malibu CA. I wanted to check this place. The ambiance was good. The prices were average for Upscale Greek cuisine
The Food was average not even close to being great. The worst is they put garlic in traditional dishes such as taramasalata. You don't do that.
 Don't confuse middle eastern food with Greek. Greeks don't use heavy garlic That's rank!!! Finally their pita bread is too thick almost like Chicago pizza. Another dumb idea. I just don't see going back. The fish of the day was recommended and of course it was under cooked. If you want sushi I would tell them. They are poorly managed at this service grill. They are just sloppy!
author: George M.

description: Not our first time at Kokkari. Kokkari is "must"  stop when visiting San Francisco. We have never had a bad experience. The food is always absolutely amazing. Out last visit was serviced by Lydia. She was a excellent waitress. My only complaint is they don't have a signature cocktail menu. There is no way I can knock them a star though, because t service and food are excellent.
author: L P.

description: Excellent atmosphere, food, service.. Kokkari has it all. My first visit was for a weekday lunch, couldn't have been more pleased with the experience. Will definitely return. One note for the frugal, a meal here will almost certainly be pricey.
author: Matthew H.

description: Incredible restaurant! We treated like royalty and the food was excellent. I came here with a large group (10 ppl) and couldn't of asked for a better experience! Highly recommend.
author: Matt C.

description:
WOW THIS PLACE IS GREAT the shank was sooooooo good went here for a birthday and this just might be my new favorite restaurant 

Fish is incredible and the apps out of this world 

We will be back
author: Phillip J.

description: I write this review while I am awaiting my dessert after an extremely satiating, and a delicious dinner served here. The ambience, the food, the service, the server(s), ours is AnnaRose, everything about this place is top class. It's not just a place you want to go for dinner, it's the whole experience who want to go through. And not once, but multiple times. This is probably my favorite place for Greek food starting today. I would highly recommend this place for vegetarians too. Being a vegetarian, i can assure that this place has multiple options for appetizers, salads, main course and desserts too! I will come back again.
author: Puja I.

description: Second time here. I think how i felt about this place has changed a lot this time. We were led to the other side of the room which is not as warm as I was here last time, light music and overall ambience is great. We ordered beets salad, grilled asparagus and a peach salad with arugula. The last one is kind of the app of the day and I had to say this is very refreshing and never thought of this combo before. For entrees we had fish and lamb chop. No dessert but I would def come back next time to try baklava.
author: Mofy M.

description: Would give 5 stars but wife's chicken came to table cold.  Attentive dining room manager noticed her reaction and had entree heated up.  Everything else was great.
author: Darrell M.

description: A ten-minute stroll from the bustling Embarcadero, nestled on a corner of a quiet neighborhood, entering Kokkari is transporting.  I was part of a large group, and the menu was pre-set, but I cannot imagine there was anything more delicious being served than what we enjoyed.  From the beautifully plated appetizers through the Greek coffee, the dishes were superb.  The friendly and attentive servers never missed a beat; although  we ate "family style" we were each served individually, declining a dish or accepting seconds was flawlessly acknowledged.  I'll be recommending Kokkari!
author: Cheryl M.

description:
Had a really special night in this place. I was surprised by the big portion so we obviously ordered too much food. The lamb shoulder I had was amazing. It is one of the best restaurants in SF. The food was delicious and I loved my dessert.

It's a perfect place for business lunch or a special date night.
author: Tingting P.

description:
One needs to make a reservation. When we arrived we had a cocktail before being seated.  All the servers were concerned with our comfort while we waited. 

OMG! The appetizers! We hade one of each.   We came here for my birthday.  EVERYTHING! was delicious!  The cheese on the grill appetizer was delicious, the whole seasoned prawns were perfect. 

The lamb, the octopus, the spit, the desserts, the Greek Rose, the other wines, EVERYTHING was E-X-C-E-L-L-E-N-T! ! ! !   The lamb dishes were excellent.  This is a top San Francisco Restaurant and it's worth every penny!  You have to consider the location.  It is not a neighborhood gem, but it is in the heart of the Financial District and Embarcadero.  

Ben was our server.  He was perfect.    Not pushy yet he was there when you needed him.  He knows the meaning of service and quality.  ALL our servers were excellent.  We will definitely be back and bring our family and friends to enjoy a wonderful evening.
author: Emilia G.

description:
Such a disappointment. We've wanted to try this restaurant forever. We finally got a reservation and went for a special lunch for my birthday. I ordered the entree size of the greek salad. It's one my favorite dishes so I skipped the other entrees in favor of it. Well, it wasn't even edible. The vegetables tasted freezing cold and out of season, and they barely put any dressing on it. It had zero seasoning. I had to ask the waiter twice for extra oil/vinegar. He did ask if I wanted something else, but it should have been taken off the bill because I barely ate any of it. They shouldn't charge $18 for a salad unless it's going to be amazing and the vegetables are in season. 
The eggplant dip also was prepared wrong, it tasted more like a salad than a dip. My husband got the lamb, and although he said it was good, it was nothing special. For the amount we spent on a meal for two, I wouldn't recommend eating here. Only gets two stars because the grilled calamari was tasty.
author: Jane C.

description: Consistently great! Ideal place to meet with friends.  exceptional food, service and atmosphere
author: Janice T.

description:
Hands down one of the nicest restaurants in San Francisco.

Very unique decor and ambience.

Wonderful variety of food choices.

Service is top notch.
author: Sal E.

description:
A few of us were looking for a place to eat after an eventful Sunday tourist day. We found this restaurant on trip adviser, #2 restaurant to check out in san francisco. Us, not knowing how popular this place was, went on in to see if they would have a table for us. Just our luck, they had a table for an hour and 45 minutes before the next reservation came in. Perfect, we took it. 
Now we came in there with day clothes. Clothes we wore to tour the city, nothing close to the attire all the other guests wore, none the less we were treated like everyone else.
The service was absolutely remarkable. Our server was amazing and had great small conversation with us. She shared the menu and her picks and pairings. 
We decided to share a bunch of appetizers, a salad, and one entree. Everything was amazing. I highly recommend the octopus for an app, so soft and tender. 
Other than that I would recommend anyone visiting San Francisco or who lives here and yet to try it, you should definitely make this a must go to spot.
author: Savanna H.

description: Phenomenal! Amazing service and everything we had was delicious. We had the zucchini cakes and octopus for appetizers, then the lamb chops and rib eye. Some of the best Greek food I've ever had, even better than In Santorini.
author: Briana M.

description: Food was outstanding. Deliciously prepared. I definitely will be visiting whenever I'm in San Francisco.
author: Greg I.

description: If you're looking for authentic Greek food, this is the place. The food is exceptional and the wine list extensive. The service can be a bit slow (they're very busy) and the prices a bit on the high end, but it's still a great place to have a memorable meal.
author: Dean K.

description:
The greeting was great, the valet got the door. No crowd, nice smiley hostess, and our table was waiting. Not that I wouldn't have liked to have a drink at the crowded bar.

2-top, seated and greeted, bread and olive oil, the salt was waiting. Food menu, wine menu, lots of great choices.

The food rocks, the duck ravioli so good, Mongolian/Chinese/Silk Road start and then the cheese, saga, so salty, wines by the glass to really get a taste for the cuisine.

Lamb shank...what's not to love falling off the bone and the pasta with it, so toothy and tasty.

The halibut, tho toothsome, was a bit disappointing for the nasty bones. Kinda like a nasty retsina after too many good ones, sharp and less. But the flesh was tasty, the muslin wrapped lemon half a nice touch.

First room looks to be bigger wigs and limited partners, the corridor up for grabs. The froggy looking guy there gave me the creeps, and he was there quite a while. 

Biggest room has an alcove that looks quieter, otherwise it's gonna get loud. Too many hard surfaces and not enough to absorb all the chatter leads to people shouting to dining companions and takes what could be a nicer evening somewhere into the din...

Our waiter was a bit overwhelmed, never saw the doggy box...oh well, in hindsight the lamb was a bit pungent and gamy, and the next day would not have been better. Best thing happened.

Watched two different sets of diners get seated, check out menu and then leave. One woman kept cupping her ears. I know why.

Come and enjoy. Drinking helps kill the awful noise.
author: William M.

description: If you don't have a reservation and try to get a table at the supposed "first come first serve" bar forget it don't waste your time.  The whole restaurant operates under graft and corruption, no surprise just like the motherland.  Whoever pays the bartender the most gets a seat.  There is no first come -first / if you know and paid for the bartender you get a seat- even if you are 90'years old!!!!
author: Linda H.

description: This was a random find, curtesy of Yelp, one night when we were out cocktailing in the city. It was very good, a little pricey. The presentation was very good, as well as, the atmosphere and ambience. The staff was delightful. I'm giving it 4 stars because the food was not outstanding to me.
author: Krista B.

description:
Went to Kokkari and ordered take out.  The host and hostess were super friendly.  They directed me to the bar to order take out.  I ordered from the bartender who was friendly.  I ordered the octopus, artichoke skewers, moussaka and potatoes.  While I waited I ordered and old fashioned (whiskey drink) - great!

Food arrived quicker than I expected in a fancy paper carry out bag.  

Food was great - like everything was great.  

It's a little pricey for the quantity you get.  But you can't put a price on quality.  I guess I like big portions.

I recommend this place if you like authentic Mediterranean food.  They have all the good stuff.

Although I didn't dine in - the restaurant had a nice vibe.
author: Zack E.

description:
This restaurant is EVERYTHING one could hope or dream for in a dining experience. The food? PHENOMENAL. The ambiance? SO LOVELY. The price point? WORTH EVERY PENNY. The service? EXCEPTIONAL. 

Chris was our waiter and he might be the best server I have ever had and I used to be a waitress myself. His recommendations were perfect. The wine was too good to be true for only  a $50 bottle and his timing was on point. His service is something to be rewarded and imitated. The absolute best experience and I cannot wait to return! Thanks Chris!
author: Jenna S.

description:
It's all about the room. It's beautiful elegant and relaxing. Belongs more in Napa than SF. Although of necessity side by side deuces are a little
BARTish. But really overall a transporting experience. 

No complaints about the service. 

Food wise I say thumbs up and really quite enjoyable but nothing I tried blew me away. That said, the octopus is not to be missed.
author: bruce t.

description:
I really enjoyed my experience at Kokkari. It is renowned in San Francisco for delicious Greek food and exceptional service. Kokkari is not an every night kind of restaurant, but great if you are looking to celebrate something special. Be sure to make reservations in advance. 

There menu consists of all things Greek. We started off with some drinks at the bar, which we took to our table once it was ready. Instead of ordering a main plate each, we choose several of the appetizers, this way we made sure we could try a greater variety of dishes. Some of the favorites out of all the plates we tried were: Zucchini Cakes, Lamb Short Ribs, House-made Grilled Pita with Tzatziki. We also finished it off with some dessert, an amazing sundae - The Kokkari Sundae - with chocolate and vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and toasted hazelnuts. 

Overall, my experience at Kokkari was great. It certainly lived up to the hype. From the brick oven where they cook the pitas, to the open kitchen concept, you really feel like you're getting an authentic Greek experience!
author: Aletta B.

description:
They serve every part of lamb in the most delicious of ways. We came here because Zagat ranked this as the best restaurant in San Fran. Zagat was spot on! 

Out of the appetizers we had, the lamb tongue and lamb riblets were my favorite, followed closely by the lamb meatballs. The lamb tongue was a special not listed on the menu. Do not miss out if you have the opportunity!

For entrees, we had the lamb chops and moussaka. The chops were so good that I literally gnawed on the bones (my mom would be so proud). The moussaka was also very good. 

Sadly, we were too stuffed for dessert. We will have to make another trip soon!
author: Adam S.

description:
One of the most perfect restaurants in San Francisco. Great for dates and special occasions--especially if you enjoy lamb, seafood, or Greek food in general.

Reservations can be tough to come by, but trust me that the pain is worth it. First off, the decor feels like a refined friend's home as the dark paneled wood and comfy chairs give an intimate atmosphere. Tables are close enough that you feel like you're all enjoying the fine dining together, but not so close that you can hear others' conversations. 

The food of course is the main star. Of the appetizers, I've tried the lamb meatballs and the lamb riblettes. Well seasoned, perfect portioned, and just enough to whet your appetite. From there, you move onto the main course, where I would recommend the traditional whole grilled fish or the lamb casserole. I've eyed the rotisserie of the day multiple times though, and it has also seemed a solid choice as well.

Service is dutiful, informative, and prompt. I would advise against the Ouzo sorbet, though, which was cloyingly sweet. 

All in all, a beautiful restaurant to enjoy a hearty and well-sculpted meal. Come here for a solid dining experience--none of that pretentious air of some other restaurants. Just friends and good food.
author: Irene C.

description:
ZOMG.  Still absolutely one of my favorite date-night spots.

Fried Squash Blossoms
Mini Greek and Mini Chopped Salads
Lamb Shank with Orzo
Rotisserie Pork with Potatoes

Couldn't ask for anything more.  Everything was perfection.  Big portions too.  Ended up taking half of each entree home.  FYI, its just as good day 2!  

As usual, we went without reservations, waited about an hour for a spot at the bar.  It was worth it.  Reservations highly recommended if you happen to be better at planning date-night than L-bear and I.  That being said, the service at the bar is great.  The bartenders are really sweet and make it just as special as if you had one of the coveted tables.  

P.S.  The bartenders keep track of who is next to sit at the bar.  So don't go cat-fighting over a seat, just make sure the bartenders know that you are there waiting to dine at the bar.  Politeness is ever in your favor at one of SFs hottest foodie spots.
author: Susan C.

description: I forgot how wonderful & amazing this place is.  The food is incredible, the service outstanding too bad it took 2 hours to get here because the bridge was crowded.  I would come more often
author: Paulette P.

description:
This restaurant cane highly recommended and really was exceptional, specifically the service. We made a reservation ahead of time since we would be on our honeymoon and good thing we did. The food was great Greek so we came out of our comfort zone over here. Upon knowing it was our honeymoon, our waiter immediately brought us champagne to celebrate which was so nice! We ordered the Saghanaki cheese to start, the lamb chops and sea bass for entrees, and the doughnuts for dessert. Our waiter also paired our meal with excellent wine choices and just again, was exceptional.

Everything was good except I wish my fish had come with something other than grilled greens and didn't have some bones (I was nervous eating it). Beware if you don't like seeing the entire fish because it comes head to tail! Also, I liked the doughnuts but they were really nothing special. 

This was definitely our splurge as the prices are up there for most people, especially an average couple just married.
author: Gaby T.

description: Great place that lived up to the hype. So glad I finally got to try it.
author: Rish M.

description:
This place is on point. Vancouver has a dearth of good Greek food so it was extra appreciated. 

The food is consistently solid. The service was the best we had during our visit. I wish i could recall the gentleman's name but he was a genuine, engaging and thoughtful individual. It is the type of good, feel-good service that makes you remember a restaurant. So for this it gets 5 stars.

This place is busy. And after a decent bottle of wine and the Canadian exchange rate, dinner for 2 ran to about $400pp. So for that reason I'm not sure if i would tell me friends they have to go if they're in SF. in that i mean, it's definitely not a romantic place. it is loud, crowded and incredibly busy. But at the same time $400 is not something you would just drop for no reason. Perhaps if you're going for a more casual meal and not getting the razor clams twice over just for yourself nor a bottle of wine. It would be a consistent repeat.
author: Audrey W.

description:
Been on my SF list for some time now and I finally got to try it. After seeing this on the Yelp 100, it rose up on my list to try. 

Grilled Octopus - This was just delicious! They were very tender and had a great charred flavor. My only complaint was I wanted more. I wish I got the whole octopus.

Lamp Chops - Ordered medium rare just like how I like my steaks. It came out perfect. I love the presentation of it. There's 3 chops and the meat was very tender and flavorful. I couldn't resist but pick the meat off the bones. It was served over their roasted potatoes.

Rotisserie Duck - This was their special for the night. I was debating from their duck or chicken after seeing them roasting in the fire in the back. This was their take on a Peking duck. Half the bird was served over the roasted potatoes. It was very meaty and the flavor was spot on. They really pulled this off right.

Baklava Ice Cream - Dessert... one of the most important parts of a meal. I was very excited to try this. They basically blend in baklava into the ice cream and put baklava honey over it. It came with three scoops. Great to share but I was tempted to just get my own.

Parking in this area is generally hard to find but they do offer valet parking. I came here via muni so I didn't have a problem. The restrooms are downstairs and you have to take the elevator to get there. Service was amazing. I can't wait to come back to try their other dishes and of course get more octopus.
author: Michael C.

description:
Let's get right to the point...This should have been a 4.5 star only because I wasn't overly impressed with the desserts but yelp doesn't allow me that option. (Maybe we need to write a review on them one day? Just kidding) Not bad, just not like the previous dishes we had experienced. Of course it may have been what we ordered as we went with the flourless cake.  

Ambiance and decor was perfect. Not overly pretentious just perfectly comfortable in both lighting and seating. Even if you aren't as fortunate as us in getting a window seat, you'll be pleased with their other options. There are several areas to the restaurant with rooms for larger groups so make sure to inquire about the private room as well. Bar area is cool and spacious but my guess is finding a seat is a real crap shoot. Wine is affordable and we ventured out and were referred to a wonderful bottle of greek wine. We done! 

Appetizers are yummy as we did what most people have done in ordering the baked cheese and octopus. Don't fight it just do it! You won't be sorry. 

Dinner was magnificent. Get what ever is on the rotisserie! I ended up getting the lamb chops which were good but I wish I had gotten what my friend ordered in the rotisserie (lamb) because it was much more flavorful. But here's the real kicker. My wife got the fish (deboned) which was absolutely amazing!!! This is a must. It's flavorful, tender but not overly buttery or fishy. I'm so glad she couldn't finish it all so I could enjoy the remaining bites. 

I even enjoyed the location where I felt safe and enjoyed a little walk with the fam afterwards to work off some of the meal. 

Bon appetite!
author: Martin C.

description:
A longtime favorite of my husband and me, Kokkari disappointed us last night. We dined with old friend we hadn't see in a while. Our Server's disapproving look and manner was a downer throughout the evening.
Strike 1 - we wanted to talk a while before turning to the menu.
Strike 2 - a couple of people in our group of 6 weren't drinkers.
Strike 3 - we don't consume in excess: no appetizers for the table, started only with salads
Strike 4 - you guessed it, no desserts.

I understand the economics of the situation, but a real professional recognizes that some people order a lot and some don't. His goal in either case should be the patron's  maximum enjoyment. Right? And by the way, our own habits vary...sometimes we're in the mood to go all out. When that comes around again, perhaps we'll pass on Kokkari.

Also- my favorite dish, the lamb chops, was over-cooked.
author: R. P.

description:
Faultless top notch service from maitre'd to bar to waiter to bussers. beautiful stunning restaurant. 
Great cocktails. Beautifully played and presented food. Just not for my palate I guess. I'm glad I finally tried this place though. 
I do find it odd that they offer bread but you have to ask for olive oil and butter. I shouldn't have to ask at this level of restaurant. It's pretty basic imho.
author: N B.

description:
Kokkari was the very first upscale restaurant I went to with a few of my college friends after I graduated from university l. I remember sitting at the bar, admiring the decor and being blown away by the food.

8 years later, I was back for my boyfriend's birthday. The decor was warm and inviting as I remembered it. The fire pit is always a nice sight to see. We had a table this time and a very welcoming manage comes around and greets and talks to everyone, making sure the service and food were top notch.

The grilled octopus was amazing. Grilled to perfection, firm and flavorful, this was my boyfriend's favorite dish of the night. We then had the Spanakotiropita, followed by the seasonal peach salad, and the grilled lamb chops. Kokkari has by far the best lamb chops period. I would not go anywhere else for this dish.
For dessert, we have the Galaktoboureko and the special, which blew my mine away. I can't quite describe except that there was a layer of pistachio on top!

Chris, our server, was excellent. He recommended a delicious bottle from Storybook. The red blend paired beautifully with our meal.
author: Aggie Z.

description:
Absolutely recommended: scallop, steak

Came here for birthday.
Surroundings: beautiful and quiet
Servers: I like how they describe their favorite dishes
Food: either so-so or outstanding
author: Dingding Sherry W.

description:
I was expecting this place to be good based off all the reviews, but I was completely blown away. This is some of the most exquisite food I have ever tasted. 
Definitely call to make a reservation. We waited about 1 1/2 hrs after they opened for dinner and by that time they only had a 9:45pm left. We're lucky we got in!
Our waiter was Abel and he was fantastic. Very knowledgeable about the food and drinks and what we should try. He convinced us to get the zucchini cakes (which is not something we normally would've picked) and I'm so glad we tried them! Excellent appetizer. 
I got the Lamb Chops for dinner. The meat was so incredibly tender and succulent, I will be dreaming about that dish for months!! My husband got the braised lamb shank which was also excellent. It was so tender that they served it with a spoon and it fell apart just poking at it.
Abel suggested the galaktoboureko for dessert, it was a kind of custard wrapped in a flaky pastry and served with cinnamon ice cream. Since we were celebrating my 30th bday, they even wrote happy birthday on the plate. 
We are so incredibly happy with our experience here. We will always come back anytime we're in San Francisco!
author: Sarah W.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Kokkari Estiatorio ever since I decided to move to San Francisco...mostly based on the amazing Yelp reviews.  Finally after living here for almost exactly a year, I got the opportunity to try it out!  

I went with a group of 4 people.  We made reservations about a month in advance.  (Although I am not sure exactly far out they fill up!)  

When you walk in the restaurant you are transported to Greece.  Okay, I have never actually been to Greece so I don't actually know what it's like...but the inside of this place is really awesome.  The first thing you notice is a huge rotisserie where there is roasting meat on a spit.   The place is crowded, filled with happy people with amazing looking food on their plates.  

The service is impeccable.  All the waitstaff is wearing shirts and ties and constantly moving to keep the 100+ diner's water glasses filled and the food coming.

With your tape water they bring out some bread and delicious Greek olive oil.  But don't fill up on that because you need to keep room for the real food!  As a group we ordered the zucchini cakes (5/5, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with an amazing yogurt mint sauce), octopus (4.5/5, very tender and flavorful, but the charred grilled flavor was a bit overwhelming), lamb tongue (4/5, very tender, mild lamb flavor).  

For the main course I ordered the lamb shank (4.5/5).  It was a large portion, very tender and a delicious mild lamb flavor.  It was served over a bed of orzo pasta with some myzithra cheese. 

The others got the goat stew special (5/5), fresh fish of the day, and lamb skewer.  Everyone really enjoyed their food.  

Overall this was an amazing experience and I will definitely be going back!
author: Paul W.

description:
3.5

It was the restaurant I could not wait to get to.  Reservation a month in advance.  Studying the menu, looking for grilled octopus and delicious Greek.

Yefsi in NYC still wins.

The atmosphere is nice. Open kitchen, I like.  Hosts were pleasant. 

Service- very annoying,  Poor.  Bordered on rude.  He (M) rushed us and kept trying to up sell EVERYTHING.  We didn't want a bunch of apps then dinner and he would not stop.  He also stuck his hand in my bread when pointing at the menu and did not excuse himself of acknowledge it.  Came and checked on the check 3 times.  He knew we didn't put a card in there.  And we didn't linger. We are not lingering people but this was too much.

Food was great.  But not amazing.  The next 2 nights in SF were much better service and food.

Bathrooms- you have to take a creepy elevator down to them.  I asked if there were stairs- no.  Yuck

So, it wasn't a bad time but I don't plan to come back.  The food didn't wow us and nobody cleaned their plate or even wanted to try dessert.  No mas, not when there is better and easier!

My rec is to skip it.
author: Mimi B.

description: High quality delicious food! Try the zucchini cakes and moussaka!  For sure in top 3 Greek/Mediterranean food I have ever had.
author: Henga H.

description: Big disappointment! I came to this place for a business lunch. The restaurant seemed to be very upscale. Most of the patrons wearing expensive suits. Very polite waiters. Appetizers were great. I ordered Lamb souvlaki (lamb cabob) as entre. I asked to have it cooked medium. When it arrived it looked cooked from outside. But when I cut it - there was pretty much raw meet inside. Unbelievable! I have been to much more modest places where you can get perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked lamb cabob for half of the price.
author: Grigory S.

description:
The Greek food here is so delicious that it's fit for the gods - Zeus, Athena, Apollo, Artemis...I bet even Ares and Hades would love it! 

The food here is really yummy - everything I've had here tastes so good. And you can tell because the restaurant is always packed and it's hard to get a reservation unless you call weeks in advance. 

This last time that I went, they had the goat stew as one of the specials. They don't have it all the time and our server said it was his favorite thing that Kokkari makes. I ordered that and it was DELICIOUS! I really liked it - the goat meat was very tender. There was also artichokes and feta cheese and underneath there was some very yummy orzo. I can see why the server likes this dish so much. I would totally order this again! 

We also ordered some appetizers, including the spanokopita, the lamb riblets, and the zucchini cakes. The lamb riblets were amazing - the meat fell right off the bone and was also really tender. I could just order like two or three orders of that by itself for a meal. The spanokopita was also really good and the zucchini cakes were the most delicious deep-fried vegetable patty things I've ever had. 

This is a fancy place - white tablecloths and servers with white button-up shirts - but it's not at all pretentious. The place is really big too - there's more seating at the back, past the kitchen. Oh, and the restrooms are downstairs and you have to take an elevator to get down there.
author: Sylvia K.

description:
I booked a birthday dinner for my girlfriend here after wanting to try out this place for awhile now. For some reason, I wasn't able to get a reservation previous attempts. Finally, on a Tuesday night we were able to get one. I really like that they have valet parking available which is convenient especially when it's hard to find parking. Right when I stepped into the restaurant, i was immediately greeted by the host. This place was a  beautiful, classy ambiance. I think it's perfect for a special occasion or dinner date even. Right when I looked at the wine list, I saw my favorite bottle of Sauvignon Blanc- Merry Edwards!! I knew I was liking this place already ;) We ordered the octopus, calamari, beets, persimmon salad, lamb chops, Sakura grilled fish, and baklava. My absolute favorites were the octopus, beets, lamb chops and Sakura grilled fish. I love baby calamari but I didn't really like the amount of feta cheese inside.. I rather have it without the cheese filling. 
Their lamb chops was probably one of the best prepared lamb chops I ever had!! I'm not even usually crazy about lamb and am quite picky about how it's prepared. If it's not prepped well and has a strong smell/taste, I can't eat it. Kokkari made it perfectly in medium rare! I definitely will be back!
author: Lenore H.

description:
This is the best Greek food I've ever had, and I studied abroad in Greece. 

Make your reservations here as soon as you book your flight and your hotel room, and be willing to be flexible - you may have to eat at 6:30 or so but don't turn down a table. You'll thank me later. 

We started with a nice selection from the small plates menu: fried zucchini, fried cheese, and a hummus platter with a decadently fluffy pita I will spend the rest of my life trying to find. Save plenty of room in your carb budget for not only the pita but also the wonderful, freshly sliced bread with fresh olive oil.  We also ordered the lamb meatballs, and I seriously could have eaten these items as my meal. 

If you're on a budget, I would still recommend giving this a try, especially if you're with other people. You can craft a nice little meal out of the small plates, get to try a lot of different flavors and order a glass of wine from the wonderful wine list. They do have a by-the-glass list, so don't let the big, beautiful, pricey list scare you away, or pick one of the lower priced bottles to share between you. 

We ordered the pork chop with potatoes, which a co-worker and I split after all the small plates (and bread) had been so filling. I was so glad I got to try one of the dishes they are most known for. Trust me, it did not disappoint. 

As you might imagine, the ambience, music, service, lighting, glassware, dishes, artwork - all of it was absolutely spot on. I loved the big square table that seated 8 of us comfortably and right in the center of it all. 

Despite my protest that I was full, some baklava appeared and I indulged in a bite or two. It was out of this world, a perfect end to one of the best meals I've ever had.
author: Julie S.

description:
Every time people ask me for a good restaurant for a special event, Kokkari is always my first answer.  

It is a beautiful restaurant with delectable charm, stellar service, a warm and inviting ambience, and food that you will talk about for years to come.  I still remember my first meal here like it was yesterday.

APPETIZERS

Arnisia Plevrakia - grilled lamb riblets with lemon & oregano
 - I wanted to slap anyone's hands that came near this.  So tender.  So juicy.  Seasoned perfectly.  So so so good!

Melitzanosalata, Taramosalata, Tzatziki, Favosalata or Tirokafteri with housemade grilled pita 
- These were wonderful on the grilled pita or on... 

Kolokithokeftethes - crispy zucchini cakes with cucumber & mint-yogurt dressing 
- Another must try.  It comes with two sizable pieces that you can cut up.  I'm drooling just thinking about it.

ENTREE

Psari Psito - traditional grilled whole fish with horta & lemon
- I've tried the bass and the fish that's similar to a snapper (I don't remember what it's called).  You can have the main bone taken out, or the fish as a whole.  Either way, it does take time to eat it, but savoring every bite is the best way to do it.  Flakey, scrumptious, and so delicate.

Kotopoulo Souvlas - lemon-oregano chicken roasted with baby leeks & Kokkari potatoes
- Very succulent and juicy.  

Arnisia Paidakia - lamb chops grilled with a lemon-oregano vinaigrette & Kokkari potatoes
- I'm not usually a lamb person.  I have very sensitive taste buds and it's usually always too gamey for me.  But every time I come here and try any lamb dish, I'm just simply in love with it.  This particular dish was just spot on.  Tender, juicy, delicious, and I didn't taste the gaminess of the lamb at all!

DESSERT

Baklava - Traditional walnut & honey baklava with vanilla-praline ice cream
- Perfect way to end a perfect meal.  Light and creamy and surprisingly not too sweet.

We've also tried a couple of their specials that I cannot pronounce or even remotely remember what the spelling was.  Either way, you just simply cannot go wrong with any of the choices.  

I must also mention the service is absolutely stellar.  Our servers have always been very attentive and have wonderful suggestions.  Our server even taught us how to say hello/goodbye/cheers in Greek (geiá sou)!  You genuinely feel like family when you dine here.  I love every moment of it.

Oh, and don't forget to snap a picture of the rack of lamb on the rotisserie in the fireplace when you first walk in :)

Random note to self: Get a bottle of Schug (pinot noir) to pair with a heavier fish and a lamb dish.  Compliments both perfectly.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I was excited about trying this place, ever since it has been on my bookmark for ages and when I heard that reservations were made,...Time to go!

Entering Kokkari, was like entering a dimly lit and intimate dining affair.  With a living room setting, extended room in the back place and a rotisserie oven on public display (that night was roasted duck), the ambiance was romantically undeceivable!

It was a lamb theme that night when ordering, indecisively.  Lamb riblets, lamb casserole and lamb chops.  Everything was lamb besides the red wine, sparkling San Pellegrino water and scrumptious dessert, Kataifi!  Their lamb riblets were commendably tender and falling off the bone!  Use the oil that's flavored with the tasty lamb riblets, as a dipping sauce with the complimentary bread!  Lamb casserole was hearty, but I think it could have been substituted with something better.  Their lamb chops passed - cooked as I wanted, medium rare and tasted nice.  I've had better spiced and flavored up lamb chops before.  Of course, red wine was ordered to compliment the tasting of lamb.

What caught me off by surprise, which was recommended well by our server who spoke Greek fluently, was their Kataifi as dessert!  It was delightfully moist and custard-like with every bite.  Topped with crushed pistachios, Kataifi ended my palate with a sweet finishing touch!

Kokkari exudes this charming aura in its atmosphere and it was a great dining experience to relieve a long working weekday in the Financial District area!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Excellent food and service!! Flawless!!

Great venue and location too!

Thank you to the staff and management team!
author: J S.

description: The traditional preparation of starters is precise and extremely flavorful. I particularly like the taramosalata and hummus, and the freshly baked pitas are perfect carriers.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Always wanted to go here but they are always booked for either lunch or dinner!  So, I finally took my friend for her Birthday celebration, and had dinner reservations @10:15pm! the Only time available on a Saturday night. :(   

Amazing food!  loved the wine and dessert.  Ambiance was superb and the service was excellent!  I highly recommend this place even if you have to eat at 10pm at night! lol...oh , and this is a great place to take your date, esp. if you want to impress them. :-) 

It was all worth the wait!  I will def come back!
author: April V.

description:
BEWARE. This restaurant has terrible service and management. 

Checked it out for its high stars and reviews, also it being very close to our hotel. Had a late reservation 9:45 for party of 2 since I wasn't sure how bad traffic will be for a Friday drive from LA. We arrived earlier than expected. By 7:30, we debated whether to keep the reservation or cancel it and go somewhere else. I decided to call them first and ask about walk-ins. Lady on the phone said check-in earlier can probably get us seated before reservation time. We got there less than 10 minutes, by 7:45.

The receptionist told us a 30-45 minutes wait. Checked after half an hour as instructed, receptionist said that next seating is at 8:30, so she needs take care of that first. Respect that, continued to wait despite that no one ever checked on us. Back again around 8:35, this time she said that she doesn't know if they can seat us early since our reservation is in an hour. What a convenient excuse. 

No way we'll wait for a table, we've decided to leave and cancel. Just right when I walked out of the door and pulled out the opentable app to cancel this reservation, I already received a cancellation email via opentable from the restaurant at 8:40. 

It is RUDE to make us wait an hour if you didn't wish to serve us in the first place. 

I can SEE that the restaurant is super small, so it's okay to tell us that you DON'T take walk-ins and we'll just leave. I've called TWO HOURS in advance and you said YES. After ONE HOUR wait INSIDE the restaurant, you informed us that walk-ins cannot be accommodated. This is NOT a new restaurant, you should probably know better your table turnover rate. 

On a Friday night, I would never expect to get seated right away at any popular spot. An hour plus wait for restaurant is reasonable and understandable without a reservation. Waiting is not the issue, but how this management handles situation like this is surprising and unacceptable, especially since the receptionist also had another employee standing next to her this whole time. 

Fine dining experience is more than just delicious food, the "experience" suggests the involvement of at least some customer service. This is not my first time dining out in SF and never had I have any seating issue before. Apparently, I'm not the only one who have experienced bad service at this place based on other reviews.
author: Ivy F.

description: Delicious!!! This place is gorgeous and so classy! Quite possibly my most favorite restaurant in SF!
author: Bridgette P.

description: Get the octopus with lamb chops and thank me later. Sooooo good! Every time I come here I want to come back. The fine dining experience and amazing menu is top notch. Best restaurant in SF.
author: Chris S.

description:
I don't even know what else to say that hasn't already been said. This place is awesome. Riveting review, ay guys?

As all the other reviews report, the service is great, the ambiance is relaxing, and the food is spot on. 

I have to give a shout out to those zucchini cakes. I have no clue what was in it but I'm all about it! Honestly I assumed they were going to be bland. Let's face it, the zucchini is not the most exciting of veggies but damn! It was scrumptious. 

I'll come back once my wallet recovers.
author: Abigail D.

description:
Basically the best Mediterranean cuisine I've ever been to. Max was a fantastic waiter. He's the kind of person you would want helping you choose anything at a restaurant, giving you his best opinion, and also catering to your specific needs.

We had the anchovy special appetizer. Had the dolmathes (amazing, a go-to for me). Shared the lamb chops (perfectly seasoned and cooked medium rare). Dessert was a berry smushed on soaked french bread-- sounds like Say Whut? tastes like Say Yes!

Service was perfect. Everyone dresses business casual, and even though we came from Maui dressing like summer, we fit in fine.

When I come back to SF, this is place is going to get another visit for sure. So many amazing things to try, and a beautiful atmosphere to boot!
author: Thu M.

description:
Zucchini Cakes - Fried really well to give them a really crunchy crust that contrasted with the soft interior. The stuffing was cheesy and gave the zucchini a richer flavor.  Yogurt dressing was refreshing and helped round out the other rich and fatty flavors. 

Saghanaki  - Delicious gooey pan fried cheese. It was salty and slightly sharp but generally pretty mild so it won't offend anyone. The crisp edges added more flavor and texture. Great on bread.

Grilled Octopus - Grilled well, but I wasn't a fan of the texture. The way they prepared it made the octopus really soft. I think the natural springy texture of octopus is fun to eat so this didn't really do it for me. I guess softening up the octopus helps prevent the tough, rubbery texture when it's overcooked, but without the springiness, I thought it was kinda boring. An easy solution to this is to just not overcook the octopus. Then they won't need to soften it.

Grilled Lamb Riblets - The lamb riblets were grilled well and had a flavorful sear. The execution was on point as the meat was tender but not to the point where it's meat mush. The meat held its structure but still slid off the bones easily. 

Goat Stew - The waiter described the stew being made with spices like nutmeg and allspice, but I didn't really taste much of that spice component. It still wasn't bad though. The goat was tender, and the cheese gave the stew more richness and aroma. The stew had enough basic seasonings like salt, but it would've been perfect if there were more of those warm spice flavors. 

Moussaka - Pretty good. I thought the stuffing of the moussaka had the warm cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice flavors that were missing in the goat stew. The creamy bechamel helped layer out the flavors of the stuffing to make them more palatable and easier to enjoy.  

Grill Lamb Chops - Spectacular. The perfect sear gave them a smoky charred crust, and they had a beautiful warm red center. The simple seasoning brought out the best in the lamb, so it didn't need any fancy spices or anything. I was doubtful about the lamb chops at first, but now I see the light. 

Good job, Kokkari.
author: Nei N.

description:
WOW. This place is delicious and super authentic! One of the few restaurants that offer Sicilian wine. The menu is also plentiful with great options. Make reservations because the wait could be kind of long. We made reservations for a 8:45pm dinner and the restaurant was still packed.

We ordered several appetizers for the table: grilled octopus, saghanaki, meatballs, dolmathes, and platters of dips with pita bread. All of it was great!!

The food took a while to arrive, but it was worth the wait. For the entree, I had the lamb shank and it was SO HUGE. Really filling and super flavorful. Others had the sea bass special, lamb riblets, and moussaka. All great! No bad dishes.

Last but not least, DESSERT!!! We ordered three desserts and shared them among the 8 of us. Baklava ice cream, Kokkari sundae, and Yiaourti Granita (yogurt sorbet). ALL DELICIOUS! Couldn't have ended dinner on a better note.

Fun fact: There are wild parrots who live in this part of the city! They're dubbed "the wild parrots of Telegraph Hill". Some of the staff know about them too, so don't be afraid to ask. There's also a documentary on the parrots and how they got there too. Keep an eye out in the trees!
author: Wing L.

description:
Chances are, you're reading through reviews to determine if it's worth jumping through hoops and donating a kidney to make a dinner reservation at Kokkari, right? Let's get to it then!

Overall, the food was very good and we really enjoyed our seafood dishes - the grilled octopus appetizer (lightly charred on the outside for texture yet still tender inside) and grilled whole fish entrees (branzini that night). Outside of the seafood, we ranked the juicy lamb chops (Arnisia Paidakia) as our next favorite item, and thought the rest of the food (including the goat stew) was tasty but not memorable.

Kudos to the reservation desk (including the manager) - I had to make some last-minute changes to our reservation and they graciously accommodated our extra guests despite the restaurant being fully booked!

It's not necessarily our server's fault, but there was a painfully long wait (~45 minutes??) between our appetizers and entrees which put a huge damper on our dining experience. Our server was friendly but we found it odd that he would constantly pour more wine into some of our guests' glasses - despite the glasses being full and the guests mentioning that they didn't want any more wine. I know it sounds snobby and nitpicky, but you kinda expect a certain level of service at a place like this, right? :)

So is dining here worth it? For our taste and dollar (~$85pp) preferences, probably not... but if you're looking for excellent, upscale Greek food in a lovely restaurant in SF, there's nothing wrong with Kokkari!
author: Steve L.

description: Best Greek restaurant that I have been at, anywhere.  Very nice setup. We went on a Tuesday night and it was busy.  The server, host and manager were all great. Food was delicious. Ordered some tapas style dishes. Try the Baklava ice cream.
author: Jayda R.

description: Kokkari used to be one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  A group of 12 went last Saturday night and we had disappointment after disappointment.  I always order the goat stew because I love it.  My stew this time was overladen with orzo pasta, very little goat meat, no artichoke... delicious but at a ridiculous price point at $36. Every entree has been jacked up in price.. a $54 steak overcooked was sent back, pork shoulder had very little meat on it..... 8:30 rez and it was like we were given left-over meat prepared by  burned out cooks.  The saving grace was that my non-call vodka neat at  $11 was a healthy pour.  Shame on you Kokkari... has your Michael Bauer rating gone to your head and your pocket???
author: Toby T.

description:
Kokkari's been on our "to try" list and even more so that it has taken the top spot on Zagat's Top 50 Restaurant list for San Francisco and that it is back on Michael Bauer's Top 100 list for 2015. Located on the edge of the financial district, street parking was not an issue. Our party of six checked in for our 6pm reservations and were promptly seated in the rear Taverna room, which has views of the large open kitchen and windows looking out to Jackson St. It had a mellower vibe than the front room, which has a vibrant bar and a large rotisserie, which had a lamb and some chickens on the spit. 

Our friendly server welcomed us and exchanged some pleasantries before describing the specials before taking our drink orders. Our group looked over the menu and we decided to go at it family style so that we could try a more of the dishes. 

Starters:
Marithes Tiganites - crispy smelts with garlic skordalia and lemon.  Nice and crispy, but wished the smelts were a little larger.

Arnisia Plevrakia - grilled lamb riblets with lemon, garlic and oregano.  Not often you see lamb riblets on a menu, but rack of lamb or lamb chops.  These were grilled perfectly and the lamb was moist and tasty.  

Grilled Sardines - a special of the day. Two sardines to the order, grilled and drizzled with olive oil and seasonings. 

Papio Manti - crispy duck ravioli with spiced brown butter and yogurt.  The ravioli were filled with a tasty duck filling that were complemented with the butter and yogurt. 

Tirokafteri - feta cheese spread with housemade grilled pita. Nice feta spread for the thick slices of grilled pita. Also came with some pickled vegetables.

Mains:
Souvla Tis Emeras - rotisserie of lamb. The dish consisted of several cuts from the lamb.  Though tender, wished it was not as well done so it would be as dry.

Psari Prito -traditional grilled whole branzino with horta and lemon. The fish is deboned before it's brought to the table.  The fish is light and fresh tasting.

Moussaka - traditional baked casserole of spiced lamb, eggplant, potato and yogurt

Goat stew (special of the day) - tender pieces of goat over a bed of orzo. Dish was full of flavor.

Desserts:
Baklava - traditional walnut-honey baklava with vanilla praline ice cream. 

Galaktoboureko - semolina custard in filo with fresh apricot sweet crème fraiche and ice cream. Wished there was more custard in the filo.  

Overall, our party had a nice dining experience, from food to service. I can see why it's taken its place on Zagat Bauer's list.  Now I'm glad that I finally get to check Kokkari off my list and claim it for my 600th.
author: Al L.

description:
After nearly 8 years of hearing how excellent Kokkari was, I finally managed to get a reservation for dinner.  My wife and I and another couple visited the restaurant on a Sunday night.  The restaurant was packed.  This wasn't surprising given how difficult it was to get a reservation.  The dining room is huge, which surprised me.  Despite the size, it looked very classy.

After a wait this long and all the stellar feedback I've heard, I was worried that my experience wouldn't live up to expectation that I've slowly built up.  (Aside:  I watched the movie, Argo, for the first time much later than most of my peers .  I heard from many of them that it was "It was the best movie they'd ever seen".  Then, I watched it, and I thought it was just OK.  Btw, Argo, like Kokkari, is a Greek word!).  In any case, Kokkari actually EXCEEDED my expectations.  The meal was fantastic!  It wasn't like the movie, Argo, at all!

For dinner, our group shared a few starters, including a corn+feta cheese special (Kalambaki), a Greek salad (Horiatiki), and a combination plate of flat bread with tzatziki, eggplant, and feta (Pikilia).  The corn dish surprised me to the upside the most - very flavorful.

For my main, I had the Lamb Chops (Arnisia Paidakia), a dish that I've heard about for years.  My wife had the Lamb Souvlaki.  It arrived on the biggest skewer I'd ever seen, which was pretty cool!  The waitress promptly slid the food from the skewer to my wife's plate so that we'd wouldn't hurt ourselves trying to deal with the bad-ass skewer for the rest of dinner.  Both lamb dishes were really great.

Beyond the actual food, I'd be remiss if I didn't mention that the service was outstanding.
author: Sebastian N.

description:
My fiance and I came here for our 11 year anniversary to try a new place and it did not disappoint! The inside is very nice, a little crowded, but not too bad. The staff was very attentive and polite. They kept our table clean. The food was delicious!! We had several dishes that were all very good. 
Out of 5 we rated them 
Saghanaki 3/5
Octapodaki Tou Yiorgou 4/5
Soutzoukakia 4/5
Arnisia Plevrakia 5/5
Moussaka 5/5 The best dish of the night!!
Sokolatina 5/5  Delicious dessert choice!

We most definitely will be coming back :)
author: Simone E.

description:
I've been wanting to come to Kokkari for quite sometime. I wanted to enjoy this place on the day of my birthday. What better way to celebrate my special day at Kokkari! It is important to make reservations because seats fill up quickly. I went on a Sunday and had reservations at 5pm and there were already a line forming at the door. 
The ambiance of the place is very classy. White table cloths, poise staff and of course good quality food. My family and I had the best seats in the house. Our waiter was very nice and gave us good recommendations some food items he enjoyed. My family and I started with the Spanakopitas, Grilled Octopus and the Lamb Tongue. You can taste the quality of the ingredients... fresh!! First time I have ever tried Lamb Tongue and it was very tender and tasted great with the complementary bread they give you. The grilled octopus was not chewy at all and seasoned very well. 
For the entrees we ordered the rotisserie chicken, rack of lamb, moussaka and the grilled branzino. ALLLL amazing. Cooked to perfection. Enjoyed every single bite. Thank goodness my family all likes to share because I wanted to try it all. Place is pretty pricy but I like to spend money on good food. 

We also ordered a few beautifully crafted dessert items which I'll post pics of. 

Thank you, Kokkari, for a beautiful and delicious dining experience.  My birthday was a success! I plan on dining with you guys again. This time I have my eye on the dry aged ribeye!
author: Maggie R.

description: For months I've been trying to get a table and when I finally got one it was such a disappointment. It's a nice restaurant and everyone is super friendly, but I just didn't like the food. My grilled fish was ok, it didn't came with a sauce or vegetables, it was a little blant . Overall Their entree was better than the main dish.
author: Sadaf S.

description: Modern flavorful Greek food with personalized service in a large Restaurant. Wife and I came here for a 5 PM Saturday evening reservation.  This is  a very large restaurant with several rooms, but the tables were set with sufficient space and overall the ambiance was cozy and pleasant.  We were seated promptly, and the waitress was very welcoming and solicitous, and clearly wanted to be helpful.  They have a full bar and a good wine list - the martini was exactly as ordered.  There were a number of specials in addition to the menu, and the waitress was very helpful in describing and making suggestions.  Wife opted to have a number of appetizers as dinner (grilled octopus with lemon- wonderful, grilled stuffed calamari- not so great, crispy smelts- delicious, grilled lamb riblets- wonderful, roasted carrots with feta cheese-delicious) and I opted for a special 3-pork appetizer (blood sausage-delicious, pork belly- wonderful, and another pork concoction also delicious), traditional egg-lemon soup (a bit sour, we did not quite like this), and the grilled lamb chops (this was wonderful and flavorful, I was trying to decide between this and the lamb shank- the waitress helpfully mentioned that the latter's major space was cinnamon, which I do not like.)  We shared a baklava (very nice) and Greek coffee (flavorful and muddy as expected) for dessert.  As should be obvious, the service was outstanding.  By the time we left, this huge restaurant was quite full and the noise level was lively, but we felt rather intimate at our table and felt we had attentive, personalized service.  We will come back.
author: Hoyle L.

description: I don't know why this place has such a high rating... it was just not my type of food. Their grilled octopus was soft but trenched in olive oil... I'm not tryna eat olive oil chef... anyways, their chicken was so so. I love chicken and couldn't bare myself to finish it. I know they are famous for their lamb but I don't like lamb so it kinda sucks they neglect to make their other dishes shine. Dessert was meh... galaktoboureko was alright.
author: Ann L.

description: Hands down the best Greek food restaurant that I have ever been to.  The zucchini cakes and the octopus was outstanding!  Can't say enough about how great this restaurant is!
author: Annie B.

description: The food is reliably good. People come back for their favorites. It's like comfort food, with impeccable old-San Francisco service. I eat here once per decade, and that's enough for me.
author: Morris R.

description: I don't need too many words to explain why this place is so wonderful. The food is stellar, the wine list is exquisite, the ambiance is rustic/chic and the staff is extremely professional. I have been here for many business lunches and look forward to it each time. From the starters to the main entree (their specials are always incredible) to my finishing latte - just the best.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
Kokkari, up until recently, was like a unicorn. Everyone talks about its magic, and people have had experiences, but I personally had not yet experienced anything except hearsay.

That all changed when I was graciously taken to a work lunch here, where I got a sampling of their appetizers, and one of the BEST lunches I've ever had when it ended with the the lamb chops. To share, we had the Baked Feta, Zucchini Cakes, Spanakotiropita, Calimari, Brussel Sprouts, and Lamb Riblets.  Out of everything, I definitely liked the Brussel Sprouts and Zucchini Cakes the best!

Let's get on to what's more important: the lamb chops.  I'm normally not a huge lamb fan; in fact I almost never order it.  When I told my fiance I was headed to Kokkari, the first thing he told me was: If you don't get the lamb chops, you'll a) be wasting your time with whatever else you get, and b) will experience the biggest FOMO of all time.  Pretty compelling argument, don't you think?  I'm so glad I took his advice, the lamb was likely one of the best things I've eaten, and for it to come at a lunch meal, completely blew me away.  While you're only given 2 chops, they are cooked to absolute perfection.  It's soft, tender, and seared perfectly on the outside. 

So, as words of advice: Get the lamb chops or go home. You will definitely not regret it.
author: Lisa I.

description: Just OK. My boyfriend is greek and we were in San Francisco to celebrate his birthday. Upon walking in with a reservation I just got the feeling that we were not welcome. Service was horrible and food was cold. There are far better places in the city to eat.
author: Kari S.

description: I first came here in 2008, have been consistently coming for lunch and dinner and it's still amazing!  The Moroccan bartender is great as well!
author: F K.

description:
Last Night our group of 4 had dinner. Was expecting an amazing food experience. The food was good, but only one very expensive appetizer dish (Octapodaki / Octopus $17.25)  was outstanding. All else we had was OK, nothing special and taking the price into account it was not nearly worth the money. Lamb chops ($46.50) good but not great. A pork rotisserie special was fair. We spent  $306.00 for the 4 of us. Not including a pre-meal bar bill of $60.00  Staff was fine, place was unbelievably busy especially based on the meal. They are making a fortune and should be a big mystery to other establishments who serve better meals at half the price. I generally do not leave negative reviews except when I am perplexed and feel like a fool being sucked into a undeserving  expensive restaurant. I am genuinely  confused by the high ratings of this place. Maybe the high prices make it more appealing to some, me, no unless the meal is outstanding. 
-
author: Andrew L.

description:
I have to say I was a little nervous that Kokkari wouldn't live up to the hype. I really didn't want to be disappointed and am so glad I wasn't.  I made my reservation about 1 month in advance and was lucky to get a good seating on a Saturday evening. 

My boyfriend and I arrived a few minutes before our reservation and were immediately greeted and checked in.  We were led through a dining room with a open fire pit and rotisserie meats cooking. The smell was mouthwatering. Our table was nice and cozy in the larger back dining room with a view into the kitchen. 

Our Server came to greet us and let us settle in with wine and dinner menus. We decided on a nice bottle of viognier suggested by our server which really paired well with the zucchini cake and grilled octopus appetizers and drank well through out the meal.

Starters: 
- Zucchini cakes w pickled cucumbers and spoonful of tazeki. The dill and cucumber flavors were so wonderful and the cakes were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Very good, but maybe not a knock your socks off dish. Very straight forward and delivers

- Grilled Octopus- Now this was definitely a highlight. Tender and well marinaded full of lemon, olive oil and butter flavor without being heavy. The slight crunch from the grill and softness of the octopus was a great texture combination. I think this was some of the best I've had. There was no sign of chewiness or toughness!

Mains:

- Sea Bass: a whole fish oven roasted with gold potatoes and red onions served with a beautiful lemon butter sauce. The fish comes deboned and filleted. Our server suggested we have this first and served us as if we were having a courses meal. I really appreciated this as up next....

- Goat Stew: a dish I would have never thought to order but the BF was keen as soon as he heard this off menu option was a young goat, not gamey or like mutton so I went along for the adventure. I'm so glad I did. A hot cast iron dish set before us and I could smell the spices immediately. A mixture of cinnamon, feta and cardamom invade your senses in the most pleasant, mouth watering way. Little snow caps of feta sprinkled atop big chunks of goat, on a bed of orzo just calling your name. I served up portions onto our plates so we could get a little bit of everything for the perfect bite. This is DEFINITELY a dish I would order again. I rarely red meat but this was so tender and didn't upset my stomach... I'm writing this review 2 days later so it's quite safe to say.

Dessert: I suggested sharing 1 but was quickly shot down so we ordered 2 Greek Coffees and 2 desserts

Coffee: something to note here- DO NOT stir your Greek coffee, you will be sorely disappointed by this rookie mistake. The grounds are so fine and sit at the bottom of your espresso sizes coffee cup. Your server will ask you how sweet you would like your coffee. BC it's such a small portion I suggest only a Demi Tass or none at all. I am also a dunker and am in full support of doing this the the small biscotti that is served with the coffee.

Rice Pudding: while I love baklava, I feel like it's a pretty standard Greek dessert so was out to try something different. I'm so glad we did. My BF's choice, this perfect rice pudding dish is served with a honey glazed grilled peach. I saw glimpses of my BF in his happy place. 

Semolina Custard- inside filo dough pastry served with frozen creme fraiche that tastes more like a tart Greek yoghurt. I loved this, while sweet, it was not too sweet like many American desserts. 

I really enjoyed these both especially since I don't get semolina too often and it's not something I would make but the rice pudding was definitely a star.

Service was excellent, our appetizers came out a bit quickly but overall Kokkari has lived up to all the great reviews and I would definitely come back.


- 2 appetizers
- 2 mains
- 2 desserts
- Greek coffees 
- 1 bottle of wine

About $260 w tax and tip
author: Audrey L.

description:
My sister and I were blown away by this place on a recent trip to San Francisco. This was by far our best food experience of our trip.  We had the lamb souvlaki and a ravioli dish with summer squash, mushrooms, cheese, and pine nuts.  The flavors of both dishes were amazing.  As another reviewer mentioned, this is food fit for the gods!  The ambience and service was classy but not pretentious.  I look forward to coming here again on my next trip to San Francisco. 
,
author: Brandy H.

description:
Really lovely across the board: atmosphere, food and service. We didn't have a reservation so we hung out at the bar until seats opened up, but they ended up seating us at a communal table (on a Friday night!) so we got lucky all around! 

We started with the chicken soup which was absolutely delicious. Next up the grilled octopus, and it was definitely the best I've had; perfect texture. We also split the Branzino simply grilled which was fantastic. We finished with coffee, rice pudding and a special banana custard dessert. Everything was amazing. The service and staff were all warm and attentive. Overall, a great experience except that we were so full we couldn't get back to our hotel fast enough to lie down! Highly recommend.
author: Maeve M.

description:
After looking for a nice restaurant in SF's financial district I came across the great reviews for Kokkari and decided to make a reservation via Local Table for myself and a friend for a Friday afternoon. When we arrived at Kokkari, we were greeted by a nice hostess and seated right away. We ordered the Grilled Octopus, Grilled Lamb Chops, and the Chicken Souvlaki - all the dishes were excellent! 

Overall great dining experience. Kind staff, wonderful ambience, and beautiful interior. We left extremely happy that we found this restaurant. The only reason I would give it 4.5 stars instead of 5 is it is a bit pricey, so will only be saved for special occasions!
author: Dana S.

description:
This is one of the best restaurants I've been in San Francisco. I am bias towards Mediterranean food, so that helps winning my high rating. 
The dishes were expertly prepared. And most importantly, if you've ever been to Greece, you should know that this is the only restaurant in SF where they serve the greek salad the same way as they do it in Greece. 
Love it! Can't wait to go there again!
author: Maria Y.

description: What can I say? It's Kokkari. It was perfect. Food and service was outstanding. I will be back as soon as I have an excuse to be in the area again.
author: Jess B.

description:
I have been wanting to go here for a few years and finally squeezed in a last minute reservation late last night! 

This place is amazing! I can't say enough good things. I have really never sat down at a nice restaurant and had Greek food, but it was great. I tried a ton of things I had never had before: Octopus, Fried little fish (forgot their name), and Goat Stew! Yes, I said goat! The stew was amazing, flavorful with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg, and the lamb we got was really well done and so great!!! I am not a fan of lamb normally (I know- so weird!) but this made me a believer that lamb can be amazing and not super "gamey". 

Our waiter was cool, calm and collected- made the beautiful, expensive restaurant not seem as intimidating, and he suggested amazing wines! Oh, the wine list here is KILLER! They have some of the best and most expensive wines. There is sure to be something for everyone. 

The restaurant is BEAUTIFUL! It is huge, with an interested bathroom set up where you take an elevator down one level. It was overall a beautiful restaurant, with fabulous unique greek foods, and great wine choices. I would definitely go back!!!
author: Ronni S.

description: I've had meals where I was completely blown away and every bite was well worth the money. This place wasn't that way. It's hard to not give 5 stars when it was great food and amazing service but I guess the expectations were just high. Very high. The food is great it's well worth a try if you have lots of $$ but if you are looking for a one time place to spend too dollar this may not be your first choice. But it was amazing and our server was great. I wasn't a huge fan of how loud it was and the chairs we had but really that's just me being picky.
author: Jason Leon D.

description:
Lamb Riblets, Goat Stew, Moussaka, Grilled Octopus. Every.Thing. 
All so great and one of my favorite restaurants in the city. So warm and inviting and never disappointing. I've dined here many times and the service and food has always been on point. I always recommend Kokkari, but make sure you make reservations ahead of time.
author: Rana K.
